story: This campaign is to raise money for three episodes of a TV series trailer about motorcycles and the people that ride them. Everyday people, reality show stars and celebrities. These videos will be used as pitch videos for Networks and will also be put on Youtube. Film crews and editors are not cheap. The money will be used to compensate the film crew, equipment and to travel to different locations. I have made contact with a well known reality show star that has agreed to be in one of the episodes. With his connections, this can really go somewhere but I have to put in a lot of work myself. I am willing to put in the work but it also takes money. Every little bit helps. Thank you in advance for your generous donation.

story:
IZM Radio is a travel/reality show featuring New York Times best-selling author and critically acclaimed documentary film maker Tariq Nasheed. The show centers around Tariq and his two female co-hosts Bree and Laila traveling around the country spotlighting uniques businesses and people in different cities.

We are raising funds to offset many of the travel and production expenses for the hosts and production crew.

The Impact

We feel it's important to bring a spotlight on businesses that usually don't get the type of publicity as other businesses in the dominant society.

Risks & Challenges

After the campaign has been completed, please be sure to give all of your correct name and mailing info so that we can quickly send your rewards to you in a timely manner. That includes unit or apartment numbers.

story:
How We Began

​     As many early career artists know, to support your passion you have to get one or many "survival jobs." I was no exception. I took the the first job that would have me, handing out coupons for a large restaurant chain in Times Square in the dead of winter. That didn't last long. But it was the catalyst for a slew of other absurd side gigs.
​     Folks in the industry always say, "write the work you want." I have always aspired to be on a comedy series like "The Office" or "Parks & Recreation." I began to think about how my side jobs would be portrayed in the same comedic layout. The material came pouring out.
​     I needed someone with expertise in writing to help harness and guide my experiences and ideas. I asked Alex Riad to jump on board as my writing partner and co-creator, and he graciously agreed.  He has a way of capturing the voice of our generation with truth and humor. I knew that together we could make this story one worth hearing.

     Our hope is that the people who see this series are brought belly laughs from the situations young artists face daily in New York City. All the while, inspiring young people to see that these sometimes daunting life experiences are equally important in forming who you become as an artist. We hope to continue to bring you content for a long time because we believe that every side job is a story worth hearing.

What We Need:

We are looking to raise the final $12,000 of our $30,000 goal. We are very lucky to have some amazing, supportive investors on our side so we could hire a top notch creative team and crew (Producer- Danny Hoffman, Director- Jessica O'Hara-Baker, DP- Jarrod Hurwitz.) The rest of the money being raised will go to props, location, paying our actors, insurance, craft services,equipment rental, and post-production.

Viewers Are Leaving TV for the web

By 2015, according to the National Association of Broadcasters, 3.8 million households cancelled their cable subscriptions in favor of buying a-la-carte streaming services. In 2017, cable lost another 1.7 million. Also, only one third of Millennials even pay for TV and they’re the biggest generation. People didn’t stop watching TV, but they switched to the web to get it. We are hoping to have our series join the many success stories sprung from original online content.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share! Share!

Thank you,
Molly Collier, Alex Riad
www.whatamidoinghereseries.com

story:
Who We Are

TMK Productions is an independent film production company striving to bring fresh ideas and undiscovered talent to the forefront of the entertainment industry.  Our award nominated short film, "Whatever We Want" was incredibly well received by the film festival circuit after a successful Indiegogo campaign and now we're ready to make something even better.

Founded by J.G. Murphy (Director/Writer/Podcast Host) and Nolan Pugh (Actor/Writer/Comedian), TMK is dedicated to producing quality entertainment that pays homage to the great filmmakers before us, while offering new and original perspectives on classic storytelling conventions.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're looking to raise $1,000 to pay for light and sound equipment, locations, and of course, compensating our cast and crew.
  • We're offering our contributors a range of perks from early access to our videos, shout outs on our show, and all the sweet sweet merchandise.
  • If we are unable to reach our goal then we plan to reduce the number of episodes and move forward with production.

Our Mission & Experience

  • The world has gotten scary and at times even unrecognizable in recent years. Our goal as filmmakers is to create something that people can use as both an escape and as proof that life can still be faced with laughter.
  • Our previous campaign was a complete success that led to our debut film, "Whatever We Want". Since then it has been accepted into three film festivals in two countries and was even nominated for Best Actor and Best Supporting Actress by Indie Short Fest.
  • Between them both, J.G. and Nolan have over thirty years of experience as artists and storytellers with dozens of credits in film, television, and live theater.

Risks & Challenges

Film making is expensive. Plain and simple. But with your help, and our drive, experience, and creativity, we have the ability to make something truly special.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Even a dollar brings us that much closer to our goal. But if you can't contribute, tell ten friends that can!

story:
Short Summary

After years of working in the industry and in the wake of the #TimesUp Movement, I realized the true lack of women's voices in the film world -- especially in creative roles. If we want this to change, we have to start from square one by creating these roles for ourselves. That's exactly what I'm trying to do with "Inconvenienced" - shoot a female-driven comedy that is completely created and supported by women (& Elie). The future starts here, so help support women by supporting causes that promote their power! As a script, "Inconvenienced" has been recognized by both the Screencraft Fellowship Competition and The Austin Film Festival. Once this short is completed, it will be used as a Proof of Concept to shoot the FULL PILOT with a full women crew!

Who Am I Giving My Money To?

I guess I have to talk about myself now. I will do so in the third person to trick myself into feeling important.

Katie Benvenuto attended the London Film School and achieved a Masters in Screenwriting like a boss. She then moved to Hollywood, Land of Dreams, and landed a dream job -- PRODUCTION ASSISTANT! Since then, she has worked her way up through the industry on such films as "Kong: Skull Island", "Pacific Rim: Uprising" and "Rampage". But, don't let these big monkey movies fool you -- "Inconvenienced" is much closer to the TV shows Katie has worked on -- "Barry" coming to HBO this March, and Alan Yang's new Amazon show to premiere later this year. Katie has worked the grind, and seen first hand the lack of diversity and gender equality in this industry. Her work as both a writer and crew member has inspired her to evoke change from the ground up. Help me (whoops, I mean HER) on this journey!

Producers:

Stephanie Espinetti is an emerging Hispanic female in the entertainment industry whose goal has always been to work with and produce content that can be universally loved and enjoyed. Her career in production ranges from working on award winning short films, feature films, commercials and television. Her mission is to bring the stories of those who are voiceless to a broader audience. 

Elie Choufany is, yes, a man who got his B.A. in Film Studies in Beirut, Lebanon in 2012, after which he received his M.A. in Screenwriting from the London Film School in 2014 in London, U.K. He worked in various departments in Film and Television as a writer, director, cinematographer and editor.  Elie wrote the sci-fi TV series 'Arabs in Space' and he recently finished writing an animated feature film 'Norm of the North 2' for Lionsgate that just went into production.

Associate Producer: Nancy Duff is a recipient of the ScreenCraft Fellowship and a past participant in The Writers Lab, created by IRIS and NYWIFT, supported by Meryl Streep and Oprah Winfrey. In 2017, the WeForShe Organization selected Nancy’s pilot script for their annual WriteHer List, which highlights female-written television scripts. The same script also appeared on the Emerging Writers Top 100 List. Nancy has been a finalist for the WIF/Black List Episodic Lab in both 2016 and 2017. Nancy’s latest feature screenplay is a 2017 Page Awards Finalist, a Top 3 Final Draft Big Break Finalist (Action/Adventure Category), and winner of the screenwriting award at the Napa Valley Film Festival. Writing across multiple genres, Nancy has placed in the top ten percent of the Universal Pictures Writers Program (2016 Semi-Finalist), Austin Film Festival and Nicholl Fellowship screenwriting contests.

Director of Photography: Carrie Scott is a Los Angeles based Cinematographer and Photographer, originally from Bozeman, Montana. Upon graduating with a dual degree in Film Production and Film Critical Studies from the University of Colorado - Boulder, Carrie took her camera and backpacked her way around the world. From working on films with award winning actors and crew, to fashion shoots with top designers, Carrie brings an adventurous spirit and keen eye to every endeavor.

Production Designer: Adrienne Garcia is a photographer turned Set Dresser known for her work on "It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia," "Baskets," "The Conjuring 2," and "Barry". 

Art Director: Laura Benvenuto is Katie's sister and being forced to do this against her will. She received her Masters in Textile Design from Philadelphia University and currently works as a designer for Title Nine Athletic Wear. So, she's legit.

Hair and Makeup: Gabrielle Rossbach has over 6 years of experience in the industry, and has worked with Golden Globe winners and various celebrities. She works with all types of makeup, from beauty to body painting to special effects.  www.gabriellemua.com

Costume Designer: Cindy Bagby is a New York based Costumer known for her work on "Boardwalk Empire", "Orange is the New Black", "The Americans", "Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt", "Inside Amy Schumer", "Mr. Robot", "Jessica Jones", "Daredevil", "Billions", and "The Night Of".

Editor: Jacqueline Basse is a New York based Editor known for her work on "She's Gotta Have It," "Rev Runs Around the World," "Killing Richard Glossip," "Impractical Jokers" and the soon to be released "Dreamland". She is also a great friend to all those Irish and dispossesed. 

Publicist: Lindsey Brooke  In 2007, Lindsey watched the entire Sex & The City series—yes, the fuchsia velvet set—cover to cover in one month. Legend has it that she may have invented the concept of binge-watching. This set contained two behind-the-scenes discs with cast and crew. A fire was lit inside her when she realized that it took a village to make the magic of film come alive, and she could be one of those villagers. So, that’s what she does now. Lindsey has worked in TV production, indie film distribution, and has a B.A. in Literature from Ramapo College of New Jersey.

Further cast and crew updates to follow!

Let's take a step in the right direction TOGETHER -- donate today and be that change we all want to see in this industry. Let's set an example for the rest of the world to follow!

What We Need & What You Get

  • In order to make this dream happen, we need to raise $5,000 to pay for our amazing female crew, our camera and lighting package, insurance, costumes, props and editorial package. I want to ensure that these hardworking people will get what they deserve!
  • Donate to collect your perk! Want an "Inconvenienced" name tag? Or an invite to the premiere in LA? Or a producer credit on this unique project? Then please contribute today and help us make this dream a reality!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, there are other ways to help:

  • Donate some goods and services -- come on down to set while we're shooting and help out our team :)
  • Send some products our way -- whether it be small water bottles or larger equipment you can donate, literally ANYTHING will help.
  • Send this link to your friends and family -- repost it on Social Media -- help get the word out for us!

story:
Who We Are And What We're Doing

Hey! We're two twin brothers from Wilmington, Delaware who just quit our accounting jobs to pursue our acting careers. This has been a dream of ours for a long time, and we're excited to get started.

This is our first project; a fictional web series based on our escapades in New York as struggling actors. The first season revolves around the twin brothers' attempts to land parts in the new Judd Apatow movie. Maintaining their New York lifestyles is difficult; hiding the truth about their careers from their family is nearly impossible. When the brothers land the call back of their dreams, they are forced to consider how much they are willing to compromise to make it big.

We are very excited about our script, and we are currently in the process of rounding out our production team. We have created this Indiegogo to raise money to finance the project.

What We Need

  • We have a goal to raise 5000 dollars for our series, or a budget of 1000 dollars per episode. This will cover the costs of the production crew, cast, props, locations, equipment, and marketing.

End Game

The goal is to wrap filming and finish editing in time for a June release. The series will be marketed to multiple festivals, online platforms, and television distributors.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word by sharing our project! Every view and every dollar is huge.

story:
Disregarding the school boards many attempts to disband them from campus, these gentlemen attempt to initiate the next generation of pledges while still holding true to the original rituals passed down to them. As the school board's AFC (AltoFrateralCouncil) thwarts to prove the boys are hazing, they brush shoulders with another few unsavory groups, these, slightly less charismatic. In one night of outlying circumstances and spontaneous characters, all told from real perspectives, this series satiates the taste for brotherhood dramedy of the finest brood. For the University of Southern Kansas' Beta Gamma Theta, this may be The Last Chapter.  

The Fraternity is comprised of 17 members. 10 Active Members and 7 Associate.

Seniors 

John. T. Rojers Jr. (President/Preacher) - the silent mafia don

Michael Balzkowski (Ballz) - Balls. Brains. Backbone.

Patrick McGreddy (Altar Boy) - From priest to pot smoker, he replaced the Bible with a bottle

Edward Arthur Low (Zen Master) - "If the river flows most fluent at night, is it still as fickle as love at first sight?"

Charles Theodore Hawthorne III (Trust Fund) - brings exactly that to the table; money and malicious intent  

Juniors:

Ewan Hammond (Prodigy) - this sprinkle of Aussie charm keeps the women around and the men at bay

Leonard Schumacher (Super Nerd) - his devotion to the fraternity cannot be mathematically deduced; not even by him

Sophomores: 

Samuel Holt (Treasurer/White Rabbit) - one man's drugs is another man's treasure

Anthony Marin (Love Slut) - falls in love more often than he changes his underwear

Jesse Mackison (Tri-Athlete) - clean body, clean mid, clean soul. Clean looking reflection as well

Freshman:

John Hardon (Hard-On) - not the Hard-On the fraternity needed, but the Hard-On the fraternity wanted

Bobby Tellman (Legacy) - Daddy is an active alumni; Mommy drives him to school

Donald Raine (Troop) - Nature. Nurture. Lover. Fighter.

Doug Mitchel (Doug) - not worth a bio

William Roberts (Cnt. Bump) - can chug a Natty Ice and wrestle down a wild boar before you can say p'tang

Thomas Gonzalez (PCB) - if Tweaky McTweakerson had a kid with Major Tom 

Taylor Kennedy (Star Boy) - a beautiful, bodacious bastard

Withstanding Member: 

George D'espciale (Oldballs George) - finally shooting his documentary thesis for the second time, George apparently still hasn't graduated yet, and is possibly not even a member in active status.

 

Fundraising

SO...$24,500 is the calculated budget for this five episode series. With this footage, we have 5 - 15 minutes episodes, which can also be broken down and sold into the standard 4 episode 20 minutes series, or one 80 minute stand alone film. After production, the piece will be pitched to the networks and streaming entities, HBO, NETFLIX, AMAZON, FX, etc. If a proposal is not agreed upon, we will present the series on a public forum so that everyone may connect. Here are some pieces of the machine that need funding in order to create a professional result.  

Pre-Production - involves work such as location scouting, permits, insurance, and advertisement, which are all necessary to release a quality picture 

Production - not only involving camera equipment and crew, but food, lighting,  set design, wardrobe, and makeup all must be taken care of to have a series that can be executed properly 

Post-Production - would span from cutting and editing images, color, or sound, each needing their own professional 

Advertisement - as preproduction continues, we are finding more and more ways to raise money. We are developing a full mens calendars, t-shirts, and posters, as well as lots of other merchandise. The fundraising has been not only a chance to enjoy and explore our characters, but also a great opportunity to show all the many ways we are trying to build the concept.  

The goal and intention is primarily to release it for the masses, allowing it to create it's own following and recognition. Although, with format and storyline, the project has the potential to also be sold as a proof of concept for a larger picture.

WE AREN'T MAKING MONEY

TO BE CLEAR. The money raised for this goes to camera equipment, permits, insurance, and FOOD. Feeding 75 people a day gets expensive. There are only a small group of professionals that are getting paid or their quality work (Camera and Production dept.). The rest of us are paid in the outcome and recognition. A vast majority of the cast and crew are eager to manifest a relatable and compelling college experience. Whether you're helping with $5 or $500, you're helping a collective of hard working and intelligent people who truly want to entertain you.

BUT WE ARE RAISING IT

A schedule with our fundraising activities and events will be posted here and on our Instagram and Facebook pages.  We have Rush Weekend, consisting of a hot dog eating contest followed by popcorn and a projected movie. The next day will be The Highland Games Tournament followed by the rudimentary but still necessary beer pong and flip coup tournaments, all of the buy ins going to the fund. The following weekend will be the Businessman Panhandle Experiment. All 17 fraternity members will dress up in suits but in character for a full weekend, with a whiteboard that asks only for 50 cents to help start our business; The Collective, a business that produces all art forms, film, music, and studio art alike, allowing the the opportunity to work and grow together. ALL OF THESE EVENTS WILL BE EXECUTED IN CHARACTER. Not only do the audience see some footage and trailers, but it allow the cast more time to blend into the character. And that's just the fun stuff.

Journey

The real story here is that fraternities were created to allow a group of boys to better each other. As hazing and other social problems have run out of control, the true factors that fraternities were instilled on are still running faint but true in some small places. We believe we are voicing the many kind and courageous brotherhoods and fellowships that are brought down by establishments that do not care about the bond, character, and memories instilled by not only fraternities, but the unions and communities that bring people together. We hope you get as involved as we have and enjoy the process as much as the result. The Last Chapter is the first of many.

With production and shooting in November, we will be raising money in our own fraternal and philanthropic ways, keeping posted on our connecting social media sites. You will be seeing trailers and characters soon enough! 

Please follow us on IG and FB to see what we are doing behind the scenes!

IG: @thelast chapter series, @bgtofsouthernkansas 

WE TRULY APPRECIATE YOU!!!

Thank you for getting involved and becoming part of our vision. We believe this exceeds beyond our own individual capabilities and is something of true value that will bring laughter to our audiences.
story_txt: Disregarding the school boards many attempts to disband them from campus, these gentlemen attempt to initiate the next generation of pledges while still holding true to the original rituals passed down to them. As the school board's AFC (AltoFrateralCouncil) thwarts to prove the boys are hazing, they brush shoulders with another few unsavory groups, these, slightly less charismatic. In one night of outlying circumstances and spontaneous characters, all told from real perspectives, this series satiates the taste for brotherhood dramedy of the finest brood. For the University of Southern Kansas' Beta Gamma Theta, this may be The Last Chapter.  The Fraternity is comprised of 17 members. 10 Active Members and 7 Associate.Seniors John. T. Rojers Jr. (President/Preacher) - the silent mafia donMichael Balzkowski (Ballz) - Balls. Brains. Backbone.Patrick McGreddy (Altar Boy) - From priest to pot smoker, he replaced the Bible with a bottleEdward Arthur Low (Zen Master) - "If the river flows most fluent at night, is it still as fickle as love at first sight?"Charles Theodore Hawthorne III (Trust Fund) - brings exactly that to the table; money and malicious intent  Juniors:Ewan Hammond (Prodigy) - this sprinkle of Aussie charm keeps the women around and the men at bayLeonard Schumacher (Super Nerd) - his devotion to the fraternity cannot be mathematically deduced; not even by himSophomores: Samuel Holt (Treasurer/White Rabbit) - one man's drugs is another man's treasureAnthony Marin (Love Slut) - falls in love more often than he changes his underwearJesse Mackison (Tri-Athlete) - clean body, clean mid, clean soul. Clean looking reflection as wellFreshman:John Hardon (Hard-On) - not the Hard-On the fraternity needed, but the Hard-On the fraternity wantedBobby Tellman (Legacy) - Daddy is an active alumni; Mommy drives him to schoolDonald Raine (Troop) - Nature. Nurture. Lover. Fighter.Doug Mitchel (Doug) - not worth a bioWilliam Roberts (Cnt. Bump) - can chug a Natty Ice and wrestle down a wild boar before you can say p'tangThomas Gonzalez (PCB) - if Tweaky McTweakerson had a kid with Major Tom Taylor Kennedy (Star Boy) - a beautiful, bodacious bastardWithstanding Member: George D'espciale (Oldballs George) - finally shooting his documentary thesis for the second time, George apparently still hasn't graduated yet, and is possibly not even a member in active status. FundraisingSO...$24,500 is the calculated budget for this five episode series. With this footage, we have 5 - 15 minutes episodes, which can also be broken down and sold into the standard 4 episode 20 minutes series, or one 80 minute stand alone film. After production, the piece will be pitched to the networks and streaming entities, HBO, NETFLIX, AMAZON, FX, etc. If a proposal is not agreed upon, we will present the series on a public forum so that everyone may connect. Here are some pieces of the machine that need funding in order to create a professional result.  Pre-Production - involves work such as location scouting, permits, insurance, and advertisement, which are all necessary to release a quality picture Production - not only involving camera equipment and crew, but food, lighting,  set design, wardrobe, and makeup all must be taken care of to have a series that can be executed properly Post-Production - would span from cutting and editing images, color, or sound, each needing their own professional Advertisement - as preproduction continues, we are finding more and more ways to raise money. We are developing a full mens calendars, t-shirts, and posters, as well as lots of other merchandise. The fundraising has been not only a chance to enjoy and explore our characters, but also a great opportunity to show all the many ways we are trying to build the concept.  The goal and intention is primarily to release it for the masses, allowing it to create it's own following and recognition. Although, with format and storyline, the project has the potential to also be sold as a proof of concept for a larger picture.WE AREN'T MAKING MONEYTO BE CLEAR. The money raised for this goes to camera equipment, permits, insurance, and FOOD. Feeding 75 people a day gets expensive. There are only a small group of professionals that are getting paid or their quality work (Camera and Production dept.). The rest of us are paid in the outcome and recognition. story:
Short Summary:

Sector 17 also include various stories, conspiracy theories and mysteries from throughout history in our scripts. Each character, even the minor ones, have very elaborate backstories that our writing team keeps in mind when creating each episode.

Although the full story behind each character isn’t revealed our writers use the knowledge of the characters in order to give them life / make them more believable. Our writing team is comprised of a group of friends that met over Facebook and by complete coincidence shared many similar interests and life experiences, each very devoted to creating a unique and independent group of superheroes and villains. 

The series has elements that appeal to lovers of most genres. Obviously the series is action-packed, but we also have heavy amounts of: fantasy, drama, conspiracy, mystery, and comedy among most other genres you can name. 

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:

  • We need about $2,000 to fully fund our project, which covers production expenses.
  • Our actors at this time are working for free, but we also need our actors to be lively and full of energy. In the event, we do not reach our goal your help will go towards providing meals and lodging accommodations our cast and crew.

What You Get:

  • With $25 contribution you'll receive a coffee mug and baseball cap, but wait for $25 more you a whole bunch of goodies!
  • With $50 contribution you'll receive a bundle which includes: A cast photo, series poster, Sector 17 T-shirt, coffee mug and baseball cap. You can start your Christmas shopping early! But wait it gets better...
  • With $100 contribution not only do you receive all of the aforementioned perks but also, you receive a digital copy of our first season AND you would receive an "Associate Producer" credit, how cool is that?
  • Much more is in store for those who are willing to contribute more....

The Impact

With your contribution our production team will be able to:

  • Provide room and board for our cast.
  • Cover location rental fees.
  • More importantly, you'll be making a contribution to a well to a project that strives to change the status quo of action and Sci-Fi TV shows by the distinct development of each character.

Risks & Challenges

Funding an Action TV series is hard and this is a very ambitious project with lots of special effects, fights scenes, miniatures and explosions. Of course, filmmaking is not entirely that simple either. It can be complicated and expensive, especially with Houston's weather fluctuating between hot, several hot, rain and/ flooding. We do have a plan with an experienced crew. With your help, we would be able to overcome any unforeseen hurdles. Our only hope is that you feel as excited about this project as we do and can join us to create the most epic Superhero Action adventure this world has ever seen to date.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us spread the word by sharing our campaign on your social media!
  • Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Sector17.tv/
  • Follow us on Twitter: @Sector17_TV
  • Follow us on Instagram: Sector17film
  • Follow us on IMDB

And that's all there is to it, thank you for your support!

story:
Teaser Footage:

 

Concept

GREETINGS!

We are the Pillmarsh Production Group. For the past 10 years we have established as a working production group made up of Producers, Writers, Directors and Key Crew. We have recently just finished our latest feature film called "Blue Grace" (Drama Created by Dan Andrusiak) which is currently our 3rd feature film produced by our group. Countless short films, music videos and more!

Iron City: 1978 is a concept that we have thought about for years. We knew back then that we would have to further enhance our skill set as a production crew in order to make this idea possible for screen/television with the highest quality available for viewing pleasure. Hence the numerous feature films under our belt and short film tests for many ideas. This type of concept is uncommon in the Australian Film and Television scene but not for the rest of the world. We love creating interesting stories and characters that can not only relate to, but entertain. So if you are a fan of Sci-Fi, Action, Thriller with a mix between Anime, 70's and 80's cinema then you will definitely enjoy what we have to offer. 

By reaching $20,000aud we will be able to enhance the quality of the production through the costumes, props, locations thus providing a better product that what we can imagine. The Producers for Iron City (Stewart Marshall, Julian Pillirone, Josh Mason) have already contributed a few thousand dollars to get the basics done for a minimum completion quality which includes the first six episodes to be filmed over the next five months. The last six episodes (episodes 7-12) will be focused upon in early 2019 as the story line involves a larger budget due to what is planned in locations, props, costumes and cast. 

Story:

Iron City; once called Melbourne - but that was before the war. Since the Axis Powers won WW2 Australia has fallen under Nazi rule. It is now 1978. The Nazi Party has annexed their former allies and Melbourne is a city ruled by despots in which Australians, Italians and the Japanese alike are oppressed. But a revolt is brewing. Mysterious, eccentric characters lurk around every corner. The Twin Valkyries; a pair of female assassins wreaking havoc on the Nazi Generals and guards. The Tinkerer; a man with no past, who has a finger in every pie he can get at, pulling strings behind the scenes - but whose side is he on? The Architect; the woman manufacturing the capacity for the Italians and Japanese to regain their status. The Last Russian; a tech giant who lives as a phantom, being the only man with the secrets to the most powerful weapon in the city. All of these characters, along with the Rebellion forming in the slums make up the complex workings of a city transformed by one war and now on the brink of another.

Cast and Crew:

Crew:
Directors: Stewart Marshall, Josh Mason
Writers: Stewart Marshall, Josh Mason
Producers: Stewart Marshall, Josh Mason, Julian Pillirone
Associate Producers: John Cunningham, Madeline Claire French, Sammy Yahya
Cinematography: Stewart Fairweather
Camera Assistant: Jackson Tipping
Sound Recordist: Sarah Tarr
Editors: Stewart Marshall, Stewart Fairweather
Special Effects Make-Up: Amy-lee Cameron
Casting: Stewart Marshall, Madeline Claire French
Photography: Oliver Dauncey, Al Burkun
Composer: Johnny Krossbow
Fight Choriographer: Sammy Yahya, Adam Yahya

Cast:
Sienna Stass - Vivian Turner
Holly Clarke - Armina
Julian Pillirone - Jorn Michaels
Stewart Marshall - The Tinkerer
Dusan Dule Dobrilovic - Ludwig
Michael Fenemore - Kurt Wulff
John Cunningham - Iron City Police Chief
Albert Goikhman - Anatoly Orlov
Mia Goikhman - Tamara Orlov
Axle Gunn - Metalique
Max Tornello - Italian King
Sandra Casa - Italian Queen
Sammy Yahya - Gaston
Sorin Bagia - Italian Prince
Jonas Sauerbrey - Overseer
Peter Spowart - Opera Singer
 

 

Where does the funding go?:

If we reach $5000:

$1000 - Film Festivals
$1000 - Costumes and Props
$1000 - Locations
$1000 - Make Up and Special Effects
$500 - Catering
$500 - Deferred Payments Cast/Crew

If we reach $20,000:

$5000 - Distribution / Aggregator
$1500 - Film Festivals
$4000 - Costumes
$1500 - Props
$2000 - Make Up and Special Effects
$1000 - Catering
$2000 - Deferred Payments Cast/Crew
$3000 - Locations

Anything beyond $20,000 will go towards post production and put into multiple categories above when we need it the most. 

Share and Subscribe!

story:
A NOTE FROM THE WRITER

Hi IndieGoGo!

Atlas is a mini web series about a woman, Ari, who sells her soul to the Devil, to save her little sister, Maddy's, life. He gives her seven years to live. Our story starts on Ari's last week of existence, when the Devil shows up to collect. Atlas is about a woman not conquering her Seven Devils, but perhaps changing one of them. In a world currently dominated by glorified revenge or 'take down' campaigns, I wanted to offer something that suggests that maybe the those struggles in our lives don't require such negativity to resolve. In this case, a little more conversation, a little more action, y'all.

Stylistically, Atlas has a really unique perspective to offer: we play with a multitude of formats and styles in the show- flash forwards and broken fourth walls are some to name a few! The best way I could pitch this show to you, is to tell you it's a bit of Shameless meets American Gods, meets a bit of Jessica Jones. If that what you're into- you're in the right place.

ABOUT THE TEAM

Alex Borlo acts as Creator, Executive Producer and Director. She is a DC native, recently graduated from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama, which is currently ranked as the number one acting school in the UK.

Amanda 'AJ' Bovea serves as Director of Photography. She is coming in from Miami to shoot with us and she holds both a Bachelors and Master's degree in Film from Full Sail University.

We have ladies from around the world filling roles in Casting, Story, Crew, Production and more!

THE STUFF

We're a relatively low budget production, but we still need your help to:
  • Rent venues and standing sets for filming to get you some incredible production quality
  • Rent equipment and buy props and costumes to provide you with one hell of a visual feast
  • To make sure our Crew and Cast are provided for and safe during long set days

IN SHORT

Above anything else, we are asking you to stay engaged with us, stay tuned, stay watching. This project has something to say and we would love for you to hear it.

story:
A COMEDY FOR ALL AGES:

Generations collide in a children’s amusement park when Tommy - a cynical northerner in his 50s meets Jess – a positive young teenager with her life in front of her in this window into modern day divisive, post-Brexit Britain.

 

Now than ever – Britain is divided, whether it’s the long, drawn out aftermath of Brexit, the deadly virus sweeping the globe, or even the elaborate Tiktok dance routines - the separation between old and young is becoming an increasingly giant chasm impossible to bridge. The perfect place to see this first hand, is in a dilapidated children’s amusement park in the North East of England – the setting of the short-form comedy Arcadia. 

 

 

Who are we?

We are Alice, Keelan and Henry, a team of post-graduate producing students from far and wide across the UK. We have been brought together by Arcadia and its portrait of a fractured country, told through the window of a rundown, war era style seaside amusement park. Penned by a talented new writer from the North East, Scott Rutherford, largely taking inspiration from the questionable characters and shady settings in his local town, we all found a familiarity in the series despite our different backgrounds. We are producing the pilot of Arcadia on a no-to-low budget, so we need your help to create and share our project with people in the UK and the world. Although if we were pitching to the lead character of our series, he’d tell us not to bother because it'd be a lot of effort and we’re all going to die anyway.

 

Unlike our lead Character, Tommy, we won’t short change you. We aren’t creating this web series pilot for a shortcut to the big time, but our love for authentic British stories that reflect the world that people like you and me live in today. Arcadia gives voice to the forgotten North East regions, on the backdrop of current political upheaval, it's political without trying to be.

Think Shane Meadows' This is England meets meets the off-beat comedy of Channel 4’s Black books, with the immersive, mockumentary camerawork of The Thick of It.

This is a big project but we’re not doing this alone, we have the incredible expertise of Royal Holloway’s Media arts centre, and senior lecturers with years of industry experience on hand to support up every step of the way. We'll be shooting in a kitted-out TV studio with most equipment provided for us by the university. 

So, How can you help?

Over the past several months we have been hard at work developing our material to reflect and connect with our audiences, everyday people. We've scrimped and saved on minimum wage jobs, sacrificed time with our friends and families, taken production meetings on our lunch breaks to get where we are today. We are only £350 from achieving our budget for the pilot. You aren't just writing a check, you're supporting people across our fractured country to find a common thread in sound bite generation. And, supporting 12 individuals take one step closer to achieving their career aspirations. 

100% of your money goes towards production costs.

Whats the plan, then?

We are producing the pilot of our web-series to use as a proof on concept for the series itself. Why you might ask? Well, Since the COVID 19 pandemic, the creative industries have have massively contracted, as so too has the work that's available to creatives. And for this reason, out of respect for our cast and crew, we would really like to be able to pay them for the rest of the series, because quite frankly, they deserve it.  

We're shooting in just over a week, so there's no time to lose. Tell your uncle, your sister, your grandad. Give the page a share. Any donation of any size will mean the world to us! 
 

COVID-19 safety.

As we are operating this production as Masters students, we are legally permitted to proceed with this shoot as it is a requirement of our course. But we have a Coronavirus risk assessment in place, as well as adhering to both the university's filming social distancing procedures, as well as government guidelines to ensure we are doing our part to keep our cast and crew safe.
story_txt: A COMEDY FOR ALL AGES:Generations collide in a children’s amusement park when Tommy - a cynical northerner in his 50s meets Jess – a positive young teenager with her life in front of her in this window into modern day divisive, post-Brexit Britain. Now than ever – Britain is divided, whether it’s the long, drawn out aftermath of Brexit, the deadly virus sweeping the globe, or even the elaborate Tiktok dance routines - the separation between old and young is becoming an increasingly giant chasm impossible to bridge. The perfect place to see this first hand, is in a dilapidated children’s amusement park in the North East of England – the setting of the short-form comedy Arcadia.   Who are we?We are Alice, Keelan and Henry, a team of post-graduate producing students from far and wide across the UK. We have been brought together by Arcadia and its portrait of a fractured country, told through the window of a rundown, war era style seaside amusement park. Penned by a talented new writer from the North East, Scott Rutherford, largely taking inspiration from the questionable characters and shady settings in his local town, we all found a familiarity in the series despite our different backgrounds. We are producing the pilot of Arcadia on a no-to-low budget, so we need your help to create and share our project with people in the UK and the world. Although if we were pitching to the lead character of our series, he’d tell us not to bother because it'd be a lot of effort and we’re all going to die anyway. Unlike our lead Character, Tommy, we won’t short change you. We aren’t creating this web series pilot for a shortcut to the big time, but our love for authentic British stories that reflect the world that people like you and me live in today. Arcadia gives voice to the forgotten North East regions, on the backdrop of current political upheaval, it's political without trying to be.Think Shane Meadows' This is England meets meets the off-beat comedy of Channel 4’s Black books, with the immersive, mockumentary camerawork of The Thick of It.This is a big project but we’re not doing this alone, we have the incredible expertise of Royal Holloway’s Media arts centre, and senior lecturers with years of industry experience on hand to support up every step of the way. We'll be shooting in a kitted-out TV studio with most equipment provided for us by the university. So, How can you help?Over the past several months we have been hard at work developing our material to reflect and connect with our audiences, everyday people. We've scrimped and saved on minimum wage jobs, sacrificed time with our friends and families, taken production meetings on our lunch breaks to get where we are today. We are only £350 from achieving our budget for the pilot. You aren't just writing a check, you're supporting people across our fractured country to find a common thread in sound bite generation. And, supporting 12 individuals take one step closer to achieving their career aspirations. 100% of your money goes towards production costs.Whats the plan, then?We are producing the pilot of our web-series to use as a proof on concept for the series itself. Why you might ask? Well, Since the COVID 19 pandemic, the creative industries have have massively contracted, as so too has the work that's available to creatives. And for this reason, out of respect for our cast and crew, we would really like to be able to pay them for the rest of the series, because quite frankly, they deserve it.  We're shooting in just over a week, so there's no time to lose. Tell your uncle, your sister, your grandad. Give the page a share. Any donation of any size will mean the world to us!  COVID-19 safety.As we are operating this production as Masters students, we are legally permitted to proceed with this shoot as it is a requirement of our course. But we have a Coronavirus risk assessment in place, as well as adhering to both the university's filming social distancing procedures, as well as government guidelines to ensure we are doing our part to keep our cast and crew safe.

story:
Street Series is a collection of short, stand-alone scenes portraying various instances a woman may be street harassed. Filmed in Toronto, they are inspired by personal experiences and use comedy to exacerbate the situation. I love being told what to do with my face and being yelled at from a car...said no one ever.

The pilot episode - 288 LEWD CONDUCT - is currently in post production and will be released in a few days! Eeep!

We're seeking funding so that we can film more episodes in the Spring/Summer to complete Season One. Wondering about their content? Here's a few sneak peak log lines for your curiosity.

MEET CUTE a daughter brings her fiancée home for dinner with the parents where, to her horror, her parents relay the story of how they met.

SUMMER IS COMING one man telling three separate women to smile and their reaction to this helpful comment. 

CATHARTIC THOUGHTS the vengeance of a woman being honked at by a car full of homies. 

This project is created, written, directed and produced by women with a few 'woke males' on the production team. 

Mostly we need money for equipment rentals and post-production costs such as editing and sound mixing. 

We have an instagram account - @streetseriesto - if you'd like to follow updates! This is where we will be posting rewards from our perks. Your support and contributions are deeply appreciated. 

Cheers!

Brittany Rae Robinson
Creator/Writer/Actor of ‘Hey, Red! Productions’

story:
Howdy Internet!

My name is Eli Tell. 5 years ago, I was working 50 hours a week as a cashier at a grocery store. I had no time to be creative as I was constantly exhausted and uninspired. It was then that I had the idea for Jamdromeda, a universe where jamming is illegal and a few subversive space-voyagers journey through the cosmos uplifting the galaxy through song.

In the past 5 years, we've fully developed this idea. We have a cast of characters like Sir Friskydigits, Professor Beaucoup-Beats, The Countess Bassie, and many more! We have a pitch bible, several scripts, and the above animatic. In short, we're ready to take this idea to the next level! 

In recent years, we've seen a world increasingly bereft of genuine creativity. In a world of reboots and a continued effort to cut funding to the arts, we must fight back with subversive, beguiling, and inclusive content that shows real creativity and a love for life itself. That's what Jamdromeda represents to me:

A chance to be real and inspiring. 

What We Need

We want to make a fully animated pilot!

  • We need (at least) $9500 to make this thing the right way. We'll need a team of animators, storyboard artists, character designers and a little something to pay our actors. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still use every penny we get to get the best animation we can afford. It's basically a situation where, no matter what, we're going to get this thing animated. The quality of the animation will just vary.

Risks & Challenges

There's obviously challenges with regards to the pandemic and getting all the people together to work but through Zoom, at home recording, and this funny little invention called email, we feel we can complete this project just as quickly as we could have in normal times.

Other Ways You Can Help

No money? No worries!

  • If you don't have the funds but you wanna help, please don't hesitate to share this campaign with your friends, family, acquaintances, lovers, enemies etc.
  • Or just shoot us some kind words in the comments, those are also appreciated.

Thanks for being a part of the Jamverse!

story:
Short Summary

Director and writer, Mike Swift of Street Gold Pictures has written numerous web series, shorts, and full features. His most recent web series was presented at ITV Fest, Brooklyn Web Fest, NYC Web Fest, and more. Producer Tori Kotsen has produced many successful short films and is currently a double major in media studies and economics at the University of Virginia where she is focusing on film studies. We came together through a television producing course at NYU and have been working on this project for the past eight months.

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is roughly $40,000, but we need room for insurance and accidents in case we hit any road bumps. Actors and a lot of crew will have deferred payment so all your money would be going directly into production. You'd be supporting the equipment, location rent fees, production design, costumes, and select crew, as well as things in post like editing and sound mixing. Every bit will help move the project along and lead it to be that much more successful. 

The Impact

We have an opportunity to create a really entertaining show that we have faith will be very successful in the future. You are helping two young aspiring filmmakers create something amazing and boost their careers to the next level.

Risks & Challenges

The only problems we really foresee right now is effectively raising money to secure a venue. Wedding venues aren't cheap and deposits often have to be put down early so the faster we can secure funds, the faster we can secure a location and begin filming.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, there are still many ways to help! Share this post with your friends or on social media and help us get the word out there!

story:
These are a couple exterior shots.
 
 

Prepare to go where no fan production has gone before!

Fan films are dreams come true, wish-fulfillment fantasies realized through the miracle of video production.  But what if it all happened for REAL? What if you were suddenly on board the USS Enterprise and Captain Kirk and his crew needed YOUR help?  Would you know what to do? After all, you're the ultimate Trekkie, right? But this isn't just a show anymore, and those Klingons are really shooting at you!

Meet Peter Warren, a "get-a-life" Star Trek fanatic who wakes up on the bridge of the USS Enterprise in his Captain Kirk pajamas...only to discover the ship is empty, the crew displaced in time, and an unstoppable foe from the future has a plan that is futile to resist.  Can a Trekkie in his pajamas possibly save the Federation all by himself?

Cross the threshold between reality and fantasy as the two become one in the upcoming fan film "To Have Boldly Gone."  With your generous donations, you can help turn this fantasy into a wonderful reality for fans everywhere to watch and enjoy!

 "to sleep, perchance to dream – ay, there's the rub, for in this sleep of death what dreams may come"

  • We couldn't make this film without your help and you can take home a small piece of it.
  • This fan film is more than a home movie, we have the best set is the world, we have experienced workers and our cast have been in numerous films.

Check out the perks, there should be something for everyone:

  • We thank you in advance for helping with this campaign.
  • Tell people about this project, you are helping make a film!
  • All funds raised are to cover costs of production and the final product is free for all to watch.
  • Will your name be seen in the credits?

Our Cast: 

Captain Peter Warren                 - Larry Fleming

Lt Commander Boyce                 - John Sims

Lt Commander Yura                    - Lezlie Sawyer

Lt Commander Dax                     -  Jason Spriggs

Lt Commander Donnelly           -  Allen Anderson

Lt Commander Kelly (Doctor) -  Lauren White

Lt Commander Yohan                - Reserved for a special contributor

 This could be you

Our IMDB Page:

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9904980

Our Writer Director:

 https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3940433

 

We wanted you to see our beautiful set. 

THE NEUTRAL ZONE STUDIOS contain a full-scale suite of Constitution class star ship sets including: the bridge, transporter room, engineering, sickbay, briefing room, captain’s quarters, auxiliary control, a 100 foot-long corridor, a near-by green screen facility, and much more!

https://www.neutralzonestudios.com

This is a Star Trek Fan film. Star Trek was created by Gene Roddenberry

“Star Trek and all related marks, logos and characters are solely owned by CBS Studios Inc. This fan production is not endorsed by, sponsored by, nor affiliated with CBS, Paramount Pictures, or any other Star Trek franchise, and is a non-commercial fan-made film intended for recreational use.

No commercial exhibition or distribution is permitted. No alleged independent rights will be asserted against CBS or Paramount Pictures.”

story:
Short Summary

Hello! We are students at the University of Georgia pursuing degrees in a  range of subjects. However, we are all very passionate about filmmaking and telling stories. Our project, PSA, is a 3 part mini-series that follows the interwoven stories of 3 different women and their struggles rooted in their own individual and unique identities. It is a 3 episode social drama with each episode lasting about 10 minutes. Produced by Madie Young and Eli Quintanilla and written by Lucia Vereen, PSA is a unique and fantastic opportunity not only to gain hands on experience, but to make something meaningful. We can't wait to get started and see the series come to light. 

What We Need & What You Get

Basically, what we need from you, is help funding our film to help with equipment costs, transportation, locations, and food on set. We want to raise as much money as we can so that we are able to use the best equipment and make PSA as great as we know can be. As college students, we don't really have the money to pay for any of this strictly on our own. That is why we are asking for some help. Anything you can donate would be greatly appreciated! In return, you will receive a letter of gratitude and all the bragging rights to say you helped make a mini-series!

The Impact

Your contribution will not only help fund PSA, but will ensure that we as students are able to learn from the newest equipment, use the perfect location, and feed our hunger on set! Your donations will allow for us to be creative, independent, and make the series the best it will be. 

Risks & Challenges

We understand that there are certain risks of making a series like ours and we will always make sure we are responsible with the funds. If for some reason, something goes wrong, we will make sure to keep you informed and ensure that your money is returned or a solution is found immediately. We understand that the costs of equipment can be very high and especially when we plan on using the equipment for an extended period of time. We also understand that many other cost factors that we cannot fully anticipate will come into play as well. We will budget and make sure that the money will go to the right places. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If  you are unable to contribute, we understand and hope that you stay updated and still watch the series when it comes out! In the meantime, if you know anyone that might be interested please send this their way. And like our page on social media!

story:
I'm an actor, writer & director living in Florence, Italy. A few years ago I moved out here to work on new projects and somewhere along the line started running workshops for actors. These workshops developed into short film scripts for different characters and then developed again into a 45-minute TV Pilot called DIRTY OLD TOWN...

Florence is known around the world as one of the Renaissance capitals. A steady stream of chocolate-box productions have emanated from the city and Tuscany in general - and with good reason - it is a city rich with art, history and culture.

To begin with we were developing characters that could exist in any city... and indeed, these characters probably could. DIRTY OLD TOWN is a term that could apply to many districts of many cities... but here we are in Florence; it is at the very least the canvas for the scenes, although this won't be your average tourist-generating love letter.

So what we have are interwoven stories of dreamers and the sub-optimal life choices that they make along the way... although I'm not a huge fan of comparisons with other shows, script-readers have commented that there are elements of Shameless, It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia, and The Office.

How you can help:

Production on the Pilot Episode begins in March 2017, and we would really appreciate your support: we are looking to raise an initial 5000 Euros which will cover various costs involved during the week of shooting: fuel, cast & crew food and other consumables, make-up & costume department, external hard drives and backups. Anything that is raised over this will be used during  the post-production phase and eventual promotion of the pilot to agents, networks and distributors: on a shoe string we have developed a 45 minute script that gets great feedback, the actors and crew are ready... now, in the words of Jasmin, we just need that 'push' that can come from you...

We have some fun things available on the perks page, so enjoy our pitch video to get a taste of the characters and take a look around the merchandise... exclusive prints, music downloads... or how about a Psychic Reading(?)... 

A huge thank you in advance for any support you can give to the project, feel free to ask us any questions, and look out for backstage updates and scene snippets that we will be posting throughout the shoot.

Here is a link to Fresnel's previous work.

Also please feel free to share our indiegogo page!

story:
Short Summary

Kris Scott was born in Irvine, Scotland. From the age of sixteen, he became very fond of the way films were made and wanted to know more. He followed numerous behind the scenes videos from different films, making his imagination go wild with what he could do. He studied media at College, including Writing, Film Making, Journalism and Photography, building upon his growing love for the arts. He also studied drama, which led to a massive confidence boost, giving him the courage to attend auditions and pursue a career in acting.  As a result, he was awarded the roles of a student in 'Waterloo Road' and Tenant Shaun in 'Outlander'.

“Detachment is important to me as we began the journey during the COVID-19 situation that engulfed the planet. Making this brought a number of creatives together from around the world. When it came to a close, it was suggested that we make another series, continuing the story but expanding on the world we created in the first series. This allows us to expand on the character arcs, grow the cast and add more locations. 

With your help we can build this world, grow the characters and create a series we can all be proud of.”  
 

Learn more about our journey here:

 

https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/ayrshire/ayrshire...

https://www.ayradvertiser.com/news/18712663.zom...

https://www.ayradvertiser.com/news/18629941.kriss-gripping-lockdown-thriller-hits-amazon-prime/

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Cast and crew worked on series 1 for free as a lockdown project.  As we move into series 2, we would like to be able to pay our talented bunch for their hard work and dedication!  £1350 raised will go towards to ensuring we can afford this.  
  • As well as paying the cast and crew, we'd love to be able to feed them on our three day shoot!  £150 will allow us to offer them something more substantial than crisps and pot noodles.
  • £200 will help us secure an editor and sound designer to put the show together and keep it looking shiny and professional.
  • An extra £100 will help us to secure props and other bits and pieces that will help build the look of the Detachment universe.
  • The final £200 will be kept in a contingency fund, as we all know things don't always go according to plan!  This extra safety net will provide for any unforseen circumstances such as equipment breakages or damage. 

The Impact

  • Detachment is a social commentary based around the importance of teamwork and communication in an ever changing post apocalyptic world.  We believe that this message is one of hope over fear, and something important to society, now more than ever.
  • Detachment Series 1 is currently available to stream on Amazon Prime, with an overall rating of 4 stars, starring the best of Scottish talent alongside Jordyn Aurora Aquino (From Dusk Till Dawn, Better Call Saul, Messiah)
  • Your contributions will allow us to continue building the Detachment universe and follow the characters as they come to terms with the new world.

Risks & Challenges

  • Much of Detachment takes place in outdoor locations (to account for Government implemented social distancing).  Outdoor shoots often come with a unique set of challenges, particularly in Scotland where the weather can be unpredictable.  We will be monitoring the weather forecast closely before scheduling these scenes, and will ensure nearby shelter to keep cast, crew and equipment safe and dry.
  • Our team are experienced and have worked on many projects previously.  Given Series 1 was filmed completely remotely under lockdown, we believe we can rise to any further challenges that come our way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help in the following ways:

  • Share our campaign
  • Follow us on social media
  • Watch Detachment Series 1 for free with an Amazon Prime account
story_txt:
Short Summary
Kris Scott was born in Irvine, Scotland. From the age of sixteen, he became very fond of the way films were made and wanted to know more. He followed numerous behind the scenes videos from different films, making his imagination go wild with what he could do. He studied media at College, including Writing, Film Making, Journalism and Photography, building upon his growing love for the arts. He also studied drama, which led to a massive confidence boost, giving him the courage to attend auditions and pursue a career in acting.  As a result, he was awarded the roles of a student in 'Waterloo Road' and Tenant Shaun in 'Outlander'.
“Detachment is important to me as we began the journey during the COVID-19 situation that engulfed the planet. Making this brought a number of creatives together from around the world. When it came to a close, it was suggested that we make another series, continuing the story but expanding on the world we created in the first series. This allows us to expand on the character arcs, grow the cast and add more locations. 
With your help we can build this world, grow the characters and create a series we can all be proud of.”   

Learn more about our journey here:

 
https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/ayrshire/ayrshire...

https://www.ayradvertiser.com/news/18712663.zom...


https://www.ayradvertiser.com/news/18629941.kriss-gripping-lockdown-thriller-hits-amazon-prime/
What We Need & What You Get
 


Cast and crew worked on series 1 for free as a lockdown project.  As we move into series 2, we would like to be able to pay our talented bunch for their hard work and dedication!  £1350 raised will go towards to ensuring we can afford this.  
As well as paying the cast and crew, we'd love to be able to feed them on our three day shoot!  £150 will allow us to offer them something more substantial than crisps and pot noodles.
£200 will help us secure an editor and sound designer to put the show together and keep it looking shiny and professional.
An extra £100 will help us to secure props and other bits and pieces that will help build the look of the Detachment universe.
The final £200 will be kept in a contingency fund, as we all know things don't always go according to plan!  This extra safety net will provide for any unforseen circumstances such as equipment breakages or damage. 


The Impact

Detachment is a social commentary based around the importance of teamwork and communication in an ever changing post apocalyptic world.  We believe that this message is one of hope over fear, and something important to society, now more than ever.
Detachment Series 1 is currently available to stream on Amazon Prime, with an overall rating of 4 stars, starring the best of Scottish talent alongside Jordyn Aurora Aquino (From Dusk Till Dawn, Better Call Saul, Messiah)
Your contributions will allow us to continue building the Detachment universe and follow the characters as they come to terms with the new world.


Risks & Challenges

Much of Detachment takes place in outdoor locations (to account for Government implemented social distancing).  Outdoor shoots often come with a unique set of challenges, particularly in Scotland where the weather can be unpredictable.  We will be monitoring the weather forecast closely before scheduling these scenes, and will ensure nearby shelter to keep cast, crew and equipment safe and dry.
Our team are experienced and have worked on many projects previously.  Given Series 1 was filmed completely remotely under lockdown, we believe we can rise to any further challenges that come our way.


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can still help in the following ways:

Share our campaign
Follow us on social media
Watch Detachment Series 1 for free with an Amazon Prime account

story:
NOBODY - The Story

Their daughter raped and murdered... His guilt growing... Her sanity slipping... Therapist Tom Campbell and his media mogul wife Annabelle are primed to unravel. 

NOBODY is a story of a man and woman united by faith and commitment, bound by total devotion and true love, yet tortured by a deep sorrow. Devout Catholics, Tom and Annabelle passionately observe the tenets of their faith, but in the throws of anguish are also plagued with the questions we all have at one time or another: Where is God? Where is the justice in life? Why doesn’t someone DO something? 

Annabelle is a sharp, poised political writer and commentator, but with the one-year anniversary of Grace’s murder approaching, she is unable to cope, and becomes a woman on the edge of losing her mind. Tom is a therapist for sexual abuse victims, and constantly reminded of his daughter’s suffering, he becomes a man on the edge of losing control, ultimately taking justice into his own hands.

NOBODY is a world of dualities; a man of faith forced to reckon with the darkest aspects of his soul, and a woman of great renown brought to her knees in a search for emotional comfort. It’s a universal story about trust and secrets, faith and doubt, and forgiveness and punishment. It explores the idea that when grief, guilt, and fury collide... perhaps justice is the best therapy. 

Why contribute to our project?

The themes of NOBODY (sexual abuse, human brokenness, justice) hit very close to home for many people. We have become increasingly aware of the DEVASTATING impact of sexual abuse and just how common it is.  In fact, if you're reading this, statistics suggest that you have been the victim of sexual abuse or know someone who has. It is pan-demograpic: every race, religion, socio-economic background, nationality and creed is affected by sexual abuse.  

NOBODY takes the issue head-on in a way everyone can relate to. Through the story of Tom and Annabelle, we examine the often life-long impact of the sexual abuse pandemic, as well as the universal experiences of grief and loss, a yearning for justice, and the prospect of healing and hope.

The Impact of your donation

As artists our work is done largely in quiet rooms, alone and with no guarantee of income. We have second jobs that allow us to keep the lights on and food in the refrigerator. Your donation means we get to take the meetings potential investors are already requesting without having to sell our furniture or cars. $20 may seem like nothing to you, but when 500 of you send an Andrew Jackson our way, it means we get to pursue investors, begin location scouting, and start pre-production with room to breathe. We thank you in advance for the trust you show in us and the encouragement that we get with every donation. We're thrilled about this project and believe it has an incredible future. Thank you for being a part of it!

Risks & Challenges

Making art a lucrative business is hard. Really hard. But we believe this issue is so ubiquitous, the story so compelling, and the themes so universal, that once people get the vision of NOBODY they'll jump right in. The journey brings a myriad of challenges: beginning with raising the full $550,000 production budget, then garnering attention from web platform, studio, and network decision-makers, as well as selling NOBODY to a market that's already saturated with more content than anyone can possibly watch, AND making our money back for our investors.

These are all very real challenges that we are uniquely equipped to address. Our team is in the top of their respective fields, with actors currently on top-rated network shows, producers with years of experience, and a consultant currently at the helm of a major network show. Our marketing team is led by a veteran of the ad business with over 30 years of experience with firms such as Publicis, Leo Burnett and Weiden and Kennedy. Our legal team is made up of numerous attorneys with all manner of legal expertise from three different states.

We are thrilled and honored to have their trust and passion working with us. There are no guarantees in our business, but with our team we feel well-equipped to address any issue that will certainly come our way.

The Team

Josh Daugherty - Creator/"Tom Campbell": Josh's career as an actor is easy to spot with over 70 commercials and guest star roles on Grey's Anatomy, Supernatural, CSI, Dexter, Castle, and Judging Amy, as well as the films We Were Soldiers, John Carter of Mars, SEAL Patrol and Custody.  As a creator and producer, he has written, produced and/or directed six short films, garnering a handful of awards from festivals all over the country. 

Felicia Willson - Creator/Writer: Felicia began her television career as a production assistant on NBC’s The West Wing and quickly rose to the position of staff writer, where she won an Emmy for her work on “The Documentary Special.” Recently, she has been writing political commentary as a contributor to The Federalist, and was a recurring guest on The Rick Amato Show on One America News Channel. 

Matthew Warren - Director: Matt is an award-winning writer-producer-director who has worked in television and live events for more than 20 years. He directed more than 20 episodes of the two-time Emmy-nominated lifestyle series How Do I Look? and has produced more than 300 hours of original content for some of the world’s biggest brands including Bose, AT&T,  DIRECTV, and Toyota. 

Jules Bruff - "Annabelle Campbell":  Versed in every platform from stage to screen, Jules writes, produces, and acts in everything from commercials to studio pictures like David Fincher's thriller Zodiac. She penned and led the Indie hit film Part Time Fabulous for which she won the Best Actress Award at the Monaco Film Festival and the Feel Good Film Festival.

Chris Sullivan - "Father Petrescu": Chris’ breakout TV role was a two-year run playing Tom Cleary in Steven Soderbergh’s The Knick on Cinemax. He can also be seen in NETFLIX’s Stranger Things, Ridley Scott’s Morgan, Guardians of the Galaxy 2, and is part of the ensemble in NBC’s hit This is Us.

Cat Taber - "Mary Eastbourne": Cat is known for her work in front of the camera and behind the microphone, appearing in Just like Heaven, Jane The Virgin, The Force Awakens, Knights of the Old Republic, The Force Unleashed, Star Wars: Detours, Star Wars Rebels and Star Wars: The Clone Wars. She can also be seen in Guardians of the Galaxy and Nickelodeon’s The Loud House.

Can't donate? No sweat! Help us spread the word!

We know money is tight for a lot of people right now. Trust us, we totally get it. So here are ways you can support the NOBODY team and mission without going into debt:

Copy, paste, and SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN! We believe the story of NOBODY will speak to millions and millions of people. All they need to do is hear about us. The more you share your passion about NOBODY, the more opportunity people have to see what a ground-breaking, honest, and universal story this is.

story:
Story

The unprofessional and disgruntled staff clash with each other at THE OWL'S NEST, a trendy and overpriced gastropub in this mockumentary comedy series. It's like The Office, but in a restaurant. 

That's what we call an elevator pitch in the biz. Isn't it weird that showbiz and food service both use the phrase “in the biz?” We bet that gets incredibly confusing in L.A. We wouldn't know. We've never been. We produce all of our own content... Which is a perfectly clever segue into the question:

Why do you guys want our money? couldn't you produce the show in a more traditional way? Pitch it to a network?

Maybe we could. But what would we compromise in doing that? Do you want to see a show that understands the world of food service, that really gets it, be put in the hands of TV executives who have never worked for tips? You know those are the same guys in suits who come in and call you "Sweetheart" and snap their fingers for service, right?

This ain't their project, it's ours. And it's yours.

We want to cut out the middle man and have a series produced by the audience. We know what you've been through, because we have too.

So help us tell the stories that are uncomfortably familiar to you!
 

Comments regarding THE OWL'S NEST on Instagram


- OMFGGGGGGG!!! Literally f*^king laughing out loud!!

- These are f*&king hilarious!

- Painfully accurate. THIS IS MY LIFE.

- I am literally dead right now. I laughed so hard that I was pronounced dead at 9:27 pm.

- I need an actual series like NOW!

story:
Short Summary

"Once upon a time, there lived a girl. She looked around and saw the world, not as it was, but as she knew it could be. She said, 'Happy endings aren't a given, I'll build the world I want to live in. And if I catch a break or two, there'll be no stopping me!'"

 

Presto! Fairy Tales (The Web Series! The Musical!) is a celebration of the magic of storytelling. About two years ago, a small team of us (without a lick of filmmaking experience between us) sat down to dream about producing a new web series that would embrace all the whimsy, wonder, and wackiness of fairy tales in a way that was both reverent and playful at once, using punk, rock, and other modern music styles to create something that would lift up, entertain, and inspire dreamers and lovers of fairy tales all over. Gradually the team began to grow (and we added a few people who knew a thing or two about web series production) and after many months of planning, production, and post-production/editing we had created something that we're all quite proud of. Throughout the process we utilized over forty local artists, giving many a chance to stretch their wings and try something new as well as promote themselves to a world-wide audience for the first time. Our following is currently small, but we continue to grow and our dream is to one day reach thousands of households with our off-beat, zany brand of story peddling. We hope that our stories--many of the obscure, oft-overlooked entries from fairy tale collectors and folklorists around the world--not only delight but also encourage others to dream for themselves, to "grind away" through whatever stands in their way between the "now" and the "happily ever after." As Jaclyn Appleblossom (Official Fairy Godmother) once put it, "You know what I get out of most fairy tales? It's  not about the happy ending. It's about what you gotta go through to get it."

 

What We Need 

We started this project with no real budget and, through the generosity of family and friends, were able to raise about $2,000 to fund season one--every penny of which went into production expenses (props, costumes, hospitality, legal fees, literature, set construction). And, truth be told, we would have preferred a bit more money to spend on these things, but we made do without it. We were also EXTREMELY fortunate to be able to borrow all the video and audio recording equipment that we used for season one. That, unfortunately, does not appear to be a possibility for season two, which means we will need to rent or buy new equipment if we would like our production quality to be roughly the same as what we had a year ago. That's quite an added expense. We have priced equipment rentals at about $1200--and again, that would just be bringing us to the same level as what we've used before. Ideally, we'd like to be able to improve our production quality, which would obviously mean more money, but for now our fundraising target would be to reach the same level of production we hit in 2017. 

Our current goal, therefore, is $3,400. If we hit that number, our equipment and production needs are taken are of (as well as our Indiegogo expenses). If we receive less, we will prioritize equipment rental and try to scrape by borrowing as many costume and prop elements as we can (we got good at this last year). Anything over that will go toward improving the quality of our work--better lighting, better costuming, better recording devices, money to invest in merchandising to support our work even further into the future. Everything you invest goes straight into giving you the best possible Presto! Fairy Tales we can create AND helps provide a stable foundation for future seasons.  Truly, we're not asking for a gargantuan sum of money. Though, truth be told, we also wouldn't down a gargantuan sum of money if it was offered :-) 

We have put together a few incentives as a thank you for certain tiers of gifts. Our hope has always been that Presto! becomes something that everyone feels a "part" of--from those of us who met two years ago to dream this crazy dream to every actor and musician who gave their time and talent to every person who clicks "play" on YouTube. Presto! is a little like a family, and we want for you all to feel a part, and several of our perks were created with this idea in mind. 

Thanks for considering helping us. We hope you'll decide to become a part of our story.
