story:
WEBSITE ANIMATION PAGE:

 https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/adventurousmindsanimationwork

  • Adventurous Minds LLC is an American film studio that develops and produces animated television programming, featured and short films.​  Our studio started in 2012, but officially became a business in January of 2017.  We worked on an short animation for the Jackson 5 documentary on Joe Jackson. Character design working alongside Pixel Pirate Studio for American hip hop artist "Desiigner" in one of his later music videos called "Zombie Walk". We also worked on a project called "Primus 7", which was a story developed by an NBA player who wanted to create more diverse content in the media of Animation.

WEBSITE HOME PAGE: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Here at Adventurous Minds LLC we're currently developing 4 Animation short stories and we need your help with funds to push these projects through to the finish line. In return for your support, we would love to create an Online Animation Course program that shows you our step-by-step process.

Short Animation 1-2: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/single-post/2018/11/02/2-PART-ANIMATION-SHORT

Short Animation 3: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/single-post/2018/10/30/PROGENY-American-web-television-series 

Short Animation 4: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/single-post/2018/10/30/PLANET-RISE-RPG-ANIMATION-TRAILER

  • This course will only be to those who support. For those who donate to our higher perks, will be granted with extra features/behind the scenes from either of the four projects once released. There are special things that are provided in each perk other than the Animation course itself. So be sure to read our perks!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Responsible for manifesting this course is a couple of studs who are taking this opportunity to meld their creative juices together into something extraordinary... and you're all invited! =D

We need your help in order to bring these projects to fruition. We cannot do this without you, the backers, the Supporters, the real MVP's!

 

The Animation Course program will contain about 4-6 tutorial episodes or even more depending on how much we fund for this campaign. We're calling it series 1 and each episode will run about 25-35 minutes long, documenting our step-by-step process showing you how we create an animation scene!

 This could give back to so many aspiring artists that have nothing but love and passion for this career field and they want to learn more about it. Maybe one day, these very same people will put their own mark on some of the most wonderful films and shows to come.

  • The animation course will cover how we use the following programs; Photoshop and After Effects.

 

  • First our focus will cover how we animate using Photoshop. We'll show you our step by step process and then break down our animation process. The break down would cover all the bases such as; storyboarding to recording the reference for the particular animation cut, then move on to key poses and then finally animating the rough.

 

  • Then we move into After Effects and from there we'll show you how we compose and organize the animation frames. The big focus here will be on timing. We'll show you how we time our animation cuts in order to get the right flow in speed. 

Then out of all of that effort comes this: 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Adventurous Minds LLC is headed by Prince Smith and Lamont Pounds.​

What has brought them to want to become filmmakers and create their very own production company?

"As kids we didn't often see people who look like us and our Hispanic cousin's in the light on the big screen.The only people of color we see are the basic stereotype or characters who didn't represent a positive or empowering image figure. So here we are now. We feel representation is very important and everyone deserves to feel like they are of value in this world. We just simply want to lend our talent's to do our part in making that change become a great one. "

  • "We believe we can have a positive influence not only in this industry but on many people across the world" 

OUR PURPOSE BLOG: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/single-post/2016/08/24/OUR-PURPOSE

  • This campaign is about building a community to help make a differences in the world of Animation and film in general. We've always wanted to see different type of characters from different backgrounds that brace the screen with their uniqueness, beauty and to be the main attraction of a film.  

  • You will be helping us achieve the possibility to build a platform for our studio to be in a position to one day green-light and produce many new diverse animation stories told on the screen today. 

  •  Also If this campaign is successfully funded it will possibly pave the way for us to pursue other projects to further the Adventurous Minds universe. It will give us the opportunity to work on additional series that we have written and developed personally.

 https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/lightanime

 

 

  • We know you, as supporters of great anime, have interest and would love to see more diverse stories/characters involved in the animation realm. We also love the idea that you guys want to be involved and you want to see a project come to life from start to finish.

 

What We Need & What You'll Get

  • So the money is not only to build the Animation online course, it is also going to help support our team as we produce and develop our current projects at hand. Also depending on how much money we raise for the campaign, we will be able to produce our new anime series called "Light". 

  • If we don't reach the entire goal we set for the campaign, we'll just produce as many behind the scenes/process tutorials as we can with the funds we raise. We'll still want to give back to those who supports us even if it's just one person that backs us.

 The funds will have an impact on how much we'll be able to give back and that's just the truth. In order to build this course, we need the funds so that we can work to complete the projects we are currently developing, so that we can document and record the behind the scenes process.

 

  • This course is being made so that more students, kids, aspiring artists and entrepreneurs could have more opportunities to learn and to be inspired to go out and also do what they love. Our Animation Courses will shed a light on how Japanese Traditional Animators animate.

  • This is an opportunity for them to maybe learn something new on animation and how it works, and how to improve their craft so that they can have a better chance to get a job in today's entertainment industry. Perhaps it can even put them on a path to create their own company that can completely change the industry. For us, Adventurous Minds, this is bigger than creating a course, it's about influencing those who care and want to have a positive impact of their own in the creative world. 

 

  •  Also we want to be able to work on something that sparks our passion and have the end result be something we and you can be proud of. We are coming to indiegogo because it gives our supporters  the unique opportunity to be involved and take part of something special and bigger than animation it self. We want something that can actually have a real impact on this industry. 

 

 

 

     

     

    •  Backers who pledge $50 & UP will also have digital download access to any future animation projects that we produced, such as "LIGHT". 

     

     The Difference your contribution will make:

    •  Why is this project valuable to the contributor and to the world?

     

    • Film is important, films are stories that are shared with the world, it influences generations, it uplifts, it inspires, it educates, it imports all sorts of values and sparks creativity to it's viewers. Film moves the soul and it resonates with people worldwide. This is why representation in film and in the media itself is so important.
    • Film has been a constant way to tell stories about the human experience in many different and creative ways. It becomes an issue when it doesn't represent the many different and creative human beings that are usually not in these stories.
    • As we said before,we create because we feel that it is very important that people of all kinds have the same opportunities to experience a reflection of themselves and people like themselves to be represented in such an empowering and creative way on screen. We want to see ourselves become the hero and not always the villain. We want to be seen as royalty or as important and of value to the world.
    • We have the talent to create film and we want to use our talents to make stories that serves as a constant reminder to the kid in everyone around the world. We want to show them that it doesn't matter where you come from or what you look like. You can still make a difference in this world. 
    • There is beauty and greatness in all and not few. We're building a platform for our company to one day be able to green-light, produce and develop many new diverse stories told on screen today.

    The power is in the hands of the people, the fans and ultimately the supporters. You are the ones that can make anything possible in this world. Your demands create the opportunities and jobs for the many creators of this world.  We need you and we greatly appreciate your willingness to help us. Thank you and much love to you all!

    It starts with this campaign, but it doesn't end here. The build will always continue. 

     

     

     

     

    • We are working with good talent to create and produce these projects. We have the experience,the know-how and now we just need your support! =D
    • We have four projects that should be completed by the end of this year or by early next year. You will be able to see these projects in it's final completion once you've joined our family.
    • If anything unexpected arises, you'll be the first to know. We'll be sure to have great communication with you, our supporters, to make sure things are going smoothly. We can't wait for you to see the animations we're working on!!

     

     

    We know that there are some people who may not be in a position to contribute with money, it's okay, please just help us get the word out to make noise about this campaign.

     

     

     

    Designed for Zombie Walk Music Video.
story_txt:
WEBSITE ANIMATION PAGE:
 https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/adventurousmindsanimationwork






Adventurous Minds LLC is an American film studio that develops and produces animated television programming, featured and short films.​  Our studio started in 2012, but officially became a business in January of 2017.  We worked on an short animation for the Jackson 5 documentary on Joe Jackson. Character design working alongside Pixel Pirate Studio for American hip hop artist "Desiigner" in one of his later music videos called "Zombie Walk". We also worked on a project called "Primus 7", which was a story developed by an NBA player who wanted to create more diverse content in the media of Animation.

WEBSITE HOME PAGE: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Here at Adventurous Minds LLC we're currently developing 4 Animation short stories and we need your help with funds to push these projects through to the finish line. In return for your support, we would love to create an Online Animation Course program that shows you our step-by-step process.

Short Animation 1-2: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/single-post/2018/11/02/2-PART-ANIMATION-SHORT
Short Animation 3: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/single-post/2018/10/30/PROGENY-American-web-television-series 
Short Animation 4: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/single-post/2018/10/30/PLANET-RISE-RPG-ANIMATION-TRAILER

This course will only be to those who support. For those who donate to our higher perks, will be granted with extra features/behind the scenes from either of the four projects once released. There are special things that are provided in each perk other than the Animation course itself. So be sure to read our perks!

 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Responsible for manifesting this course is a couple of studs who are taking this opportunity to meld their creative juices together into something extraordinary... and you're all invited! =D
We need your help in order to bring these projects to fruition. We cannot do this without you, the backers, the Supporters, the real MVP's!
 

The Animation Course program will contain about 4-6 tutorial episodes or even more depending on how much we fund for this campaign. We're calling it series 1 and each episode will run about 25-35 minutes long, documenting our step-by-step process showing you how we create an animation scene!
 This could give back to so many aspiring artists that have nothing but love and passion for this career field and they want to learn more about it. Maybe one day, these very same people will put their own mark on some of the most wonderful films and shows to come.
The animation course will cover how we use the following programs; Photoshop and After Effects.

 
First our focus will cover how we animate using Photoshop. We'll show you our step by step process and then break down our animation process. The break down would cover all the bases such as; storyboarding to recording the reference for the particular animation cut, then move on to key poses and then finally animating the rough.
 

Then we move into After Effects and from there we'll show you how we compose and organize the animation frames. The big focus here will be on timing. We'll show you how we time our animation cuts in order to get the right flow in speed. 

Then out of all of that effort comes this: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
Adventurous Minds LLC is headed by Prince Smith and Lamont Pounds.​
What has brought them to want to become filmmakers and create their very own production company?
"As kids we didn't often see people who look like us and our Hispanic cousin's in the light on the big screen.The only people of color we see are the basic stereotype or characters who didn't represent a positive or empowering image figure. So here we are now. We feel representation is very important and everyone deserves to feel like they are of value in this world. We just simply want to lend our talent's to do our part in making that change become a great one. "
"We believe we can have a positive influence not only in this industry but on many people across the world" 
OUR PURPOSE BLOG: https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/single-post/2016/08/24/OUR-PURPOSE

This campaign is about building a community to help make a differences in the world of Animation and film in general. We've always wanted to see different type of characters from different backgrounds that brace the screen with their uniqueness, beauty and to be the main attraction of a film.  



You will be helping us achieve the possibility to build a platform for our studio to be in a position to one day green-light and produce many new diverse animation stories told on the screen today. 

 Also If this campaign is successfully funded it will possibly pave the way for us to pursue other projects to further the Adventurous Minds universe. It will give us the opportunity to work on additional series that we have written and developed personally.

 https://www.adventurousmindsstudio.com/lightanime
 


 
We know you, as supporters of great anime, have interest and would love to see more diverse stories/characters involved in the animation realm. We also love the idea that you guys want to be involved and you want to see a project come to life from start to finish.


 

What We Need & What You'll Get
So the money is not only to build the Animation online course, it is also going to help support our team as we produce and develop our current projects at hand. Also depending on how much money we raise for the campaign, we will be able to produce our new anime series called "Light". 

If we don't reach the entire goal we set for the campaign, we'll just produce as many behind the scenes/process tutorials as we can with the funds we raise. We'll still want to give back to those who supports us even if it's just one person that backs us.
 The funds will have an impact on how much we'll be able to give back and that's just the truth. In order to build this course, we need the funds so that we can work to complete the projects we are currently developing, so that we can document and record the behind the scenes process.

 
This course is being made so that more students, kids, aspiring artists and entrepreneurs could have more opportunities to learn and to be inspired to go out and also do what they love. Our Animation Courses will shed a light on how Japanese Traditional Animators animate.

This is an opportunity for them to maybe learn something new on animation and how it works, and how to improve their craft so that they can have a better chance to get a job in today's entertainment industry. Perhaps it can even put them on a path to create their own company that can completely change the industry. For us, Adventurous Minds, this is bigger than creating a course, it's about influencing those who care and want to have a positive impact of their own in the creative world. 

 
 Also we want to be able to work on something that sparks our passion and have the end result be something we and you can be proud of. We are coming to indiegogo because it gives our supporters  the unique opportunity to be involved and take part of something special and bigger than animation it self. We want something that can actually have a real impact on this industry. 
 
 
 

 

 
 Backers who pledge $50 & UP will also have digital download access to any future animation projects that we produced, such as "LIGHT". 

 

 The Difference your contribution will make:
 Why is this project valuable to the contributor and to the world?
 

Film is important, films are stories that are shared with the world, it influences generations, it uplifts, it inspires, it educates, it imports all sorts of values and sparks creativity to it's viewers. Film moves the soul and it resonates with people worldwide. This is why representation in film and in the media itself is so important.
Film has been a constant way to tell stories about the human experience in many different and creative ways. It becomes an issue when it doesn't represent the many different and creative human beings that are usually not in these stories.
As we said before,we create because we feel that it is very important that people of all kinds have the same opportunities to experience a reflection of themselves and people like themselves to be represented in such an empowering and creative way on screen. We want to see ourselves become the hero and not always the villain. We want to be seen as royalty or as important and of value to the world.
We have the talent to create film and we want to use our talents to make stories that serves as a constant reminder to the kid in everyone around the world. We want to show them that it doesn't matter where you come from or what you look like. You can still make a difference in this world. 
There is beauty and greatness in all and not few. We're building a platform for our company to one day be able to green-light, produce and develop many new diverse stories told on screen today.


The power is in the hands of the people, the fans and ultimately the supporters. You are the ones that can make anything possible in this world. Your demands create the opportunities and jobs for the many creators of this world.  We need you and we greatly appreciate your willingness to help us. Thank you and much love to you all!
It starts with this campaign, but it doesn't end here. The build will always continue. 
 
 
 



 

We are working with good talent to create and produce these projects. We have the experience,the know-how and now we just need your support! =D
We have four projects that should be completed by the end of this year or by early next year. You will be able to see these projects in it's final completion once you've joined our family.
If anything unexpected arises, you'll be the first to know. We'll be sure to have great communication with you, our supporters, to make sure things are going smoothly. We can't wait for you to see the animations we're working on!!

 


 
We know that there are some people who may not be in a position to contribute with money, it's okay, please just help us get the word out to make noise about this campaign.

 
  



Designed for Zombie Walk Music Video.

story:
The series will include 15 episodes all between 30-45 minutes long.

Ep. 1  Tools and Safety. We have finished and released the first episode to show people we are serious about this project and to give a taste of what they will look like. You can watch the full episode here, or check out this teaser:

 

Ep. 2 Design and Layout (and using reclaimed material)

Ep. 3 Trailers and Foundations

Ep. 4 Framing and Sheathing

Ep. 5 Doors and Windows (Here's a clip we recently shot)

 

Ep. 6 Siding, Flashing, and Roofing (Here's a clip we recently shot)

 

Ep  7 Electricity and Solar

Ep. 8 Plumbing and Gas

Ep. 9 Insulation and Vapor barrier

Ep. 10 Drywall and Tongue&Groove (Choices for interior walls)

Ep. 11 Trim and Flooring

Ep. 12 Bathrooms  (Toilets and Tiling)

Ep. 13 Kitchens (Counters, Cabinets, and Appliances)

Ep. 14 Custom Furniture (Murphy Beds and more)

Ep. 15  Wrapping things up (inc. Bylaws and Codes)

The series will follow us as we build a tiny house based on our Winter Wonderland house (watch video below). However, we will show you other projects in these videos so that in the end, you will be able to better build any style house you desire.

By backing this campaign, you'll receive 35% off the final price ($195 USD) of these videos!

Member Forums

If you pledge at the $25 level or higher you will get access to a members-only Forum where members of our team and other builders will answer your questions and share tips. 

Meet the Team

We recently put together a video introducing the staff at Nelson Tiny Houses

 

By backing this campaign, you are helping to make this movement grow by making the tiny house dream accessible to tons of people who cannot afford to hire someone or may not have the confidence they need to take the project on.....With these videos, we hope people sitting on the fence will jump off and start building! 

Even donating a dollar will get us a bit closer to making the highest quality tiny house building videos we possibly can.

Thank you for your time and support! ☺

Warmly, Seth & the Nelson Tiny House team

story:
UPDATED: Our Festival Journey

Since January of 2019, Awkwardly has been on the international festival circuit with marvelous acclaim. We've been celebrated in Italy, Germany, South Korea and right here at home with a bevy of wins & nominations for Best Comedy, Best Writing, Best Directing, Best Ensemble Cast & more!

We maintain our InDemand campaign to supplement this thrilling adventure. Our festival submission fees, marketing, and travel/accomodation costs are beyond the scope of our intitial crowdfunded production budget. We want to ensure that Awkwardly is represented in as many rooms and markets as possible, and this global platform increases our audience, as well as the potential interest in distribution. 

Our team filmed 100 pages of dialogue (aka: 20 episodes), directed by 9 incredible ladies, in 18 locations, featuring 31 actors... and we had an absolute blast! Thanks a million to our 141 original backers for seeing us through production and our Tribeca Screening Room Premiere!  Will you join us in taking Awkwardly to the next level?

 

THANK YOU ALL for your time and consideration in supporting this female-driven, original series with the most beautiful collaboration of artists imaginable. We can't wait to make you proud!

 

Best Wishes & Many Thanks,

The Awkwardly Family

 

[You can watch our award-winning episodes by clicking on our PLAYLIST at: 

facebook.com/AwkwardlySeries OR tuning into our channel: vimeo.com/channels/awkwardly

 Follow our exciting journey on Instagram & Twitter @awkwardlyseries ]

 

**********************************************************************************

OUR ORIGNAL PRODUCTION CAMPAIGN

Thank You for tuning in! As you can see, this is a delightful group and we're thrilled you'd consider supporting our production! 

The Spark

This whole thing started when Nikki, our creator/producer, was issued a friendly dare from a super successful colleague, named Jason. "Write the project only you could write, and make it the BEST thing you possibly can." She wrestled with what that might be... till she thought about her friends. Writing with these exquisite people in mind, "Awkwardly" caught fire... and to Nikki's amazement, each marvelous human jumped aboard the adventure. BOOM! Here we go!!

The Show

An original series about how life's awkward moments connect us all. A mighty, pocket-sized, universal dramedy from NY with love. 

The Vibe

Quirky. Vibrant. Endearingly flawed. Think "High Maintenance", Netflix's "Easy", "Master of None",  and "Friends From College".

The Structure

20 principal actors in a chain of 20 short-form episodes that comes full circle. 

The Music

We have kick-ass music from Emmy-nominated composer, Scooter Pietsch and a one-of-a-kind theme song performed by the outstanding Erin and Her Cello!

The Timeline

We film for 10 days between Mid-October and Mid-December and will premiere the series...well, as soon as it's ready. Ha! (Ideally, spring.)

The Plan

Wherever possible, we'll borrow/ barter for costumes, props & locations. Our showrunner has volunteered her time and edit services. Our spectacular cast will work under the SAG-Aftra New Media contract for deferred pay. These magical people SHOW UP and SHINE!! With your support, we can ALL have a hand in creating Awkwardly! 

The Budget

Insurance : General Liability, Third Party Property and Worker's Comp. = $1,000

Crew: Directors, Director of Photography, Assistant Director, and Sound Recordist = $6,500

Equipment Rental: Lights, Camera and Sound = $4,000

Locations: $2,500

Meals: $1,000

Total: $15,000

The Next Step

There are several ways to support us: 

1. Any contribution you make will make UNICORNS WEEP WITH JOY! Every bit brings us nearer to achieving our goal and we can't wait to make you proud collaborators.

2. Any buzz you spread via Twitter, Facebook, or a good ol' fashioned mention- broadens our reach. Everyone loves bingeing on new shows. Tell a friend who digs making them HAPPEN! 

3. Stay tuned. Follow us on social media! [Twitter: @AwkwardlySeries and @okwebseries - The WC production company. We follow back! Facebook: facebook.com/okwebseries.] Be an active part of our community. We look forward to hearing from you! 

Once more, THANK YOU for your time and consideration. We're honored to share this adventure with you...

Follow us on social media! [Twitter: @AwkwardlySeries and @okwebseries - The WC production company. We follow back! Facebook: facebook.com/okwebseries.] Be an active part of our community. We look forward to hearing from you! Once more, THANK YOU for your time and consideration. We're honored to share this adventure with you...

story:
DeadFish Productions is a production company focused on quality production value and integrity.  With a passion for Indie Film Making and the skill set of many Film, Fashion, and Entertainment Professionals; we developing Excellence! At DeadFish we have a solidified a full vision and plan for the Production of "Lil' Mary"!

This once written book will now be adapted into an Independent Series filled with Creole Funerary Culture as we expose hidden stigmas within the black community such as Colorism, Depression, Voodoo, Money, and Power.  Another element that makes "Lil' Mary" an amazing show is the fact that mass audiences get the chance to experience Mary Sr.( Mother of Lil Mary) a Woman of Color; running a very lucrative and successful business in Los Angeles from 1947-1975. In this Independent Series, we plan to educate the masses on the impact and the Actualizations of Lil' Mary's Legacy in African American Experience. Starting with Lil' Mary's grandfather J.T Stone; he founded "J.T Stone Mortuary " of Culture Louisiana in 1886.  J.T Stone is responsible for the Education of Funerary Insurance for Negros, and served under Booker T. Washington in the fight for rights to educate Negros of the 1800's on all societal fronts. 

This campaign is for the Pilot to be shot, filmed, produced, and edited in it's entirety, with prospects to pitch to major distribution. With our full team of professionals we need an initial $250,000.00 investment, which entails establishing focus teams to procure excellence in every aspect of Lil' Mary as an Independent Series .

As a THANK YOU ! We at DeadFish have our Lil' Mary implantation! a variety of T-Shirts Hoodies Base Ball Caps, note pads, Pins OF COURSE! but what is the real prize in Funding a Hollywood Film Production? Actually SEEING THE PRODUCTION! Thats right! our TOP 5 DONORS GET A CHANCE TO BE ON SET WITH THE CAST AND CREW IN THE MIDST OF THE MAGIC! Make your Bid Either Way!!

On behalf of DeadFish and Mary Ross Smith; We would like to Thank You! We appriciate and are very grateful for your contributions! Other than the many lives you will singlehandedly saving supporting this project, we have faith in your own journey, your life will be changed from watching the same show, YOU helped start!

story:
NMI:  We're producing 92 musical theatre internet videos and two mainstage musicals at the 2019 Hollywood Fringe Festival.  Can you help us with‑‑

 

YOU:  Wait -- did you say 92 videos?

 

NMI:  Yes.  We've been working round the clock on our new greenscreen studio since we renovated it last summer.  We've already shot 38 internet shorts, with another 54 planned...creating four separate musical webseries, working through the Screen Actors' New Media Agreement.

 

YOU:  You've shot 38 videos already...can I see some of them?

 

NMI:  Sure.  Here's a link:    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vHv8RSzerUU  You can see excerpts from of Tales From a Darkening Wood (myths, fairy tales, spooky yarns), The Ghosts of Stowell Hill (the ghosts speak to us from the graveyard, sharing directly with us their confessions, memories, or stories), and The Last of Its Kind (stories about final moments, good and bad, such as the last night before going off to college, or the final payment on a house, or the final letter of Captain Scott from the Antarctic).  The fourth series, Trunk Songs, we just started shooting, and don't have edited peeks to sneak.

 

YOU:  You guys are amazing.  How're you doing that?

 

NMI:  Our stoic staff has been doubling as crew members:  running sound, lights, editing, post-production, special effects, etc.  Plus, you know Elise...she's a creative workhorse and is the star of maybe a dozen of the episodes.

 

YOU:  Sounds exhausting.  How can I help?

 

NMI:  We need some money to pay for: editors, costumes, lighting crew, sound crew, directors, and stagehands.

 

YOU:  Glad to help!  Anything else?

 

NMI:  As a matter of fact...thanks for asking.  As if producing 92 videos wasn't enough, we're also producing two (count 'em TWO) Mainstage productions at the 2019 Hollywood Fringe Festival:  The Bully Problem, written by Michael Shapiro, winner of NMI's 2018 Search for New Musicals; and we're partnering with Smart Media LLC for the musicalization of Hell's Kitty, based on the hit internet series and now Amazon Prime Video movie.

YOU:  Can I see some of that?

 

NMI:  You can see Hell's Kitty movie on Amazon Prime.  If you want to see the musical,

YOU:  Sounds fantastic.  I want to help you make your goal.  I'll go find the right combination of perk/donation right now!

 

NMI:  Mwah!

story:
After working on numerous film projects, Tony and I came together to give life to a story that focuses on one man's ethical dilemmas while grieving from a personal loss. Our film breaks down the preconceived ideas of how parents view their children and when regret comes at a high personal loss. The original writing in STRANGERS casts a light on social issues that are very prevalent in our modern day society. Growing up, several of our cast and crew members experienced negative social ramifications because of their gender and/or sexual preferences. STRANGERS aims to explore, share, and create a discussion regarding the outcome of such upbringings.

Everyone who worked on this project: creating original music for STRANGERS, writing the script, scouting locations, shooting the footage and our director Albert who spent countless hours going through and editing all the footage, did so pro bono. We pulled our resources together and funded this teaser we hope you enjoy. With the proper funding, we can hire a bigger crew, be able to film on set and pay for all the equipment we need to turn STRANGERS into a series. Thank you so much from the whole cast and crew of STRANGERS for your support.

story:
About the Project

  • My name is Coop Lee, I've been swordfighting for over 10 years, creating and promoting swordfighting videos through my Youtube/Facebook Channel, TUSSLES, for three years, and building a platform and brand that can be utilized by all Modern Sword Sports as an exploratory, promotional tool.
  • This project is to specifically video document Team USA in all her glory (particularly 5v5 melee combat) while at Battle of the Nations 2017 and give you, the audience, fans, and family, an unprecedented perspective of the event and action.
  • Contributions to this project are NOT ONLY going towards Battle of the Nations and steel combat videos of our friends and rivals, but will help fund and network future TUSSLES endeavors in other swordfighting styles and organizations, like that of foam-fighting (Belegarth/Dagorhir/Amtgard).

What I Need & What You Get

  • I'm asking for $1500 dollars to cover travel expenses to Spain, and the investment I made on T-Shirts/Stickers.
  • These are the first TUSSLES T-Shirts to be offered to fans and subscribers, who have patiently waited for awesome swag for some time. The shirts and stickers are of high quality and a great way to rep the Tuss!
  • There is also an option to directly contribute to the making of your own promotional Fighter, Team, or Event Spotlight Videos through this project. Investing in this will ensure future content and videos to promote the vast world of swordfighters and events.
  • If I surpass the goal, any extra money will go towards getting to future swordfighting events and investing in a new computer to edit video on (because over the course of shooting and editing my last 100 videos, I've realized how crucial a good editing computer is!)

The Impact

  • This project is first and foremost to promote modern sword sports, particularly steel melee combat or Historical Medieval Combat (HMB).
  • Secondly, its to further develop and explore the TUSSLES brand which seeks to ensure a platform of promotion for sword sports with its many styles, disciplines, organizations, and events.
  • I was lucky enough to accompany Team USA to last year's Battle of the Nations and produce over 20 videos and 1000 photos for them. Even quit my day job to go, because the opportunity was too amazing to pass up. Not to mention I have met many awesome people from all over who I can say will be my friends for life.

Risks & Challenges

  • Once again I may have to quit my day job to get the time off to travel to Spain, but that is no matter, because the Tuss is a must!
  • Last year's Battle of the Nations had its learning curves when it came to properly capture a steel melee fight on handheld video and how to promote the content to the community (I was like the AV club nerd getting asked to prom by the Varsity Cheerleading Captain). But I have picked up some tricks and acquaintances along the way which will make me stronger and more versatile in coming video-making excursions.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Some of you can't contribute, and that's ok ;) But getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign goes a long way. Anything helps!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and help me spread the word!
  • Thank you!! And remember, #TheTussIsAMust!

story:
The Story

Our main character, Naeemah, a young black woman who attended predominantly white schools all her life, gets expelled from Yale University during her junior year, and transfers to Howard University in Washington, DC. Shortly after her arrival, she realizes the grass isn't always greener on the other side; because even amongst her own people, she still feels out of place. Naeemah has two roommates, Brittanie and Mufﬁn, who have recently graduated from Howard University, and are both hurdling obstacles during their transition into adulthood. This series shows 3 different women, from 3 vastly different backgrounds, come together in support of one another. 3 Blind Mice illustrates the physical and mental diversity among black millennials; while implementing 90's television nostalgia.

WHAT YOU WILL HELP US ACHIEVE 

The money raised from this campaign will be used to film the pilot episode of 3 Blind Mice; which will be pitched to various networks and production companies. Independent film making is one of the most important steps to empowering Black people by reflecting our communities' stories in one of the most public spaces. By contributing to the production of 3 Blind Mice, you will be an intrigual part in greatly enhancing diverse Black representation in the media. You will help cultivate developing Black film makers and empower us to be our best selves by way of reflection, discussion, and action. By increasing representation of Black people in the media, we will all work to enhance our communities by looking back to where we've been, to inform where we are presently, and how we will grow in the future.

WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES

Your contribution will assist us with:

  • Traveling our Cast & Crew from: LA & NYC to Baltimore & D.C.
  • Post Production, Editing & Sound
  • Film Equipment
  • Lodging
  • Food & Accommodations

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use the funds we have raised, and contribute it to our production.

The Creative Team

Imani Nia Robinson is an Actor, Writer, Creator, and Producer, who  hails out of Baltimore, Maryland. At the early age of 9 years old, Imani knew her calling. She starred in her first play in the third grade, and continued to create ever since. Acting was her first passion, having acted in countless plays, and booking roles on HBO's The Wire & The Deuce. Wanting to express her own creativity, she immersed herself in her own writing, and discovered an additional talent. 

After graduating from the California Institute of the Arts, Imani continued to exercise her craft, and matriculated at UCLA's Professional Program in Screenwriting. Imani became the Writers' Office Assistant on HBO's The Deuce, providing her more insight on the production side of this industry. Imani is excited to bring her vision into fruition, and is MOST thankful for your support!

Producer Ayana Parker Morrison is an Actor and Producer also hailing from Baltimore, Md. After graduating with a degree in Drama from NYU Tisch School of the Arts, she decided to move behind the scenes in production. Ayana has produced independent theatre as well as short form films. Her film credits include Eleven Two-Oh Three (written and directed by Jeremy Accime), which is a short about police brutality in East Flatbush, Brooklyn. She has also line produced several shorts for Stonestreet Studios in New York, NY. Ayana is currently Producing Fellow at the New York Theatre Workshop as a part of their new 2050 Artistic Fellowship Program.

The Impact

At this moment, there are no television shows that cater specifically to Black millennials. 3 Blind Mice is here to fill that need. From the interviews and research we conducted, one major conclusion that can be drawn is: there is without a doubt an audience who feels that they are lacking programming that speaks specifically to their experiences as young Black people coming into their own as adults. Art gives us the ability to reflect a vision of the world. We can then use this reflection to reconcile who we are with who we want to be. By seeing ourselves on television in the way that many other cultures and ethnicities get to see their communities represented, we can learn from where we've been and reach our greatest potential as we grow. As the message of Sankofa suggests to us, we must look to our past to inform our present and future. We look at past representations of Black culture such as, A Different World, to inform our current experiences and use that information and our imaginations to create a new kind of world for ourselves. 

3 Blind Mice will add to the long legacy of Black TV shows that have shaped our culture and communities while also contributing new voices to the conversation of what Blackness is. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Our team is so very thankful for your support! There are many ways to contribute to 3 Blind Mice. You can share this campaign with friends, family, and other Black 90's television enthusiasts to help spread the word and support 3 Blind Mice coming to life.

Please also like and follow our social media pages to stay up to date with new developments and our progress in bringing this new vision to fruition!

 Thank you kindly!

              Photos by: @Blackbookla_

story:
I am a paranormal researcher and filmmaker - there's a particular location that has grabbed my attention over the years, and I've unraveled layers to this location. To complete the work and to release it for all to view, I am calling on the support of fellow paranormal enthusiasts.

 

Donations made will go towards equipment, travel, and production costs. If this documentary is a success, it will reveal things far beyond the typical way we see the paranormal today. Any donation is appreciated.

story:
We are Coleman Films, the two brothers and amazing film crew that brought
you "Halloween Inferno" and "Inferno Part II".  Our love for film making
started at a very young age watching the original John Carpenter’s Halloween.
In a way, that movie started our careers because the first couple of movies
we made at the ages of 11 and 12 were our own versions of Halloween. We
filmed them in the backyard, the basement, wherever we could, but they
definitely were not very good.

As the years went on, we began making our own original horror films. Fast
forwarding to today, we have worked on and produced multiple movies including
distributed works such as “We are Still Here” and “Book of Evil”. We now
own a production company that has been very successful in Rochester, New
York.

The reason we decided to start crowdfunding for part 3 is because of how
well "Halloween Inferno" was received by the fans. We wanted to make a Part
2 that was even better than the first one to bring the fans of Halloween
(much like ourselves) what they want. Parts 1 and 2 were financed out of
our own pockets and as much as we would love to make a Part 3, production
costs are very expensive and to do it right we need *your help*.

Our goal is to raise enough to cover the basic costs of making a film the
fans want to see. It has always been our dream to work on a Halloween film set
and we want to make something so good that Hollywood will have no choice but
to get us involved in the next one.

See "Halloween Inferno" (part 1) here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SS09GXc4AZo&t=11s

See "Halloween Inferno" (part 2) here: 

https://youtu.be/IRfDyfFRVmo

 
 

Why Raise Funding?

We are looking to raise $20,000 to fund this 15-20 minute project. The team
came up with this number after adding up the expenses from the first two
installments that were done out of pocket.

The films were both filmed on industry standard cinema cameras, lenses and
lighting equipment all rented from local production companies. For us to
maintain the quality of the inferno series rentals are a must have.

This money will also go to paying and feeding our extensive cast and
crew for their hard work and dedication. Locations will be a big part of
the budget as we needed to rent multiple locations for several days
for each film. Your contributions will go a long way in pushing production
forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

The positive feedback from the fans of our first installment of Halloween
Inferno is what inspired us to keep going with the story. We are all fans
working on this project and it is such an amazing feeling to see the
reaction to what we created. We want to keep going, so if you like what we
have made, feel free to share it with your friends and people you know.
Spreading the word is an amazing way to help us out on this project and
future ones as well.

 

Big Productions

Enjoy some Behind the Scenes pictures below that will show you the amount of work that goes into productions like Halloween Inferno Parts I & II....
story_txt: We are Coleman Films, the two brothers and amazing film crew that broughtyou "Halloween Inferno" and "Inferno Part II".  Our love for film makingstarted at a very young age watching the original John Carpenter’s Halloween.In a way, that movie started our careers because the first couple of movieswe made at the ages of 11 and 12 were our own versions of Halloween. Wefilmed them in the backyard, the basement, wherever we could, but theydefinitely were not very good.As the years went on, we began making our own original horror films. Fastforwarding to today, we have worked on and produced multiple movies includingdistributed works such as “We are Still Here” and “Book of Evil”. We nowown a production company that has been very successful in Rochester, NewYork.The reason we decided to start crowdfunding for part 3 is because of howwell "Halloween Inferno" was received by the fans. We wanted to make a Part2 that was even better than the first one to bring the fans of Halloween(much like ourselves) what they want. Parts 1 and 2 were financed out ofour own pockets and as much as we would love to make a Part 3, productioncosts are very expensive and to do it right we need *your help*.Our goal is to raise enough to cover the basic costs of making a film thefans want to see. It has always been our dream to work on a Halloween film setand we want to make something so good that Hollywood will have no choice butto get us involved in the next one.See "Halloween Inferno" (part 1) here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SS09GXc4AZo&t=11sSee "Halloween Inferno" (part 2) here: https://youtu.be/IRfDyfFRVmo  Why Raise Funding?We are looking to raise $20,000 to fund this 15-20 minute project. The teamcame up with this number after adding up the expenses from the first twoinstallments that were done out of pocket.The films were both filmed on industry standard cinema cameras, lenses andlighting equipment all rented from local production companies. For us tomaintain the quality of the inferno series rentals are a must have.This money will also go to paying and feeding our extensive cast andcrew for their hard work and dedication. Locations will be a big part ofthe budget as we needed to rent multiple locations for several daysfor each film. Your contributions will go a long way in pushing productionforward.Other Ways You Can HelpThe positive feedback from the fans of our first installment of HalloweenInferno is what inspired us to keep going with the story. We are all fansworking on this project and it is such an amazing feeling to see thereaction to what we created. We want to keep going, so if you like what wehave made, feel free to share it with your friends and people you know.Spreading the word is an amazing way to help us out on this project andfuture ones as well. Big ProductionsEnjoy some Behind the Scenes pictures below that will show you the amount of work that goes into productions like Halloween Inferno Parts I & II....

story:
Code\Switch is a series that follows a young computer programmer, Toyin, who’s working quietly on the backend of a…. well, annoying dating app start-up while trying to escape her past life as a notorious hacker.  It’s a story about her, and girls like her, who feel the need to lay-low in a world that has never really made a place for them to stand out.

 

Hi! You’ve found your way to the Code\Switch Indiegogo page and we’re so happy that you have. We can’t wait to share our project with you. We’ve made five episodes of our first mini-series for you to enjoy, but we need your help in finishing the story.

 

Representation is important. If you're reading this, you probably already know that. You understand that culture can often be the foundation for what a person thinks they’re capable of, or, alternatively, what they think they’re allowed to be. Luckily, the cultural landscape is changing, and new narratives are being told in a multitude of formats, largely because of technology. In our culture, technology has always acted as a symbol of hope and change, a democratizing force meant to even the playing field. 

However, while technology has made the impossible possible, it still hasn’t erased oppression. On national and global scales, it’s still more difficult to walk through this world as a racialized person, as a queer person, or as a woman, but most especially if you’re all three, like Toyin. Maybe part of that is inevitable, but maybe another part is because despite all the rhetoric surrounding technology, tech companies (like most companies) still lack diversity on a large scale. 

Code/Switch is a story about a queer, Black woman in tech, but moreover it’s a story about empowerment. It’s about someone who has the power to be herself, the power to notice injustice, and the power to fight back against it. It is a labour of love by some of the most talented, diverse, socially-conscious people I know, focused on giving voice and agency to a demographic that usually isn’t given either. So whether you’re here to support a diversity and representation, or just because the trailer caught your eye and you’re interested in seeing where things go, please, please support this project, and I promise you will not be disappointed.

 

The first thing we want to do is get Code\Switch in front of as many eyes as possible. We hope to take our project to festivals, pitch markets and screenings all over Canada and the U.S! 

With five episodes in the books, we are already so happy with this crazy, wonderful thing we’ve created. But after dropping the trailer, one thing became immediately clear to us; we’re nowhere near done yet. For anyone who’s seen all five episodes already, we obviously leave on a bit of a cliffhanger. We expected our audience to be curious about what happens after Toyin’s big move, but we didn’t expect our fans (and it’s crazy that we can say “fans” now) to literally demand a resolution to the story. So, of course, that’s what we plan to do. We’re currently writing and storyboarding five fresh new episodes to wrap up the Toyin story, but even then, we won’t be done. 

Our plan is to give the Hogtown treatment to a whole array of characters from different races, sexualities, and backgrounds. We want everyone to be able to see themselves and their stories on the screen. We’ve got exciting plans for characters such as:

Linn
Toyin’s insanely beautiful and impossibly brilliant best friend who spends far too much of her time keeping her lives as a PhD scholar and Toronto baddie glamour model as separate as possible. Afraid of her traditional Chinese parent’s reaction to some of her life choices, and to her recent mixed-race relationship, Linn feels her walls closing in as she emerges as the target of a vicious DeepFake attack.

Danny
Small town girl Danny is new to the big city. After ending the only relationship she’s ever known, she packs up and moves to Toronto to start fresh, redefine herself and uncover the truth behind her best friend’s recent suicide. Only then can she finally move on. 

Caleb
A fuckboy. No two ways around it. But one who genuinely doesn’t want to be anymore. We follow his journey towards earning a second chance and if, at the end, there’s anyone left willing to give it to him.

As well as explore the stories of Code\Switch Characters like Matt, Dean, June and Robin! 

 

This is the part where we ask you for money. If you’re not in a position to support us financially, that’s totally fine. Just be watching, reading here, and sharing our project with your friends and family you’re helping us out A LOT. But if you’re considering supporting us, here’s what your contribution is going to help us do:

Code\Switch was made by a cast and crew of professional level creatives who donated their time, resources and energy to the project because they were passionate about the story and believed in its future. The first thing we want to do is thank them for their wonderful help and make sure we can compensate them fairly for the second half of it. 

We’d also love to get Code\Switch in front of as many eyes as possible. That means taking it to festivals, pitch markets, and screens all over Canada and in the United States. We’re totally down for the road-trip, but it cost money to apply to these festivals. With your help, we’d like to apply to as many events as possible!

Your contributions will go a long way in supporting our vision!

story:
WHAT IS IT?

Cinephile Ridge is a 10-minute horror comedy short.
Check out the ripomatic for it HERE.

In it, Jalinda, a pragmatic young woman and Psychology major, is dragged out to the set of a student film in a remote forest. Her handsome film buff boyfriend, the ever-optimistic Keith, promised her a nice, peaceful weekend away from all the stresses of school. Unfortunately Keith’s immature best friend, horror fanatic Derek, is along for the ride. And he isn’t very pumped about Jalinda encroaching on their bro time.

On the drive to the set, they smoke herb and tell urban legends about the haunted woods where they’re headed. Little do they know, the stories are true and the rest of their crew has already become a part of the horror film they’re making.

WHO ARE WE?

Two years ago, smoking on a Bluff overlooking Marina del Rey, Bluff Puff Productions was born. Started by a group of graduate film students in Loyola Marymount University’s Writing and Producing TV program, Bluff Puff employs all we have learned in and outside the classroom. We create regular online content, including comedy sketches and the scifi-stoner webseries, Power Trip. All of these are available on our Vimeo Page.

Cinephile Ridge is just the tip of the iceberg. Our little production company has been producing more and more content and we can’t wait to create longer and wilder pieces for everyone to enjoy. We plan is to take Cinephile Ridge to the festivals as a horror short film.

Plus, we know comedy. We laugh at ourselves all the time. Bluff Puff's Executive Producers are:

Eric Tate once got lost alone in the woods overnight. He never gave up hope.

Patrick Pitts has been chased by a moose – and survived to tell about it. He’s the real deal.

Elizabeth Stickley has beat nearly every post-apocalyptic video game. She can handle a cut scene.

Director of Photography Hunter Karas has filmed weddings, graduations, and cult rituals. 

The project will be written and directed by David Larkin. A lifelong fan of horror and comedy, David spent his formative years sneaking in Friday the 13th and Halloween viewings between episodes of The Simpsons and South Park. He’s always had an equal passion for making people laugh, and scaring the shit out of them. Now a grad student in the Writing and Producing Television program at LMU, he’s eager to put his unique perspective to good use. Building upon his previous work with Bluff Puff and on other projects, he aims to have Cinephile Ridge serve as the magnum opus of his time in film school. Plus, he made a horror film with other kids in his neighborhood when he was only ten, so you know he’s got the chops.

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

As graduate students, we know a thing or two about working on a tight budget and our goal is to make Cinephile Ridge for as little money as possible without sacrificing the quality of the project. Our budget of $9,000 will make a hilarious and horrific short film that we can be proud of and you can enjoy.

We have a fully itemized budget for the project and scene-by-scene shooting schedule, and we are confident we can stay within our proposed budget. Below you can see how the money will be distributed:
 



WHY DONATE TO US?

We’re Tough. Plain and simple, we know what to do in a horror movie situation. Whatever it may be: Mutant Sharks, Accidental Demon Summoning, Zombie Apocalypse, Killer in the House, Killer Outside the House, we’ve seen it all.

We Don’t Bluff. We are all beyond excited to make this project. In fact, we believe in it, so much so that we are all self-funding our own thesis projects so that we can focus all our crowdsourcing efforts on Cinephile Ridge to make it a festival-worthy piece of horror fiction.

We’ve Got the Stuff. We’ve been prepping this project for a year, rewriting the script, working on our budget, growing our personal equipment collection. All of our previous projects have been in preparation for this. We have our actors, our crew, our locations and our shooting dates ready, now we just need your help.

story:
Welcome to Groovy Tuesdays!

We're a musical comedy web series that follows three queer women navigating their way through their sexuality and friendships in Los Angeles. Think: A queer gal Flight of the Conchords!

The Creators:

Hi!  It's Nicole Ledoux and Abbey May, creators and cowriters of Groovy Tuesdays.  We realized that the roles we were booking in Los Angeles didn't allow us to be our full weird, funny, and queer selves...so why not write nuanced roles for ourselves and other queer actors that we know?

In real life (as in the series) we are roommates, LGBTQ+ community members, and best friends.  We both have a passion for witty bits and goofy songs which clearly comes through in our writing.  This silliness paired with our passion toward shining a spotlight on queer voices has come together to make a wonderfully palatable comedy series about the experience of coming out as bisexual.

Okay, so... why?

We've asked many members of our community for feedback on our script and story and what resonated most of all was there was a gap in the LGBTQ+ narrative for lighthearted material. Coming out is hard, but why not express that through some giggles and jingles? 

More importantly, we wanted to share how queerness is boldly and truly independent to each person's life experience. We wanted to create a story where our characters grapple with their lack of understanding on what it means to be queer altogether.

Where Your Money Is Going:

The money raised is going towards filming the pilot episode of Groovy Tuesdays.  

Why just one episode?  The pilot will be used as a "proof of concept" to present to streaming services, larger donors, and supporting organizations. Our series is in fact 9 episodes with 10 musical numbers! Big work ahead of us. Our best bet for some serious series-wide funding is to get support for this pilot...because a bigger budget means a better quality episode.  So by helping us film one episode you're helping us film them all!

What We Have:

  • Black Magic Cinema Camera 6k.
  • A director and 2 producers.
  • A fantastic cast!
  • Fully developed 9 part script with 10 songs.

Your contribution can count for:

  • Estimated minimum of $500.00 in filming permits in Los Angeles.
  • Estimated $2,000.00 in audio and lighting rentals.
  • Craft services, i.e. feeding everyone on set! roughly $20 per crew member (per day of shooting) plus-- snacks and water.
  • $650.00 in camera lenses and accessories.
  • $1,500.00-$2,000.00 in hiring additional crew members.

What are the Steaks?

You mean, stakes. It's okay, we knew what you meant. We are raising $6,000 to film a pilot with a quality that matches our ambitions.  That being said, we can still make a pilot episode with whatever money we end up raising. The more we raise, the better the content--Let's shoot for the Groovy Tuesdays stars!

Other Ways You Can Help

Low on your cash flow? We totally get it. 

  • Make a smaller than expected contribution, but ask 5-10 friends to match your contribution!
  • Share! This! Campaign! The more traction we get, the easier we can ask people outside our community for help.
  • Contact us. Let us know you have Groovy Tuesdays in mind. We can brainstorm ways to help together.

And that's all there is to it.

Our Main Characters:

NICOLE (The Beginner Queer) After an abrupt ending to a 5 year relationship, Nicole is ready to come out of the closet. She'll navigate her newfound bisexuality through bad dates and constant flashbacks from her past relationship.  She’s awkward, sincere, and sometimes a bit emotionally unstable. With a boost from her two best friends/roommates Abbey and Emily, she begins her journey as a single queer woman in LA.

ABBEY (The Novice Queer) Abbey has been out and proud for a few years, but when she meets cute Uber driver Toby and starts to catch feelings for him, she has to figure out where her place is in the LGBTQ community.  Avoidance is her best defense mechanism, and she will keep her new love life under wraps for as long as possible. She’s compassionate, zany, and loyal to a fault. She’s the embodiment of a golden retriever.

EMILY (The Expert Queer) Emily has “been there, done that” when it comes to all things LGBTQ.  She came out as a lesbian when she was in high school and has been dating ladies and theydies ever since.  However, her dating luck has run out since moving to LA. She’s been frustrated, lonely, and can’t seem to find her person.  Emily will try everything from dating apps to letting her two wacky roommates be her wing women in order to find love. She’s a huge stoner and doesn’t hesitate to give Abbey and Nicole a reality check.

Our Team!

Caroline Ullman (Director) A wildly talented director, producer, and writer.  Currently in post production for the web series, Freshly F*cked, which she wrote and directed. She writes for the sketch comedy group, "LapCat," and is no stranger to what it takes to create successful, funny, and resonant content.  

Johnny Turner (Executive Producer and Actor) Devoted producer and actor. After several years working in Film and Television Development, Johnny left the studio world to act and independently produce the projects close to his heart.  He is thrilled to be a part of the Groovy Tuesdays team and help bring it to a screen near you!

Jack Merline (Executive Producer) Having been in production for half a decade, Jack has filled every role behind the camera. He hopes to be remembered for his movies and bagel sandwiches.

The Rest of Our Cast (thus far):

Johnny Turner, Ashley Dixon, Lucia Towers, Lily Richards, Will Block, and Helya Salarvand. 

 

Thank you!

We're asking for help because this project means the world to us.  We appreciate any support you can give.

Our Team!
Caroline Ullman (Director) A wildly talented director, producer, and writer.  Currently in post production for the web series, Freshly F*cked, which she wrote and directed. She writes for the sketch comedy group, "LapCat," and is no stranger to what it takes to create successful, funny, and resonant content.  
Johnny Turner (Executive Producer and Actor) Devoted producer and actor. After several years working in Film and Television Development, Johnny left the studio world to act and independently produce the projects close to his heart.  He is thrilled to be a part of the Groovy Tuesdays team and help bring it to a screen near you!
Jack Merline (Executive Producer) Having been in production for half a decade, Jack has filled every role behind the camera. He hopes to be remembered for his movies and bagel sandwiches.
The Rest of Our Cast (thus far):

Johnny Turner, Ashley Dixon, Lucia Towers, Lily Richards, Will Block, and Helya Salarvand. 
 

Thank you!
We're asking for help because this project means the world to us.  We appreciate any support you can give.

story:
Origin Story

Hi, my name is Jason Farrington. Thanks for checking out my campaign. I've been passionate about film and TV ever since I was a little kid. Throughout high school and college I worked in the movie theater business, immersed in the film world and forever fascinated by visual storytelling.

For the last seven years, I worked as the media director for a missions organization and church in Madison, WI. During my time there, I was in charge of all live event production, put together documentaries about our work in Ghana, Africa, produced a music album, and helped create a short film called "Lifted".

Now a freelance photographer and videographer, I felt the time was right to create a project I've been wanting to make for many years.

Elementary Cooking is inspired by my brother's kindergarten class project from 25 years ago. Each child shared with the teacher their version of the recipe for their favorite meal and then created a cookbook. The results were hilarious. I always thought that this concept would make a great cooking show but never pursued it. Until now.

Recently my family and I found the original cookbook and after reading through it again, I knew I had to make the show. It went on the back burner for a little while, but now it's time to make this dream project come to life.

By supporting this project, you will be making a years-long dream become a reality and you'll be part of a community of people filled with joy and laughter produced by the simplicity and purity of children.

What We Need & What You Get

While an entire movie can now be shot on an iPhone these days, I want to step up the production value of Elementary Cooking.

The goal for this campaign is $3,000. The money will be used to get the remaining equipment needed to turn my kitchen into a TV set, pay for all of the food we'll be making, and of course, to send all of you amazing backers the cool perks we have set up.

Speaking of perks, here's a quick list of what's available to you as a backer: Social media shoutout, digital wallpaper, special thanks in the credits, digital copy of the pilot, fridge magnet, coffee mug, DVD of the pilot, T-shirt, and even executive producer credit.

Risks & Challenges

Every new undertaking has some level of risk and will undoubtedly run into challenges but I've come too far now to turn back. I will be doing everything in my power to help this show move forward and succeed. With a fully funded campaign, we'll be able to film 3 episodes with a plan to turn it into an ongoing series.

Other Ways You Can Help

While this endeavor is a dream of mine, it would be nothing if it weren't for people like you to watch and enjoy.

Whether or not you can support financially, there are other ways to support the show. 

Get the word out to your friends, family and social media networks. It's as easy as clicking the share buttons at the top of the page.

Also, follow Elementary Cooking on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter to stay up to date and be sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel.

Thanks again for checking out Elementary Cooking. I look forward to sharing it with you.

Jason Farrington

story:
Short Summary

Before FOXES Television there was FOXES Magazine, a magazine dedicated to all things men's fashion and rock n roll. The magazine is run by mother and son duo, Tina and Julian de la Celle, and has been successfully running in print for the last three years. This year, the idea sprung up to start some kind of television series showcasing the wide range of talent in the music and fashion worlds. The two main sources of inspiration? The early inception of MTV, and the Jim Jarmusch film Coffee and Cigarettes.

It's a show that revolves around an iconic duo, for example Mick Jagger and Martin Scorsese, and pairs them up in conversation. The content around that conversation includes: live sets with up and coming and already established bands, spotlights on fashion designers, backstage at fashion weeks and tour diaries with bands.

Attached to the project is Orian Williams who produced the BAFTA and CANNES winning film Control, directed by Anton Corbijn detailing the life and times of Joy Division frontman Ian Curtis. Other noteable credits include The Last Movie Star with Burt Reynolds and England Is Mine, a portrait of Morrissey and his early life in 1970s England. Also attached as a producer and music supervisor is musician Kevin Haskins of Bauhaus, Love and Rockets and Tones on Tail.

                                                         

 

 

What We Need

The show has peaked the interest of a well known actor and he is interested in pitching the project to Netflix and Amazon, but wants to see what we create in a 10-15 minute sizzle / pilot. We want to make the pilot the best it can be and have some incredible talent already confirmed but need the right budget to make it happen.

Here is a breakdown of costs for 2 days of shooting:

Equipment Rentals: $1500 a day.
Director of Photography: $750 a day.
Sound Recordist: $500 a day.
B Camera operator: $300 a day.
Gaffer / Lighting: $300 a day.
Craft Services / Food: $200 a day.
Production Assistant: $100 a day.

 

 

What You Get

To make things more interesting for our contributors, we've decided to hold a one-off Bauhaus raffle with a few exclusive signed items from drummer Kevin Haskins! Each raffle ticket is $10. The more you donate, the better your chances!


Example: $30 donation = 3 raffle tickets. There will be (4) winners announced November 22nd at 10:00pm (PST).

Here's what we will be raffling off:

- (1) Small print of your choice and (1) large print of your choice from Kevin's site: https://www.bauhausbook.com/ (Printed on premium archival matte photography paper, 260gsm. Signed by Kevin Haskins. Frame not included.)
 

 

- A signed copy of Kevin's book Bauhaus: Undead. 

 

 

- A signed one of a kind Bauhaus tour laminate from their "Near The Atmosphere" tour.

 

Our biggest Perk is a Daniel Ash signed Shecter black wood telecaster guitar which has been donated to the crowd-fund by Michael Ciravolo of Schecter Guitars! The guitar comes with the case. Due to the size and weight of the item we can only offer free shipping within the United States, outside of the United States must pay the shipping rates. Thank you!

 

 

The Impact

In just three years, we have successfully made FOXES Magazine a global name. Now imagine, in a world where so much is focused on the video format, even more so than print, what the impact could be for artists and visionaries! We have an eye for talent and have always strived to give these artists a platform to showcase themselves to a much larger audience than they would have before.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Obviously our biggest challenge is creating the show we envision it to be. It's going to take a lot of time, energy and creativity, but we know that it can be an incredible television show that helps artists from all over the globe.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute funds, we understand! Even a simple share to friends and family or on social media goes a long way.

story:
Who we are.

The concept for It's Personal! began one afternoon last summer when Alli Trussell and Amanda Bullis met at their friend Karen's bar for a drink after a long week of work. Amanda was late, severely sunburned, coming from sailing lessons she was taking for her personal assisting job. Alli was perfectly on time and two glasses of Chardonnay in. One drink turned into another as the two girls exchanged war stories from the battlefield of personal assisting. The two girls are both actors, and decided to write a pilot episode about the bizarre world of assisting. 

Friend and mentor, writer/director Billy Kent (Hairbrained, The O in Ohio) came onboard as a co-creator and director a few months later and the three began to build on the concept to create a whole season following personal assistants Kat Powers and Jamie Woods as they navigate their lives in New York City. Part It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia (if Sweet Dee was in charge) and part Sex in the City (if they had real jobs), It's Personal! is a dark comedic web series that aims to speak to a generation of assistants who have entered the job market as the most financially compromised group of educated young adults in American history.

Millennials get a bad wrap, but Kat and Jamie are members of generation of workers with college degrees, crippling debt, adult obligations, meager bank accounts, but are still child-like dreamers swimming upstream in a confusing, overwhelming world. 

What we've done.

A lot! Check out our trailer if you're one of those rational people who needs proof!

 

We’ve shot and completed post-production for our 10-minute pilot episode, and are seeking funding to film the rest of Season 1. We're ready to shoot!

Why It's Personal?

Know three millennials? Two of them are assistants. For better or for worse, our generation is living in a "gig economy." Some by choice (hello, actors!), and some by necessity.

Health insurance is reaaaally expensive. And none of us are buying a house anytime soon.

Services like Fiverr and Taskrabbit are household names, and millennials are household work wenches. And honestly, we're probably going to be replaced by robots. 

Plus, #assistantlife is gaining it's own celebrity culture, see Kimmy K's fly first lady here. 

Why Back Us?

 

"Women in film don't need help. They need money." - Frances McDormand.

 

We are women making stories about women.

According to The Hollywood Reporter, women accounted for 7 percent of directors, 13 percent of writers, 17 percent of executive producers, 17 percent of editors and 5 percent of cinema- tographers in 2016.

We want to put as many women as we can in the writer’s room, producers pool, and behind the lens as possible.

We are telling true to life stories.

Creators Alli Trussell, Amanda Bullis, and Billy Kent have all been personal assistants and have bonded creatively over the wacky, bizarre reality of the world of assisting. Truth is funnier than fiction!

We are now.

Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, HBO, Vimeo, Comedy Central, FX are all investing in Original Series for streaming. It’s Personal is original content dedicated to quality beyond the “web series” format. We are creating something real (not reel), collaborating to elevate, making storytelling our #1 priority, and failing BIG whenever possible.

The Magical Perks of Supporting IRL Assistants

Lucky for you guys, Alli and Amanda are personal assistants in real life and ready to put their mouths (hands, feet, time, and energy) where your money is! Or in Mariah Carey's case...where her lip sweat is...

Check out our incentives...we're really good at our jobs. 

Why we need you. 

We self-financed the pilot, but now we're tapped out.

With support from contributors like you, our team will be paid a living wage, we will be able to rent equipment that will increase our production value, secure permits, properly insure ourselves, and secure locations in the city that would be true-to-life for our characters. 

See our team below!

OUR TEAM

Alli Trussell as Kat Powers

Amanda Bullis as Jamie Woods

James Coker as Kevin Smith

Flint Rascal as Joe, the Pharmacist

Suni Reyes as Maria

Billy Kent, Director, co-creator, co-writer

Natalie Eakin, Producer

Shea K. Johnson, Producer

Alan Simon, Executive Producer

Jake Clennell, Director of Photography

Jackie Christy, 1st Assistant Director

Lauren Tanchum, Costumer Designer

Paul Bertino, Editor

Chantal Eyong, Color Correction

Nick Bolton, Sound Editing

Poor Like Us? 

Even $5 goes a long way to contributing to our goal, but if you can't participate financially, you can still help us create!

Live in NY and have equipment or a service to donate? We'll take it! We are reaching out to our community to make this project happen. Have a little cousin who wants film experience and would like to PA? Let us know!

Another way you can help? Share us on your social meeds, plz. Get the word out to your own friends and family about It's Personal! using the Indiegogo share tools up & to the right. 

FULL DI$CLOSURE: If we don't reach our fundraising goal this money will be going straight towards Botox (We'd like to say it's preventative, but we're too far gone).

story:
The Story

Pete Malloy (38) has just been told by his egotistical promoter Cash (46) that his current gimmick of 'Pigeon Pete' needs to be dead and buried. 

To win back the respect of the local wrestling world, his ex wife and get his life back on track, he must bury his old persona and search for the perfect gimmick that will help him win 'Wrestle-Jam' 2017.

 

Why We Need Your Support

With your help we can put the money raised towards the production of the web series, this will include helping fund costumes, set design and our cast expenses. 

If you're not in a position to help financially, that is completely fine! All we ask is that you could like and share our page so that you can stay up to date and spread the awareness.

We're offering unique rewards as a thank you for your generous donations.

As a group we are passionate about making something that will push us creatively. We would love to submit to festivals in the future and have something that we are proud of on each of our showreels. 

We have a website up and running which showcases some of our teams past work which we'd love for you to take a look at.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can stay updated by following us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and our website. You will be able to see behind the scenes photos and see where exactly the money raised is going. The pilot episode will be completed by March 2017. 

Facebook https://www.facebook.com/CheapHeat.WebSeries/?f...

Twitter https://twitter.com/CheapHeat_WEB

Instagram https://www.instagram.com/cheapheat_web/

Website https://cheapheat8.wixsite.com/cheapheat
