story:
Pub51 is the brainchild of a group of film and television students at the Queensland University of Technology. The show seeks to bring together local Brisbane notables and artists to discuss various Australian conspiracy theories over beers. With no script and only their imagination leading the way, anything can happen when talking about events such as our missing prime minister, and the top-secret intelligence facility in Alice Springs likened to be Australia's Area 51.

 

"We" are almost 40 film and television students either in their penultimate or final year of study at the Queensland University of Technology. Being students, we are strapped for cash. As much as we wish we could fund this thing with the 45 cents in my wallet and the four french fries under the seat of my car, we can't and we need your help! 

Let's introduce the team!

Creators and Directors: Dan Taylor and Monica Rooney

Producers: Justin Mach, Jaidyn Griffin, and Jordan-Lee Randle (absent)

(Jordan says she had to get her wisdom teeth out, but I think that's just want she wants us to think.)

 

Making a film or tv show is no cheap task, and we can't do this on our own accord. We need you and your precious dollarydoos to help us out.

If you choose to be so kind and donate to our show, your money will be spent on a variety of different things including set design (we have BIG plans and a SMALL amount of cash), costuming, hair and makeup (we can't have our presenters looking TOO wild can we?), cast and crew catering (we'll be working long days and we have to eat!), and if there is enough to spare, a WRAP PARTY (WOOP WOOP).

In return for your donation, we have a few pretty cool perks, if I do say so myself.

  • $5 "Goon Sack" Perk - you get: Our eternal thanks
  • $10 "Vodka Cruiser" Perk - you get: The above, and a special shout out on our social channels!
  • $25 "Jimmy Beam" Perk - you get: The above, and a special Pub51 poster!
  • $45 "Milton Mango" Perk - you get: The above, and an Executive Producer credit!
  • $75 "Fireball" Perk - you get: All of the above, and a limited edition Pub51 t-shirt!

 

We get it. Not everyone, even us, has disposable income they can give to a pretty cool project. But that's okay! You can help and support us in other ways by liking and following our social channels on Facebook and Instagram, and sharing the word about our fundraising campaign!

Facebook:  facebook.com/pub51series

Instagram: @pub51series

Producers: Justin Mach, Jaidyn Griffin, and Jordan-Lee Randle (absent)

(Jordan says she had to get her wisdom teeth out, but I think that's just want she wants us to think.)
 

Making a film or tv show is no cheap task, and we can't do this on our own accord. We need you and your precious dollarydoos to help us out.
If you choose to be so kind and donate to our show, your money will be spent on a variety of different things including set design (we have BIG plans and a SMALL amount of cash), costuming, hair and makeup (we can't have our presenters looking TOO wild can we?), cast and crew catering (we'll be working long days and we have to eat!), and if there is enough to spare, a WRAP PARTY (WOOP WOOP).

In return for your donation, we have a few pretty cool perks, if I do say so myself.


$5 "Goon Sack" Perk - you get: Our eternal thanks

$10 "Vodka Cruiser" Perk - you get: The above, and a special shout out on our social channels!

$25 "Jimmy Beam" Perk - you get: The above, and a special Pub51 poster!

$45 "Milton Mango" Perk - you get: The above, and an Executive Producer credit!

$75 "Fireball" Perk - you get: All of the above, and a limited edition Pub51 t-shirt!


 
We get it. Not everyone, even us, has disposable income they can give to a pretty cool project. But that's okay! You can help and support us in other ways by liking and following our social channels on Facebook and Instagram, and sharing the word about our fundraising campaign!
Facebook:  facebook.com/pub51series
Instagram: @pub51series

story:
Who are We and why should you invest?

 As the Director, and one of the Producers, I want to share why this project means so much to myself and the crew. Most importantly, why it's important to have fans doing fan work, and what it means to see it come to life. For starters, even though I've been directing and producing Independent Films since 2014, my first love was always graphic novels and comic books. Picture a young boy designing characters and drawings at age ten to share with only his parents and close friends. Now jump forward to 2018 when an excited DC Fan (the writer for the series) tells me he's waited three years to give a project about NIGHTWING to life. How could I possibly refuse? 

How can you take on such a project though and do it right? With larger studios above making the Cinematic Universes, how does the underdog compete? The answer lands with being a fan. Knowing the characters and developing them in a new way that a familiar lover of the characters can enjoy. Diving further and passionately with the actors to create the living story on screen that we all can enjoy.

With your contribution, we have a shot. The proper sets, the correct costume design, and just as important: the chance to be proud of the work we set forth to make for both new fans and old fans of DC alike.

What do we Need? How do we show Thanks?

Where does the money go, and where does the price lie may be your first question now. Thankfully, we have some answers. We've assembled a strong crew, and cast, which will help considerably:
1. Costume Design: A friend has agreed to, and has already, used his 3D printer to create some amazing design work. The hours and products alone to make this possible has stressed the friend considerably, but they push on. With additional funding, we can make the accurate purchases for both the 3D printing materials needed and costumes. Especially as an action series, the need to have back ups in case of things that break is essential.
2. Transportation: Not limo and jet rentals, but traveling to sets. Shooting in Colorado, to bring the settings of the DC Universe to life will require a lot of travel. The funding provided will assist in:
a) Gas for carpooling cast and crew (some locations over 300 miles apart from each other)
b) Emergency fund for minor repairs if required on vehicles (personal vehicles only)
c)  Lodging far from homes. Although many locations will consist of friends houses as the overnight stay, a cast member affiliated with a hotel chain can get very modest priced accommodations. It may be 5 people to a room, but it helps!
3. Food and Drink: With no plans for 5 Star cuisine, your funding will assist in out of pocket expenses for food and drink. Taking care of cast and crew, some far from home on set, thanks to your donation we will be able to provide home cooked meals and snacks. The donation will help us keep everyone happy, and that alone is a huge thanks from us and them. Happy sets make great shows.

BUT HOW DO WE SHOW THANKS???

No matter the donation size, the first thing you'll see is the free release of the Series on the Public Platform of Youtube. Accessible to everyone, and made with your help, you will never have to pay to see this on screen.

Donations of $100 or more will receive a poster signed by the Leading Cast and Director as well as a thank you in the credits of each episode in the series (Seven Episodes planned). We appreciate your help! Posters provided by local businesses in our community.

Donations of $500 or more will receive the above mentioned benefits, as well as a Producer credit on the series in each episode (Seven Episodes planned). A signed official poster, a "made possible by" in the credits, and credited as Producer on the show. You deserve it and we thank you!

Donations of $1000 or more ( Wow! Really? Thank You! ) will receive all of the above mentioned perks, as well as the Grand Prize of Perks: First release viewing. With that assistance, you've earned the right to see Episodes before they go public on the Youtube Platform from a private link. Along with that, notifications on when the Cast and Crew will be making public appearances in promotion of the series. Three set dates in 2019 alone across Colorado.

BUT WHAT IF THE GOAL FALLS SHORT?

We've thought that through, and it will not stop this series from going forward! You will see this project come to life, because we won't let it fail. If the goal falls short, it may take longer to complete, but we will do it. Local fundraising options would be considered as well.

All considered, You Make a huge Impact.
 

Ahead are some Risks & Challenges though...

Taking on such a project, with such a large fan base, does have it's downfalls and risks. Ridicule and online hate for not fitting a certain mold of DC is one. Even further though, in a very real scenario, is the issue of Colorado weather. Traveling the cast and crew across the state is one thing, but battling the elements of Snow and Ice and Cold on I-70 through April can be perilous. A normal 4 Hour trip can easily become 9 Hours if not careful. Even without snow, some locations require travel through unkept roads along cliff edges. It can be a challenge, be we are prepared!

1. We have sourced entirely for cast and crew local to Colorado. People familiar with the elements and cautious to those dangers
2. Carpooling will be done by 4 Wheel Drive vehicles only! Again at the hands of an experienced local driver careful to the road conditions.
3. Your donation! With your assistance, we can be better prepared for car repair and overnight lodging in cool or cruel weather. Thank you!

I Love it, but I can't Donate. How else can I help?

Sharing our campaign is a tremendous help. The more we can get the topic discussed, the better chances we all have of seeing this project done correctly and timely. And remember, releasing the series on a large Platform like Youtube freely means you can see it without it costing a dime. Thanks for you help here as well :)

story:
The Class...

This fall the NYU television bootcamp class, which is comprised of juniors and seniors in the film and television department at Tisch, will be collaborating to create three webseries. Each series has a showrunner, a writers room, and a team of producers working to create three incredible shows!! 

This course was developed to simulate a real television production, challenging students to adapt their concepts into webseries structure and giving opportunities for growth as creators and artists. Through the process of developing and producing the show, students gain experience and knowledge that will strengthen their collaborative skills.

The Shows....

 

CHECK, PLEASE

When her parents get arrested in the college cheating scandal, high school senior Jen Walton becomes infamous overnight and is forced to work as a busboy at her uncle’s local chain restaurant.

Created by Nick Ryan

Executive Produced by Kelly Moore

Produced by Michael Consuelos, Maia Grieve, and Hannah Qin

Written by Austin Jones, Stirling DuBell, Nina Allison, Cole Paticoff, and Laith Devjiyani

Directed by Jazz Pitcarin, Ben Kaufman-Shalett, Valerie San Luis, and Sophia Hannah Anderson

 

JUST BE NICE

Just Be Nice is an office comedy about the absurdity of unpaid internships and being a woman in a male dominated work environment.

Created by Kaylee Scinto 

Executive Produced by Sophie Bennett

Produced by Petuh Samuel and Emily Miller 

Written by Kaylee Scinto, Emily Brochin, Jeff Kemp, Neeti Joshi, and Keara Sullivan 

Directed by Lily Huang, Valentina Garrett, Jazz Taylor Pitcairn, Sydney Rudman, and Sophia Hannah Anderson

 

DOLORIS

Doloris is a sci-fi series that switches the point of view with each episode, following an ensemble of characters with their use of an experimental pill that has a unique aspect - allowing you to interact with loved ones who have passed.

In present day New York, after a company decides to invest in an experimental drug called Doloris, a chain of events occurs in which we see the pills float from character to character. We explore each character’s unique interaction with a different loved one that they've lost after taking the pill.

Created by Dylan Lenze

Executive Produced by Kate Remelius

Produced by Maddie Neuville & Sophie Green

Assisted Directed by Matt Warden

Written by Ben Waitches-Eubanks, Deaniera Wibisono, Sydney Rudman, and Matt Warden

Directed by Lily Huang, Valerie San Luis, Sydney Rudman, Deaniera Wibisono, and Valentina Garrett

 

Donating...

As young artists and creators we have poured a lot of hard work into these projects. Since we are students crowdfunding is a major way for us to raise the amount of money required in completing the highest level of quality content! Our budget goes towards location fees, transportation costs, creating a beautiful production design, and feeding our wonderful cast and crew. No donation is too small and we greatly appreciate every donation!!!

story:
A Quick Overview

Hi! I'm Emily - and first and foremost, I want to say thank you. Thank you for taking a look at this page and thank you for learning a bit about what I want to accomplish. I'm so excited for what's to come. 

In the beginning (a very good place to start). I first started thinking about We the Voters almost four years ago, when I was fresh out of college and trying to determine how to use my journalism degree. I'd wanted to be a journalist since I was seven, but was a bit disillusioned on where I saw the field headed. Then, life took a few twists and turns, which leads us to today.  

We the Voters is about real conversations. In a series of audio, video, and photo interviews, I'll share 2,500 conversations online - sans bias or analysis. Consider it a one-stop shop so you can learn more about people all around the country - people who may look, sound, or seem different (or similar!) at first glance. Because I believe that most people are good - and that we're not as different as we might originally think. 

Together, we can bring this project into the world. But -- I will not be able to do it without your help. Every dollar you can spare means another day on the road and another person I can talk to. It means better equipment and more resources, which means even better interviews you can listen to while I'm on the road. 

Thank You for the Support

I know I said it before, and I'm sure I'll say it a few hundred more times. But I also know that words only go so far, so I'd love to share a little something with you too - a small token of my gratitude for all of your kindness and support. 

Your Name in the Credits - $10

  • Your name in the THANK YOU section of the We The Voters Website
  • My undying love and gratitude 

See You in the News - $25

  • An exclusive extra content/behind-the-scenes newsletter, sent from the road
  • Your name in the THANK YOU section of the We The Voters website
  • My undying love and gratitude 

A Peek Behind-the-Scenes - $50

  • Behind-the-scenes/exclusive content videos, sent from the road
  • An exclusive extra content/behind-the-scenes newsletter, sent to you monthly 
  • Your name in the THANK YOU section of the We The Voters website
  • My undying love and gratitude 

Let's Chat Over Coffee - $100

  • A group chat/Q&A session where we can chat and connect 6 times while on the road
  • A monthly behind-the-scenes/exclusive content video
  • An exclusive extra content/behind-the-scenes newsletter, sent to you monthly 
  • Your name in the THANK YOU section of the We The Voters website
  • My undying love and gratitude 

Connecting, Snail Mail Style -  $250

  • 15 paper personalized postcards mailed to you, sent monthly from the road
  • A group chat/Q&A session where we can chat and connect 6 times while on the road
  • A behind-the-scenes/exclusive content video, sent from the road
  • An exclusive extra content/behind-the-scenes newsletter, sent from the road
  • Your name in the THANK YOU section of the We The Voters website
  • My undying love and gratitude 

A quick, small note - due to the nature of rewards and limitations of this project, I cannot offer returns or refunds. My apologies! 

Can't Donate? No Worries - I Get It! Mind Spreading the Word?

I totally understand when money is tight - trust me. Would you mind spreading the word instead? 

  • Share this page across social media platforms so more people can hear about the project! I'd love to get as many people - and points of view - involved as possible.

story:
For over a decade WildEarth has been connecting people with nature through broadcasting daily LIVE safaris from Africa into homes, schools and hospitals around the world. In doing so, we have changed many people's lives for the better, often at times that they needed it most.  

Last year we appealed to you, our dedicated community of viewers, to help us keep our daily broadcasts on-air as we looked for ways to position WildEarth for the future. The incredibly generous support we received has kept us going since then and until recently appeared to have been sufficient to allow us to start putting the new plans, developed with your help, in place.

However, the economic impact of the Corona pandemic on first China and now the world has resulted in clients delaying the contracts (and their revenue) we needed to execute these plans.

We, therefore, need to ask for your support again and hope that, once again, our community of viewers will rise to the occasion. As it stands, and without this support, we will have to suspend our daily broadcasts from April 1st for an as of yet unknown period of time.

This would come at a time when more people, young and old, than ever before are forced to be at home or are admitted to hospitals and would benefit from our broadcasts.

 

"Research shows that even if they’re artificial, the images, sounds and smells of nature can have positive health effects. Listening to nature sounds over headphones, for instance, has been shown to help people recover faster from stress–which might explain why so many spas employ nature sounds in their treatment rooms." - The Healing Power of Nature - Time Magazine, July 2016 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We, therefore, need to once again look to you, as our community of viewers, to support us. To keep our daily safaris operating through April we would need to raise approximately $70,000. If we raise more, we can keep them going for longer, but April is our first objective.

These are difficult and uncertain times for most everyone, and many of you might not be able to contribute much, or at all. We understand that. You can also help through spreading the word about the campaign. Any contribution, in any form and of any size, can help us in continuing our daily LIVE safaris and is appreciated.

For those who can help financially, we've created a number of 'perks' for you to choose from. Please have a look and pick one, or choose to contribute whichever amount you can by choosing 'no perk'.

 

How your support will benefit many others

WildEarth has been on a mission to 'connect people with nature' and over the past 12 years have reached millions of people.  Many of those are simply watching because they enjoy it, but there are also many for whom it provides a brief escape from whatever pain and sorrow they might be going through. The joint experience of watching nature LIVE provides a special connection; with the animals and guides, but also with others who are watching at the same time. it builds community and friendships, even marriages in some cases...

 

“…I’m currently living with a very slow-progressing terminal illness. My only window to the outside world is my tablet, but I’m often too ill to communicate with others even via social media. Your show has helped me through many long, lonely, and often painful nights. Most importantly, safariLIVE gives my mind a door to the outside world. I never tire of the realization that the things I’m seeing on my screen are happening right that very moment half a world away. 

Words simply cannot express how important this twice daily outing has become to me, how much I look forward to it, or how much it has improved my quality of life.” – Brooke

 

We at WildEarth remain dedicated to providing this special connection and will continue to work hard to achieve this. We've seen the positive impact it's had on people young and old, healthy or ill, and do not want to give up on that. And 'with a little help from our friends', we want to continue doing so!

If ever there was a time our mission has the ability to improve people's lives, now is it!

 

What we will do if we exceed our target.

The more money we raise, the longer we can keep broadcasting. Our first goal is to raise the around $70,000 we need to keep doing so through April, but we would love to raise enough to secure them until June.

 

Help us spread the word!

Beyond contributing financially to this campaign, there are various other ways you can help us, e.g. by spreading the word about this far and wide among your friends, relatives, local radio stations, and anybody else who is willing to listen…

We understand that. You can also help through spreading the word about the campaign. Any contribution, in any form and of any size, can help us in continuing our daily LIVE safaris and is appreciated.For those who can help financially, we've created a number of 'perks' for you to choose from. Please have a look and pick one, or choose to contribute whichever amount you can by choosing 'no perk'. How your support will benefit many othersWildEarth has been on a mission to 'connect people with nature' and over the past 12 years have reached millions of people.  Many of those are simply watching because they enjoy it, but there are also many for whom it provides a brief escape from whatever pain and sorrow they might be going through. The joint experience of watching nature LIVE provides a special connection; with the animals and guides, but also with others who are watching at the same time. it builds community and friendships, even marriages in some cases... “…I’m currently living with a very slow-progressing terminal illness. My only window to the outside world is my tablet, but I’m often too ill to communicate with others even via social media. Your show has helped me through many long, lonely, and often painful nights. Most importantly, safariLIVE gives my mind a door to the outside world. I never tire of the realization that the things I’m seeing on my screen are happening right that very moment half a world away. Words simply cannot express how important this twice daily outing has become to me, how much I look forward to it, or how much it has improved my quality of life.” – Brooke We at WildEarth remain dedicated to providing this special connection and will continue to work hard to achieve this. We've seen the positive impact it's had on people young and old, healthy or ill, and do not want to give up on that. And 'with a little help from our friends', we want to continue doing so!If ever there was a time our mission has the ability to improve people's lives, now is it! What we will do if we exceed our target.The more money we raise, the longer we can keep broadcasting. Our first goal is to raise the around $70,000 we need to keep doing so through April, but we would love to raise enough to secure them until June. Help us spread the word!Beyond contributing financially to this campaign, there are various other ways you can help us, e.g. by spreading the word about this far and wide among your friends, relatives, local radio stations, and anybody else who is willing to listen…

story:
My name is Bill Brock. I am extremely passionate about solving mysteries like alien abductions, cryptid sightings and the mysteries of the ancient mound builders. In the past I hosted Monsters Underground a show featured on Discovery Channel and Destination America. Now I am taking that experience to locations that may reveal connections between the Ancients and the extraterrestrial.  With your help, Rogue Mysteries will research and hopefully solve the questions we all have:  Do aliens exist? Are portals real? Did the ancient mound builders have alien contact? These are just a few questions you can help us answer. 

 Funding for this project makes it possible to properly explore and research these mysteries. Our goal is $5000.00. We need to access specific locations like the University of New Hampshire, which requires a hefty sum just to access the archive. We need to shoot there to tell the full story of Betty and Barney Hill, given that the university holds all the artifacts from the abduction. The next few episodes will have us travel to the Allagash to investigate the abduction that happened there in 1976. Other costs include food, travel and equipment, not to mention the cost of wardrobe, makeup, and graphic design. As you can see, costs add up quickly so please help us make this dream a reality with your donations. 

Help us get the word out about what we are doing. If you can't donate please just simply share this post!

story:
Courtney is a caterer, event planner and effervescent world traveler. Owning a seasonal business gave her the flexibility to travel for 6 months a year, which opened her eyes to the rich cultural tapestry that spans the globe.

In the belief that knowing leads to understanding, and by understanding different cultures we can find commonalities and celebrate our differences, Courtney feels by educating the world through celebrations people can open their minds, learn other perspectives and take home new ideas for throwing parties.

The money raised goes directly to filming the trailer for the multi-episode series. At the culmination of fundraising, Courtney will hold a fabulous party, to which all donors will be invited.

If you support the intention (or the creators!) please donate and share with others who may also care to support this project.

story:
About the Bear Lake Monster Video

Despite the quaint charm of Garden City or the fact that thousands of tourists visit the eerie blue waters of Bear Lake every year, there is a dark, mysterious secret swimming below the surface. The mystery of the Bear Lake Monster has not yet been conclusively solved although rumors of monsters have been floating around since at least the 1800s. Stories of a monster were passed down by early pioneer settlers and maybe even the native people before them. 

Our team intends to make a spectacular YouTube video about the Bear Lake Monster just in time for Halloween in 2019. Some videos about the topic have hundreds of thousands of views and we plan for this video to rise to the top of search results. Our video will be informative and as accurate as possible. We have already interviewed faculty at Utah State University in the Folklore Department on-camera. We have also already secured partnerships with local businesses.

Our team includes Matthew Havertz (a video producer from Logan), Lucas McGraw (director and producer of Before Your Time from Layton), Neal Stucki (a music composer from Ephraim), Ron Jensen (a professional animator from Provo), and Jameson Smith (a narrator and voice actor from Logan).

The businesses we are partnering with so far include the following. These are great places to check out and stop by while you're in the Bear Lake Area. 

  • Ace Hardware-Garden City
  • Bear Lake KOA
  • Bridgerland Adventure Park
  • Cody's Gastro Garage
  • Hometown Drive In
  • Moose Buns
  • Water's Edge Resort at Bear Lake

Click on any business on the list above to check out their website and learn more.

What We Need & What You Get

To make an absolutely incredible video, we need your help! We have enough funding to make a decent video now, but we want to hire actors, additional crew, rent additional equipment, and more. If you support our project as an individual with $10 or more, you will get to see an early release of the Bear Lake Monster video. Other benefits of supporting the project at various levels include being featured in the video or coming to watch us film pieces of the video.

We're still looking to partner with businesses. Perks for partnering with us as a business include some of the following: being featured in a separate travel video about the Bear Lake area, getting video footage of your business that you can use for your own use, being featured in the Bear Lake Monster video, and more. Watch this video to learn more about partnering with us as a business. 

The full details of all these perks are available here on Indiegogo. If you want more detailed information about our budget, feel free to reach out to Matthew Havertz by emailing MatthewHavertz@gmail.com. 

Other Ways You Can Help

First and foremost, if you have stories about the Bear Lake Monster, we want to hear them! Whether it's a story you heard around the campfire and aren't quite sure if it's true or if it's your real experience, we want to know! Email Matthew Havertz at MatthewHavertz@gmail.com. 

The next biggest way you can help is by sharing our video and campaign with family members and friends. If you know anyone that visits Bear Lake regularly, has more information about the Bear Lake Monster, or just loves these types of videos, please spread the word! You can even use the sharing features right here on Indiegogo.

Finally, you can also help by contributing your own time or equipment. Here is a list of things we're looking for, but we're open to any kind of donation you can think of:

  • Drone camera operation and equipment
  • Under water camera equipment
  • A boat to film on/from
  • Video production experience (we need more crew)
  • Acting experience (we're looking for actors)

story:
GINGER: KEEPING IT ALL TOGETHER

INTRODUCTION

The Ginger Show is a new TV/Web Series scheduled to premiere in the summer of 2017. We have established a fine cast, a great script and a formidable management team.

Join us! Follow us! Help us! Celebrate our diversity! Cheer our ingenuity! Give thanks for his mercy! Express gratitude for his grace! How? By supporting the Ginger show!!! We at Simple Elegance Entertainment know the power of prayer. The Bible teaches us: Ask and it shall be given to you. The Bible also says: You have not because you ask not. So we are asking. There is violence on TV, sexual exploitation throughout entertainment, and “God-less” programing existing on many networks and stations.  It is time to add a show that has the realism of today, the platform of yesterday and the faith needed for a better tomorrow! That is the Ginger Show! With your help, with your prayers and your support, we will provide an entertaining, educating and inspiring show that you can watch with your kids and grandparents. Don’t be afraid to show your faith. Don’t steer away from supporting something just and fair. Jump in and provide a helping hand. Every donation is a blessing and we know where our blessings come from. We look forward to your donations and providing the Ginger Show, which is a show we Christians can support and be proud of. Peace and Blessings!!!

SYNOPSIS

The Ginger Show is a Christian “dramedy.” It is essentially a drama with some comedic moments. The character Ginger is a modern woman; with a husband, three children and a full-time job. The Ginger Show was developed to bring to television a program that allows the majority of viewers a chance to watch a show that mimics society.  It is a show that through its scripts and presentations discuss many of the issues affecting our society. Issues such as: Alzheimer’s, domestic abuse, unwed mothers, bringing up children, law enforcement and the community, being African in America and many other issues. In other words, Ginger is a conduit to look at our society perhaps opening up discussions worldwide about those issues that affect us the most, depending on who we are.

Ginger’s occupation is key. The relationship of society and law enforcement has worsened over the years. Ginger helps to provide some insight on the “human” side of law enforcement.  A day in the life of Ginger is enlightening. Better understanding can help towards better communications. It is our sincerest desire to have a show that helps towards that understanding. Watch and let us know! God Bless!!

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Our Goal is to raise  sixty thousand dollars ($60,000) to produce a Series Trailer, Pilot Episode, and two additional episodes.

Our incentives provide you as a contributor with various opportunities to socialize with the cast and crew and/or attend Ginger activities.

  • An invitation to attend the Ginger Show Post Production Meet and Greet (on set at conclusion of filming)
  • An invitation to attend the Ginger Show Cast and Crew Party
  • An invitation to attend the Initial Screening of the Ginger Show Pilot and Trailer

You get to support a show that is very unique. A show with a diverse cast. A show that looks at issues of race, law enforcement and society from the view of an African American Christian woman. Choices and decisions being made reactions and consequences. Ginger is current. It looks at today’s issues with a cast that looks like the world.

If our goal is not reached, the funds that we do receive will be used to further the project by: completing as many episodes that we can based on the amount; searching for matching funds; developing partnerships, and adding potential investors to complete the project.

THE IMPACT

The Ginger Show is a look inside a law enforcement officer’s life as a mother, a wife and a Christian. We believe the show can and will be a platform for people to see law enforcement officers as real people. Helping the public to gain a better understanding of the community working together with law enforcement to make a safer world for our children. In the last decade, we have seen an increasingly large divide between law enforcement and the African American community. Come take a journey and travel though Ginger's life.

CHALLENGES AND RISKS

The challenge is to produce the Ginger TV/Web series. We are working  to acquire the necessary finances to complete the pilot and first three (3) episodes of the show.  We can meet this challenge with your help.  We have worked long and hard to find and establish a fine cast,  great scripts  and a formidable management team. Because we are a small production company we are able to do more with less. As with any project there are risks. The most definitive risk is not acquiring enough capital to support the show to become a success. Insufficient  financing as with any project, can be the cause of its failure. We believe with the proper financing and support we will be a success. We have a wiling and able audience (Worldwide) that is ready and poised for a show like Ginger. Other challenges include letting the world know that a show like Ginger is available. We must have great social media marketing and personal communications to help build the audience we know is there and interested in a show like Ginger. Finally we acknowledge there is RISK! The risk lies in many areas and we believe we are able to mitigate those risks: insufficient financing (discussed earlier), developing and maintaining the audience, availability of the show to the masses, and addressing the competition.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please, please, please tell others about the Ginger Show. Tell them it is a show for the community, a show full of diversity and made for all to watch. We can learn about so much by just watching Ginger. Ask your friends and family to please check us out at Ginger.com, Facebook, Twitter page and Instagram. Share us on your social media too.

Thanks,

Peace & Blessings

Other challenges include letting the world know that a show like Ginger is available. We must have great social media marketing and personal communications to help build the audience we know is there and interested in a show like Ginger. Finally we acknowledge there is RISK! The risk lies in many areas and we believe we are able to mitigate those risks: insufficient financing (discussed earlier), developing and maintaining the audience, availability of the show to the masses, and addressing the competition.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPPlease, please, please tell others about the Ginger Show. Tell them it is a show for the community, a show full of diversity and made for all to watch. We can learn about so much by just watching Ginger. story:
So there I was, sitting at my desk at one of the trendiest gyms in Hollywood, fire alarm ringing, flashing lights strobing, music blasting, and me, with a phone call in one ear (the man on the other end trying to talk me down from the “deal” I was pitching him), and in the other ear, the sounds of two co-workers debating about the rightful owner of the commission for the membership that had just sold and was just placed, accidentally, under my name. And I thought to myself, “This is real life right now.” 

As I look to my left, a strange man, half naked (in what I can describe to you as a woman’s butterfly bathing suit top and blue booty shorts to match, his name written all over himself in magic marker), sitting at my desk, waiting for me to get off the phone so that he could “properly” ask me out on a date. His idea of “proper” of course, was to pick me up in a Ferrari (which he did not own), and to take me to dinner at a fancy Beverly Hills Restaurant, all after only just revealing to me that he dropped $500 to legally change his name to “Sexy Vegan.” I politely declined, but, alas, that was enough for him to make a scene upon exiting the building. Believe me, I WISH I were making this  up. 

And so,  I confirm: “This truly is REAL LIFE.” So real, in fact, that I could not have possibly have kept it all to myself. I needed to share it with you. Thus, a TV show was born.  
 

The Story:
REPS is a workplace comedy about the sales team at a gym. But it is not about trendy work-outs, personal training tips, or the proper nutrition guide you need to getting that rock solid body just in time for the summer, no. Reps is about what you don't know; what you don’t realize is actually happening while you are minding your own business on your treadmill, or in that yoga class, or on that bench press. It’s about what’s really happening when you walk into the gym to “shop around,” and how you got manipulated into a committed membership when you only actually walked in to “try it out.” It’s about the real people, the real situations, and the real experiences I witnessed within 12 months of working as a Sales Representative at your gym. 

Told through the comedic perspective of one protagonist, Maggie, REPS will show you the ins and outs of the fitness industry through the way of the people that make all the wheels churn. Oh, and all the mishaps, misunderstandings, and shenanigans that happen along the way. More than that, REPS is a perfect example the journey; becoming who you are meant to be, and about the people that help you through it all. My name is Jacqueline Marie, and I have come together with Willow House Films to bring to you an original comedy series, REPS.  
 

Meet The Reps:


Maggie: “The Newbie,” New to L.A, new to the gym, and new to the job.  She is smart, witty, sarcastic and a walking accident waiting to happen.


Dylan: “The Eccentric One,” The membership manager for Reps Health Club, he also acts as Maggie’s mentor. He is odd, invested, curious and uses illogical logic to get what he needs.


Alexis: “The Power Player,” She is a master of manipulation, using her spanish accent and her female charisma as her weapons of mass destruction.


Derek: “The Charmer,” He is a stickler for the rules. He’s conceited, attractive, stuck up, and can convince you of absolutely anything through his smooth talking.  


Paul: “The Logical One,” he is well kept, organized and clean-cut, but has an obsession with making money. He sells illegal supplements under the table.


Marvin: “The Cynic,” He is the best salesman on the team...without ever having to say a word. 


Andy: “The Materialistic One,” He is the front desk manager and the keeper of all secrets.


Brenda: “The Boss,” She is the picture perfect general manager, she runs the club, polished and and pristine, but will bare her teeth if you cross the line. 
 

About the Team- 


Jacqueline Marie Alberto - Writer / Creator

Jacqueline Marie is a Cuban-American artist, originally from Miami, FL. She holds a BA Theatre degree from Florida State University and an MFA Acting Degree from the University of Houston. A professionally trained actress and dancer, she resides in LA, where she pursues an acting, dancing, and writing / producing  career. Her most recent credit includes the role of Bayleigh on this season of TV Land’s LOPEZ, with George Lopez. 
Instagram: @jacquelinemariealberto Twitter: @jacquie_marie_a


Iohana Sanchez - Producer

Iohana Sanchez is a Cuban- American  model and actress, born in Isabela De Sagua, Cuba. She holds a BA in Business Administration from Florida International University. Iohana has studied the Uta Hagen Method with authorized Hagen acting process teacher, Mar Durso in Miami. She now residing in LA, and is currently the lead in SWEET, the web series premiering this April.  Instagram: @isanc Twitter: @iohanasanchez


AJ Groy - Director / Producer

AJ Groy is a Producer / Director who got his start by producing an award winning short film Don’t Watch Me Dancing. His focus is directing and producing feature films and TV shows. He is currently co-producing his first feature Followed, which is in post-production. AJ founded and co-owns Willow House Films and Providence VR. He is also a field producer on the hottest house flipping show Flip or Flop, which airs on HGTV. AJ@WillowHouseFilms.com
Instagram: @ajgroy  Twitter: @ajgroy
 

Why now?
We have been working hard trying to bring this show from page to screen, and now is the best time to show you what we have cooking. We have a full cast, a full production team, and a full crew, all who are itching to make something for you that you are going to laugh at time and time again. What we need now are the funds to bring it to life. That’s where you come in. 

 

How You Can Help:
FOLLOW FOLLOW FOLLOW! Help us by showing us your love and support along this journey. You can keep up with us on Instagram @RepsSeries, Facebook @RepsTheTVShow, Twitter @RepsTheTVShow, and Youtube @RepsTVShow. You can also check in for updates on our website @ www.repstvshow.com. And of course, share, like, comment, tell your friends! Anything helps, from a like, to a follow, to a dollar.  

DONATE DONATE DONATE! You can start helping us by spreading the word and also donating to our Indie Gogo Campaign. Every penny counts and will all be going to making this dream a reality. 
 

What We Need:
We only need 10k to make this pilot a reality. All funds contributed will go towards production and post production costs. 

Budget chart :

What You Get: 
We have a number of amazing perks that go along with your donations, including Reps swag, work-out gear, a signed poster from the cast, among other fun stuff. Apart from the perks, you will get to be a part of a fresh new series and it’s journey from your computer screen to your TV. From the very first draft to the current content we are working hard to bring to life, the people behind REPS are very passionate about what this show has to offer. With a dynamic cast and dedicated crew, we guarantee to not only make you laugh but bring you a series that you will get excited about for many seasons to come.
story_txt: So there I was, sitting at my desk at one of the trendiest gyms in Hollywood, fire alarm ringing, flashing lights strobing, music blasting, and me, with a phone call in one ear (the man on the other end trying to talk me down from the “deal” I was pitching him), and in the other ear, the sounds of two co-workers debating about the rightful owner of the commission for the membership that had just sold and was just placed, accidentally, under my name. And I thought to myself, “This is real life right now.” As I look to my left, a strange man, half naked (in what I can describe to you as a woman’s butterfly bathing suit top and blue booty shorts to match, his name written all over himself in magic marker), sitting at my desk, waiting for me to get off the phone so that he could “properly” ask me out on a date. His idea of “proper” of course, was to pick me up in a Ferrari (which he did not own), and to take me to dinner at a fancy Beverly Hills Restaurant, all after only just revealing to me that he dropped $500 to legally change his name to “Sexy Vegan.” I politely declined, but, alas, that was enough for him to make a scene upon exiting the building. Believe me, I WISH I were making this  up. And so,  I confirm: “This truly is REAL LIFE.” So real, in fact, that I could not have possibly have kept it all to myself. I needed to share it with you. Thus, a TV show was born.   The Story:REPS is a workplace comedy about the sales team at a gym. But it is not about trendy work-outs, personal training tips, or the proper nutrition guide you need to getting that rock solid body just in time for the summer, no. Reps is about what you don't know; what you don’t realize is actually happening while you are minding your own business on your treadmill, or in that yoga class, or on that bench press. It’s about what’s really happening when you walk into the gym to “shop around,” and how you got manipulated into a committed membership when you only actually walked in to “try it out.” It’s about the real people, the real situations, and the real experiences I witnessed within 12 months of working as a Sales Representative at your gym. Told through the comedic perspective of one protagonist, Maggie, REPS will show you the ins and outs of the fitness industry through the way of the people that make all the wheels churn. Oh, and all the mishaps, misunderstandings, and shenanigans that happen along the way. More than that, REPS is a perfect example the journey; becoming who you are meant to be, and about the people that help you through it all. My name is Jacqueline Marie, and I have come together with Willow House Films to bring to you an original comedy series, REPS.   Meet The Reps:Maggie: “The Newbie,” New to L.A, new to the gym, and new to the job.  She is smart, witty, sarcastic and a walking accident waiting to happen.Dylan: “The Eccentric One,” The membership manager for Reps Health Club, he also acts as Maggie’s mentor. He is odd, invested, curious and uses illogical logic to get what he needs.Alexis: “The Power Player,” She is a master of manipulation, using her spanish accent and her female charisma as her weapons of mass destruction.Derek: “The Charmer,” He is a stickler for the rules. He’s conceited, attractive, stuck up, and can convince you of absolutely anything through his smooth talking.  Paul: “The Logical One,” he is well kept, organized and clean-cut, but has an obsession with making money. He sells illegal supplements under the table.Marvin: “The Cynic,” He is the best salesman on the team...without ever having to say a word. Andy: “The Materialistic One,” He is the front desk manager and the keeper of all secrets.Brenda: “The Boss,” She is the picture perfect general manager, she runs the club, polished and and pristine, but will bare her teeth if you cross the line.  About the Team- Jacqueline Marie Alberto - Writer / CreatorJacqueline Marie is a Cuban-American artist, originally from Miami, FL. She holds a BA Theatre degree from Florida State University and an MFA Acting Degree from the University of Houston. A professionally trained actress and dancer, she resides in LA, where she pursues an acting, dancing, and writing / producing  career. Her most recent credit includes the role of Bayleigh on this season of TV Land’s LOPEZ, with George Lopez. Instagram: @jacquelinemariealberto Twitter: @jacquie_marie_aIohana Sanchez - ProducerIohana Sanchez is a Cuban- American  model and actress, born in Isabela De Sagua, Cuba. She holds a BA in Business Administration from Florida International University. Iohana has studied the Uta Hagen Method with authorized Hagen acting process teacher, Mar Durso in Miami. She now residing in LA, and is currently the lead in SWEET, the web series premiering this April.  Instagram: @isanc Twitter: @iohanasanchezAJ Groy - Director / ProducerAJ Groy is a Producer / Director who got his start by producing an award winning short film Don’t Watch Me Dancing. His focus is directing and producing feature films and TV shows. He is currently co-producing his first feature Followed, which is in post-production. AJ founded and co-owns Willow House Films and Providence VR. He is also a field producer on the hottest house flipping show Flip or Flop, which airs on HGTV. AJ@WillowHouseFilms.comInstagram: @ajgroy  Twitter: @ajgroy Why now?We have been working hard trying to bring this show from page to screen, and now is the best time to show you what we have cooking. We have a full cast, a full production team, and a full crew, all who are itching to make something for you that you are going to laugh at time and time again. What we need now are the funds to bring it to life. That’s where you come in.  How You Can Help:FOLLOW FOLLOW FOLLOW! Help us by showing us your love and support along this journey. You can keep up with us on Instagram @RepsSeries, Facebook @RepsTheTVShow, Twitter @RepsTheTVShow, and Youtube @RepsTVShow. You can also check in for updates on our website @ www.repstvshow.com. And of course, share, like, comment, tell your friends! Anything helps, from a like, to a follow, to a dollar.  DONATE DONATE DONATE! You can start helping us by spreading the word and also donating to our Indie Gogo Campaign. Every penny counts and will all be going to making this dream a reality.  What We Need:We only need 10k to make this pilot a reality. All funds contributed will go towards production and post production costs. Budget chart :What You Get: We have a number of amazing perks that go along with your donations, including Reps swag, work-out gear, a signed poster from the cast, among other fun stuff. Apart from the perks, you will get to be a part of a fresh new series and it’s journey from your computer screen to your TV. From the very first draft to the current content we are working hard to bring to life, the people behind REPS are very passionate about what this show has to offer. With a dynamic cast and dedicated crew, we guarantee to not only make you laugh but bring you a series that you will get excited about for many seasons to come.

story:
Our Story

We are a group of committed individuals who work at a Non-Public school. Day in and day out we work with children who suffer from mental disabilities, some have behavioral problems, and some have very tough home lives.

Our public school system is not adequate to take care of these children, so they are sent to private institutions that are publicly funded called NON-PUBLIC SCHOOLS.

When people see "non-public high school", people think it just means "private." With our series, we want to shine a light on the reality of the "non-public" school system.                                                     
If a free and appropriate public school can no longer give a student an appropriate education, they are required to educate them, which can cost up to $40,000 for the LA public school system. 

 

The Impact

We want to start a conversation, create awareness and create an environment that makes kids feel empowered.

By interrupting the school to prison pipeline cycle we can empower the youth who struggle with trauma and underserved backgrounds.

We also want to create awareness in our communities of color, so we become aware of the struggles our youth are facing and take actions to support them.

 

 

Our Team

Our core team collaborating on this project recognizes there's a problem in how we are raising our youth, and know that by educating the community of their struggles, we can work toward healing and change. 

Kyle Harris works at a Non-Public School. He is committed to providing  extra care and assistance for his students with special needs. 

Christian Henley himself wanting to give back to those who gave to him and took up a position at a Non-Public High School in the community in which he grew up. After spending a year working as a one-to-one aid for students he decided to marry his interest and begin working with a trusted team to develop the series, AWOL, based on his unique experience working within The Los Angeles Unified School District. 

Joshua Patterson was brought up in a community built around music, leadership, youth development and faith. He uses that foundation in his daily work as a lead behavior staff in a special education school, and as a youth development counselor in a locked residential facility.

Emily Margolis has worked the last 8 year in a school environment, using Art Therapy to help treat children with early childhood trauma, mental illness and other disabilities which impact their ability to learn. 

Angie Williams has an educational background in both psychology and human development. She has worked with children for years and her passion is to provide the youth with a voice and a clear path so they can thrive.

Jermel Brooks pursued a degree in Psychology after graduating high school and is passionate about music, sports, and helping kids. He is currently a Teacher's Assistant at one of Los Angeles' non-public schools.

Rich Cortez has been a recording engineer for years working around Los Angeles. He has also been working for many years as a tutor, group leader, and camp counselor for many community youth centers as well as an instructor for the Peace Project.

We all come from different backgrounds in social work and together we want to bring our passion project AWOL to life.

 

Where Your Contributions Will Go

With our series, we want to take an authentic and look as true to life as possible. That means equipment rentals and location permits. We also need to keep our cast and crew happy, fed, and housed. Since we will be working with child actors, we will also be paying for teachers to come in on set. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute financially, please help us get the word out. Together as a community, we can have a large reach by sharing the link to the campaign via social media will help to spread the word about this important story.

Thank you!

story:
We are shooting a fan-made, noir-style, gritty detective series, set in the Batman universe, right here, in Central New York.  The show will focus on the men and women of the GCPD, as seen through the eyes of Captain Jim Gordon.  We will explore these complex characters, down on the ground, as they try to deal with policing the most corrupt city in the world.

We believe we have something to offer that is very different and separate from what is being currently done in the current movies and television series.  Our show will be very grounded.  Our villians will be along the lines of Zsasz, and Black Mask, as opposed to Mr. Freeze, and Poison Ivy.  Our heroes will be along the lines of Renee Montoya and Cris Allen, and not The Dark Knight. There are so many great stories and characters that are not being utilized to their full potential, and we want to bring these elements to the masses, and show people that there is so much more to Batman, than just Batman. 

Everyone working on this project are all volunteers.  This show is a completely not-for-profit fan-series.  We are making this show simply for the love of these characters and stories. 

We are raising funds to help pay for our projects costume, prop, and set budget, so that we can hopefully bring the best show possible to you.  We want to make this series regardless, whether we raise 1,000 dollars, or 50 dollars.  What we are able to do with it depends on how much we can put into it.  Our hope is that with a little support, we may be able to make this something really special. 

If you think this series is something you would like to see, then please consider coming on board as a backer.  Truly, every little bit helps.

This series is an unlicensed fan-series, and is in no way endorsed by Warner Bros. Studios, The FOX Television network, or DC Comics.  As such, this project is subject to termination at any time if the property owners so decide. 

We believe we have the tools and talent to bring something really special and unique to the Batman universe.  And who knows, maybe the guys at DC will too.

story:
Short Summary

The Show will be 120 minutes. It's a variety show. We are gonna pitch our idea in front of producers of broadcast channel of Montreal. It's gonna be either a music show or a cinema show. With real comedians as animator, we want to make it big. We will achieve a next level of content and production design/props.

What We Need & What You Get

All the money would be invest for the show, we don't pay ourselves, it would be use for some cool stuff such as lighting and fake walls to do a studio/loft mood. The show will be stream live on Facebook for FREE! Everybody can see it even you, founders that will help us. If we don't reach the entire goal, ALL the money would be invest in the show.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the Indiegogo on social media, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.

story:
The first fifty backers of the Multiplex 10 Indiegogo are eligible to win a free Multiplex 10: The Animated Short USB card (including free shipping anywhere in the world). But if you weren’t fast enough, we’ll give another card away for every ten additional backers we get (e.g. when we get to 60 backers, we’ll unlock a second card, up to a limit of ten cards total).

The earlier you back—at any dollar amount—

ALSO: Get a DRM-free digital download (MP4) of Multiplex 10: The Animated Short with every perk/reward level! ($3 pledges and up.)

—

Hey, Multiplex 10 fans (and newcomers)!

If you’re new to Multiplex 10, it’s an animated web series directed and produced by Gordon McAlpin, based on his long-running webcomic, Multiplex. It launched in 2018 with the release of Multiplex 10: The Animated Short and “Oscar Pool,” and it has continued thanks to the support of its fans through Kickstarter, Patreon, and Indiegogo.

Check out a couple of our favorite episodes above in the Video Gallery on this site OR visit our website Multiplex10.com or our YouTube Channel to watch all of them. (And learn more about the cast and crew of Multiplex 10 on our official site!)

Multiplex 10 has received numerous honors, including Best Animation/Puppetry at the 2018 Minnesota WebFest and Best Web Series at the 2018 Monmouth Film Festival. Oh, and then there's this:


As we are about to wrap up the series of episodes funded by the Multiplex 10: The Web Series Kickstarter in late 2018, we realized we didn’t want the show to end. We have one more episode already in productionand ideas for as many more as we’re able to fund, but we need your help to finish them.

Animation is EXPENSIVE. With a budget of under $1000 per minute, a minute Multiplex 10 costs less to make than ONE-TENTH OF A SECOND of a Disney animation feature. In order to keep our goal as low as possible, and to fund as much animation as possible, the rewards we’re offering with this crowdfunding project are minimal—primarily in the form of credits in the episode(s).

At the $3 level and up, you receive an MP4 of Multiplex 10: The Animated Short.

At the $15 level, you receive ALL of the Multiplex 10 videos: the short, the web series, and some promo stuff.

And higher levels get a special thanks on the website, or credits in the episodes themselves! The producer credits will be in EVERY episode funded by this campaign, so the more episodes we can make, the better your rewards are!




Additionally, backers at the Co-Producer ($300) level and up have the option of adding one or more cameos in the episodes funded by this campaign (limit 4).

To keep things simple, we only have one stretch goal: for every $2,500 we raise over the goal, we can produce at least two more minutes of animation! We can’t promise how many episodes that will work out to—we’ve learned our lesson about promising a fixed number of episodes rather than basing it on running time! But whatever dollar amount we raise, we love making Multiplex 10, and we’ll try to stretch that budget out as far as possible, to get YOU more cartoons for your eyeholes.

But let us know what form you’d like those extra minutes to take! Would you like more movie reviews or just web series episodes? Do you prefer longer episodes? Would you rather watch more frequent, shorter episodes, like the Untitled Star Wars Mini-Episode?

Gordon McAlpin (the voice of “Jason,” executive producer, director, animator, editor, & co-writer of Multiplex 10: The Animated Short) wrote and illustrated the comic strip Multiplex from July 2005 through April 2017 and has produced three Kickstarter-funded Multiplex collections. Beyond comics, he is a freelance writer, designer, illustrator, and animator. He lives in Somerville, MA.

Tom Brazelton (the voice of “Kurt,” co-producer for Multiplex 10: The Animated Short, producer on Multiplex 10: The Web Series) is the former artist/writer of the movie-themed comic Theater Hopper. He still enjoys writing and drawing, and he still likes movies (although, these days, it’s a lot more Pixar and a lot less Jim Jarmusch). Eventually, he’s going to get back in the game and publish some journal comics.

Joe Dunn (the voice of “Curtis,” co-producer for Multiplex 10: The Animated Short, producer on Multiplex 10: The Web Series) is a graphic artist living and working in the New York City area.  He loves movies and drawing. He tries to do both non-stop. You may know his work from Joe Loves Crappy Movies or some other terribly-titled webcomic.

Aiyanna Wade (the voice of “Becky” and “Sunny”) has recently appeared on Channel Awesome’s Nostalgia Critic and is the cohost of the Awesome Comics podcast. She currently works on stage in Chicago and lives with her other half Jake and kitten Gideon.

We love making Multiplex 10, so making this next episode isn’t a matter of “if” but how soon. But we'd like to make even more episodes. As I’ve learned from my earlier crowdfunding projects, scope creep, and unpredictable production delays just… happen. But we’ve released over twenty Multiplex 10 videos (between the animated short, the web series, and movie reviews) in the past two years, and I think we’ve shown a habit, for better or for worse, of going above and beyond our very limited budgets.


    We know that some people just can't afford to contribute financially, and that’s okay! But you can still help Multiplex 10: The Web Series get made by helping us spread the word about the show and this crowdfunding campaign on social media! Use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thank you so much for your support. We look forward to getting the Multiplex 10 gang back together soon.

But we’ve released over twenty Multiplex 10 videos (between the animated short, the web series, and movie reviews) in the past two years, and I think we’ve shown a habit, for better or for worse, of going above and beyond our very limited budgets.


We know that some people just can't afford to contribute financially, and that’s okay! But you can still help Multiplex 10: The Web Series get made by helping us spread the word about the show and this crowdfunding campaign on social media! Use the Indiegogo share tools!Thank you so much for your support. We look forward to getting the Multiplex 10 gang back together soon.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! My name is Robert Michael, creator of the original comedy series, Girl Chill! I've also created content for REELZ network in the form of music production and I am the creator of the newly released dogsledding documentary, Heartprints in the Snow!

We are in the midst of production and are seeking to raise just a portion of the funding for our post production and location costs! We are mostly funded but just need that extra little bump :) Here's where we are so far:

 

5 to 6 fully funded 20 min episodes, standard for 1/2 hour television! We just need enough to film an additional episode, and if we get beyond, make even MORE episodes! So....Here's the story!!!

 

STORY

Dating is hard in the city, and for one woman it's pure desperation at this point. Amidst THAT chaos, we also are also focused on a budding star, a vengeful photographer's assistant, a powerful female entertainment executive, and a fashion photographer just trying to make an honest living. All of our characters intermix in ways none of them would have expected. Think Shitts Creek meets Sex and the City meets Gossip Girl! We are also already in talks for a streaming service distribution, so this project is GOING PLACES!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Looking to raise just an addition 750 to get us through, any amount will help, but this will make finishing this beast SO much easier! We are already slated for a release THIS SUMMER!

 

Funds go toward:

Music

Locations

Actor Pay

Post Production

SFX

 

SEE PERKS FOR DETAILS ON WHAT YOU CAN GET :)
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi everyone! My name is Robert Michael, creator of the original comedy series, Girl Chill! I've also created content for REELZ network in the form of music production and I am the creator of the newly released dogsledding documentary, Heartprints in the Snow!
We are in the midst of production and are seeking to raise just a portion of the funding for our post production and location costs! We are mostly funded but just need that extra little bump :) Here's where we are so far:
 
5 to 6 fully funded 20 min episodes, standard for 1/2 hour television! We just need enough to film an additional episode, and if we get beyond, make even MORE episodes! So....Here's the story!!!
 
STORY
Dating is hard in the city, and for one woman it's pure desperation at this point. Amidst THAT chaos, we also are also focused on a budding star, a vengeful photographer's assistant, a powerful female entertainment executive, and a fashion photographer just trying to make an honest living. All of our characters intermix in ways none of them would have expected. Think Shitts Creek meets Sex and the City meets Gossip Girl! We are also already in talks for a streaming service distribution, so this project is GOING PLACES!
 

What We Need & What You Get
Looking to raise just an addition 750 to get us through, any amount will help, but this will make finishing this beast SO much easier! We are already slated for a release THIS SUMMER!
 
Funds go toward:
Music
Locations

Post Production
SFX

 
SEE PERKS FOR DETAILS ON WHAT YOU CAN GET :)

story:
The Breakdown

Dru is just your average anxious introvert who’s in the middle of a psychotic breakdown. She thinks the world has ended, but she has pesky hallucinations of her friends and family that have come back to haunt her. The question is: what’s real? The end of the world? Or humanity’s survival?

To process all this Dru broadcasts her apocalypse theories and last-human-life-hacks into the world. She does this using a self made radio-tower in case any survivors might be listening. Of course, if the world isn’t over, they could also just be available via iTunes.

The Creator

Abigail Brosh earned her BA from Tisch School of the Arts at New York University, where she majored in drama and studied both screenwriting and directing. She has experience both in front of and behind the camera, and is passionate about film in all stages of its development.

Her screenplay for “Supporting Paranormal” was a semifinalist in the Storyteller’s Initiative at SeriesFest, and her short/music video (co-created with Kat Ahn and directed by Laura Dziamba “Sci-Fi Chicks” was entered into Official Selection at Austin Comedy Short Film Festival where it won Best Original Music.

The Budget

The money fundraised on Indiegogo will help to provide:

  • Hiring a crew and equipment for the shoot
  • Location fees
  • Meals and crafty
  • Festival Submissions
  • Props, costumes, and makeup
  • An underground bunker for the cast, crew, and all donators in the event of an apocalyptic event (just kidding… but like… hypothetically what are everyone’s favorite non-perishable snacks?)

Any and all donations will be greatly appreciated and put to good use. Thank you all for your time and consideration.

story:
Bound is a project about human awareness. It is a project that we want to do right and really show the people what human trafficking really is like. 

Our goal is to reach $1,900 for this project to help for costs in making for the film. We also plan to give most of what comes in to the following human trafficking organizations. 

Operation Freedom Awareness, Greenville, SC  

SWITCH, Greenville, SC  

Hope Center for Children, Spartanburg, SC  

Lighthouse for Life, Columbia, SC  

Doors to Freedom, Summerville, SC  

Human trafficking is a big issue locally, through each state, even worldwide. This is something that continues to grow and really touches our hearts that this happens. We hope through this film we can make a big impact to anyone who sees this. It is time to help make a change and that time is now! 

Please give what ever you can and help us reach awareness! Please like, share, and make a difference in someones life.

story:
Short Summary

When Kevin Bell (Frank Beckwith) and Joy Thompson (Jordan Johnson) meet in an unusual scenario, their lives take an unexpected turn. Visualize Eddie Murphy’s suave character in Boomerang and Sana Lathan’s girl next door charm in The Best Man. Then you mix the vibe and music of Brown Sugar, infused with Jazz and Hip Hop. This is the essence of The Very Thought of You.

What's going on everyone?!

I'm super excited for this project! The Very Thought of You is a passion project that I have created with the loving spirit of 90's and 00's romantic-dramedies in mind. I wanted to bring back sexy love stories with relatable characters, that you are challenged by.

We need YOUR help to achieve this goal! We have plenty of ways for you to get involved and we can't wait to work together to achieve this goal. Let's get it!!!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Let's get to business, for season one of the show we are looking for $15,000. This will help fund the entire first season of the series.
  • We have unique perks with fun names relating to aspects and vibe we are going for in the show. Some perks include digit downloads (expected spring 2021), bonded signed episode scripts, sign posters, cameo appearance, t-shirts, hats, exclusive Virtual Watch Party invites and much more! Please look into the perks section!
  • If the goal isn't reached we will still use the funds raised to pay for production expenses.

The Company

                                                   

Focal Beam Entertainment L.L.C. is a new multimedia production company founded by Frank Beckwith. The Very Thought of You will be the company's first project, with many more to come in the future.

 

The Impact

YOU are a critical component to the success of the project! I can't understate that EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS! Besides the financial support, this project also provide jobs for the cast and crew!

                                             Here is a chart of the budget estimate.

 

                      

         

                            

Key Team Members

                                                   

Frank Beckwith is a actor/writer/producer from New York City. He is known for his roles in "Like A Tattoo" , "Consequences" and as lead in the play "Cherish Every Preious Moment". He is  currently working on the series The Very Thought of You, where he serves as creator, writer, producer and lead. 

                                                   

Morgen A. Whiteman is a director/writer from Maryland. Since graduating with a Master of Arts in Speech-Language Pathology from the George Washington University in 2014, she has worked as a speech-language pathologist in a variety of settings while concurrently writing, producing, and directing short film projects.  Morgen’s short film, MOM, won the judges’ award for best fiction film at the 2017 Born in Baltimore Film and Photography Festival. Ms. Whiteman serves as director on The Very Thought of You. Congratulations to Ms. Whiteman for her acceptance into American Film Institute (AFI) in California!

 

                                                     

Rhonda Fisher is a producer better known for her work on the web series "Like A Tattoo", "Staying In Lane Season 2" and short film "Bruises". She was responsible for casting and production work for these series. Ms. Fisher serves as producer on The Very Thought of You.

More Crew Members Include

Assistant Director/Producer: Jamill Crooks

Art Director: Erin Lett

Associate Producer: Carol Boston

Director of Photography: Colbie Fray

 

Risks & Challenges

There will be challenges with this project we are aware of that. However, we have a great team who have done several projects and have extensive experience. What qualifies me to overcome these obstacles you may ask?

  • I'm very head strong and determined to succeeded.  As a business owner, writer, producer and actor I've seen my fair share of obstacles. I am inspired by the greats before me i.e Keenon Ivory Waynes, Tyler Perry, Spike Lee, Malcolm D. Lee, Salim & Mara Brock Akil and many more. These are the people I look at for inspiration and great storytelling.
  • When problems arise, as the leader, I will make sure things are solved to the best of the team's abilities and to the betterment of the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you are unable to support financially during this time. However, that doesn't mean you can't help.

Please help spread the word on your social media platforms, as well as ask others to do the same. Feel free to use the share tools and links. Thank you so much!

Lee, Salim & Mara Brock Akil and many more. These are the people I look at for inspiration and great storytelling.

story:
Short Summary

Hi Saultites! 

We are Katie and Trish, the creators and stars of the award-winning comedy web series My Roommate's an Escort. We met at a friend's birthday party three years ago and decided to take our careers into our own hands and write and produce a series. After a lot of hard work, we are proud of the success of My Roommate's an Escort which includes countless awards at festivals around the world, press coverage on outlets including etalk CTV, the Globe and Mail, CP24, and the Sault Star, and over a million views across platforms. My Roommate's an Escort is one of the most successful web series in Canadian history.

From dancing with the Trixie Hardy Dance Studio, to Miss White's drama class at Sir James Dunn, Trish owes her love of performing to the teachers and community of Sault Ste. Marie. Trish's first job on a film set was in the Soo and has led to many work opportunities. It only makes sense to return back home where she got her start to work together with Sault locals and maybe even inspire others to pursue their dreams.

With your partnership you can help us to continue in the pursuit of sharing comedic content with our established and growing audience. We are on a journey in what at times can be a challenging industry, and we cannot express the magnitude of excitement we have for teaming up with you to create season two. The budget we raise will help us take our careers to the next level, and will respectively promote your business in the Soo.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 50K for the following expenditures.

-Cast wages

-Crew wages (Cinematographer, Assistant Directors, Production Manager/Co-ordinator, Continuity, Grips, Electrics, Gaffer, Set Design, Make-up Artist, Wardrobe, Art Department,etc)

-Food

-Transportation

-Accommodations

-Wardrobe 

-Props

-Equipment Rentals 

-Insurance

-Post production costs (editing, colour correction, sound design, score)

-Social media marketing

-Publicity

-Festival submissions and travel 

What you get:

-For $500 we will feature your business location (and logo) in an episode. 

-We will give you an executive producer credit in season two of the web series, and an IMDB executive producer credit.

-If you are an ACTRA member we will give you a walk-on role (as we are an ACTRA production)

-An invite to our black-tie, red carpet gala in Sault Ste. Marie - and your logo on our red carpet back drop.

-A social media post promoting your business

The Impact

  • Our project is valuable because it gives the world a chance to see the Soo in mainstream media! 
  • We've had a lot of success with this project so far. We hope that you can also take pride in our finished product as well as in our next round of festivals and accolades! Our awards from season one include the following:

2018 Best International Series – Miami Web Festival – Miami, USA

2017 Best Web/New Media Award – Kapow Intergalactic Film Festival, Los Angeles, USA

2017 Best Actress – Katie Uhlmann – Yes! Let’s Make a Movie Festival, Montreal, Canada

2017 Audience Choice Award – Austin Revolution Film Festival, Austin, USA

2017 Director’s Choice Award – Best Web Series – Austin Revolution Film Festival, Austin, USA

Other Ways You Can Help

We are also accepting in-kind donations in exchange for the same perks. If you can provide any of the following please email us at myroommatesanescortcomedy@gmail.com! If you have something to offer that's not on the list - send us an email anyway, because we can most likely partner with you as well!

-Flights to the Soo (maybe you own an airline...)

-Accommodations in the Soo (maybe you own a hotel, a motel, or a B&B or you don't mind an actor sleeping on your couch...)

-You want to lend us wardrobe (maybe you own a clothing store)

-You want to provide catering for a day (or longer) for our cast and crew (maybe you own a restaurant)

-You want to provide coffee (maybe you own a coffee shop)

-You want to provide candy (maybe you own a candy shop)

-You want to provide transportation during the shoot (maybe you own a car or a cab company)

-You want to provide hair styling (maybe you're a hairstylist)

  • If you don't have any $$$ or in-kind offerings, we also appreciate you sharing this campaign on social media and helping us spread the word!!!
