-Flights to the Soo (maybe you own an airline...)
-Accommodations in the Soo (maybe you own a hotel, a motel, or a B&B or you don't mind an actor sleeping on your couch...)
-You want to lend us wardrobe (maybe you own a clothing store)
-You want to provide catering for a day (or longer) for our cast and crew (maybe you own a restaurant)
-You want to provide coffee (maybe you own a coffee shop)
-You want to provide candy (maybe you own a candy shop)
-You want to provide transportation during the shoot (maybe you own a car or a cab company)
-You want to provide hair styling (maybe you're a hairstylist)
If you don't have any $$$ or in-kind offerings, we also appreciate you sharing this campaign on social media and helping us spread the word!!!

story:
Hi, it’s Dan Shinder, founder of Drum Talk TV. It’s time to bust out a rocking Drum Talk TV membership site with all new exclusive content. This will not take away any of our free content you are used to seeing on social media or our main site. The Membership site will have three tiers of subscriptions, with all new stuff, and we will keep doing what we have been doing on the free side!

The membership site's exclusive content will include extended interviews only available there; videos and PDF’s full of tips on creating a great rehearsal and recording room for drums, micing, recording, mixing, and mastering from the pros; tips from pros about networking, getting more session work, professional conduct, getting support show/tour work, everything from setting up a kit as a beginner to what to consider for seasoned pros who need to change or adapt to varied genres of music, developing your sound, tours of your favorite artist’s varied budgets—not a paid shopping guide, but so much more from industry leaders; info on marketing, management, and publishing; and so much more we cannot yet reveal.

The best part is that for contributing even a one-time-only $10 or more contribution to the crowdfunding campaign we are now running to help make this happen, you get our premium subscription level for an entire year! We also have additional amazing perks for contributors, even at the $1 to $5 dollar levels and all Perks are Giftable - Perfect with the holidays coming!

Drum Talk TV has been 90% self-funded by me, a regular guy who had a big vision for an online drumming community—not a wealthy guy; and with no start-up capital at all in the beginning. Along the way, we have had a few sponsors/advertisers, such as The Ahead Wicked Chops Practice Pad, WalkaBout, KickStrap, Alesis and a few others along the journey.


This January DTTV will be 7 years old and it’s time to scale in a big way to provide you with even more content and experiences. All the other media companies covering the world of drumming focus on the big pop stars, rock stars, jazz stars, and educators.

While we have brought you all of those since the beginning, we have also been bringing you so much more, such as live streaming coverage of the Winter NAMM show with 200+ video interviews each year with makers of gear to show you what’s new, as well as many of your favorite artists and educators, and hidden gems who are the rising stars. We were recently brought to The Singapore Drum Fest for the third year in a row to cover the Drum-Off Global, and to Japan for the first time to cover taiko drumming events.

We also curate music with drumming and percussion styles, genres, and cultures from all over the world. (No one else does this!) And most of this includes submissions from our fans from over 130 countries.

We have a handful of part-time employees who help crank out all our new content, while creating, editing, scheduling and publishing more for you to enjoy each week.

Building the membership site requires us to bring on a brainiac project manager (We have our eyes on someone!) and a team of techies to make it happen for you in a timely manner and spectacularly! Not to mention additional staff to create the new content with our artist and educator affiliates.

All this and more require funds we don’t have. The crowdfunding campaign we are running will help us raise the necessary funds to seed this expansion, while giving you, our campaign contributors, a wide variety of rocking perks based on your contribution level. These include amazing, fun, one-of-a-kind experiences for helping us take the first giant steps to making this happen. So help us light this rocket for stellar perks and a membership site that’s out of this world!

Join us on this extended journey and thanks for following what we do and for your support for our exspansion for YOU!

Dan

We were recently brought to The Singapore Drum Fest for the third year in a row to cover the Drum-Off Global, and to Japan for the first time to cover taiko drumming events.We also curate music with drumming and percussion styles, genres, and cultures from all over the world. (No one else does this!) And most of this includes submissions from our fans from over 130 countries.We have a handful of part-time employees who help crank out all our new content, while creating, editing, scheduling and publishing more for you to enjoy each week.Building the membership site requires us to bring on a brainiac project manager (We have our eyes on someone!) and a team of techies to make it happen for you in a timely manner and spectacularly! Not to mention additional staff to create the new content with our artist and educator affiliates.All this and more require funds we don’t have. The crowdfunding campaign we are running will help us raise the necessary funds to seed this expansion, while giving you, our campaign contributors, a wide variety of rocking perks based on your contribution level. These include amazing, fun, one-of-a-kind experiences for helping us take the first giant steps to making this happen. So help us light this rocket for stellar perks and a membership site that’s out of this world!Join us on this extended journey and thanks for following what we do and for your support for our exspansion for YOU!Dan

story:
Short Summary

We are very eager to get this project off the ground because not only is it a female-led production, but a local Chicago production as well. As a creative team we believe in inclusion, diversity, and generating opportunities for people to display their talents and abilities. The show's Creator and Executive Producer, Alyssa, has written a compelling story that is relatable even though it takes place 32 years from now. We are honored to have lined up an ambitious and talented ensemble cast, and we plan to start shooting in late June.

Executive Producer/Writer/Actress - Alyssa Haglund

Producer/Director - Nikki Hassinger

UPM - Grishma Shah

1st Assistant Director - A.M. Tapia

Director of Photography - Scott Langford

Generation Beta fits in the lane of sci-fi drama with lots of mystery and intrigue. If The 100 + Maze Runner + The Killing had a baby, it would be Generation Beta.

While assembling this project, we realized the scope was much larger than originally planned. Making a TV show takes a decent amount of money. We plan to film the pilot and begin working on subsequent episodes. We would love to contribute to our local economy by being able to pay our film/TV industry professionals a fair wage, and we need funding for:

  • Camera package and lenses 
  • Sound equipment
  • Lighting equipment
  • Special and visual effects
  • Hair, make-up, and wardrobe
  • Production design and set decoration
  • Enough food and drink to keep the cast and crew fed and hydrated on set (safety first!)
  • Post-production and editing support

There will be some incredible perks for all of you amazing contributors! And, you will be a part of something transformative.

story:
A little bit about the project

A debut comedy pilot created by actor, writer and comedian Jess McDonagh noted as 'One to watch’ by The Funny Women Awards and as having, ‘Comedy Chops’ by Adrian Mills (BBC).

This is a massive passion project that Jess has been working on over the past year, and we’re incredibly excited to help share this catalog of bizarre characters with the world. The pilot consists of 12 different sketches which take place anywhere from your local community talent show to the top of the Jolly Rodger. 7 of these sketches which will be filmed in Summer 2019 and the rest will be completed in winter, with the aim of a Spring 2020 release date.

Working alongside and steering her in all the right directions is local producer Adil Ladha. Adil has recently been working on several filming projects in London and is excited to return to Manchester and help with the pilot. Together we’ve assembled an incredibly talented crew to bring ‘Down Right Deluded’ to life and we would absolutely love you to become part of making these characters and their stories a reality.

'McDonagh’s ability to change character and accent at the drop of a hat was something to behold.’ - North West End Review.

 

Director's Statement

‘I would love to create memorable characters that might inspire another young girl who doesn’t yet understand that being funny can be more than her forte, but her career. I grew up watching Kathy Burke as Linda La Hughes in, ‘Gimmie, Gimmie, Gimmie.’ She was the first female comedy character actor that I adored, I would mimic her character again and again. I love what I do, especially when it makes others laugh and with your help I have the opportunity to bring my characters to life and do them justice.’

(Extra Information) Jess McDonagh credits: On her second Stand Up Comedy gig she ‘Beat the Frog’ at Manchester's infamous Frog and Bucket comedy club, winning the competition. She can be seen in the Mentos: Say Hello Advert and has starred in a multiple short films and theater productions around the UK including She in ‘The Pensive Federation’ Oldham Coliseum, Filming for both ITV and the BBC  as a performer in Just some Sketch night and having previously trained in Clowning. After the sell out tour of her Richard  III inspired satire Car Park King, she has always continued to develop unique and quirky characters. The play will be going on it’s second nationwide tour over Autumn 2019.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to make this the best that it can be! Doing so means having the resources behind the project to help raise the bar. This project that has been a year in the making, and fortunately we have been able to source a lot of the equipment and personnel that we need in order to get the cameras rolling.

However film making is expensive and there are so many other things that we need to acquire in order to make this as absurd as possible. All of your donations will go towards helping us to acquire the best props, locations and costumes. As well as going towards transportation, insurance, and post production.

We really appreciate anything you can give towards helping ‘Down Right Deluded’ come to life (Lightning sound and dramatic effect).

So why not join us on our this wacky journey to making our first comedy pilot a reality!

As a thank you for supporting us we wanted to reward you! Check out our perks to the right.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We completely understand if you can’t make a financial contribution, however we hope that the fact you’ve read up to this point means you are interested in what we’re about!

 

Sharing this page is a GREAT help. Not a good help, a GREAT help. And the best way to do that is to go back to the top of the page and click on the SHARE button.

 

We're always looking to grow our audience and want to keep you updated with what happens with Down Right Deluded.

 

So if you'd like to give us a hand, follow us on our social pages, please share our content and show us some love with those likes and shares.

 

Social Media Facebook: @jessmcdonaghcomedy

                        Instagram: @jessmcdonaghcomedy

story:
Shortish Summary

The Art of Blowing it is a Mockumentary about fictional former child star Emmy Hart's career reboot in 2019. This show is inspired by the quick wit of The Comeback, the odd characters of Christopher Guest films & highlights the absurdity of Reality TV's Mega Mogaled Kardashians.

 Sidekick Productions Award Winning Show Skeleton Crew is a body positive tv show that has always found amazing talent based on its rule of thumb.  Size and color-blind casting. Because people come in all shapes and size.  While casting The Art of Blowing we used the same method when going through the thousands of submissions.

 

 

 

What We Need

Rental of locations- $2000 

Feed the actors and crew for 10 days of filming- $1000

Props & Costumes $600

Music and Mixing: $500

Postcards, Postage, Posters & Branding Materials: $550

Festival Budget (Entry Fees 2019): $1,000 

Facebook & IG  Boosting (2019 Budget): $850

Buffer to account for a portion of the 8% platform/processing fees: $560*

Total: $7060

 

What You Get

The Art of Blowing swag and the feeling of knowing you helped create this show with us.  

 

The Impact

Your contribution will change everyone's lives.  Now, go with me on this one.  You donating of $5 bucks will support this shoestring budget into real production. The Art of Blowing it is relevant and fresh.  It's a funny web series and promoting it will get digital foot traffic.  Viewers on a youtube link are like "customers"  in a store. If you have 60,000 views on a video I am more likely to get a meeting with someone at Comedy Central or Netflix than if I had 2,000. When I get a network deal Josh and I will be writers in a writers room and will have money to be able to fund more projects in the future.  When we get on a network we will finally be able to share our talents with the world.  As well as star in our own work.   #kevinsmith #lisakudrow #rickygervis #issarae #frankieshaw #shondaland #lenadunham

 

Cast & Crew

This show would not be without the inspiration of this man. Joshua R Pangborn. He inspired me to create my own show.

 

 

 

Emmy Hart- The Star

Ashley Monique Menard is the creator and director of The Art of Blowing it. She can been seen recently in the upcoming Bric comedy All Hail Beth, Step into my Office and The Skeleton Crew Season 1-4. Ashley can also be seen singing Adele, Lady Gaga, & Janis Joplin with her band The Evergreen Experience. Ashley is excited to bring the world of Emmy Hart to your TV and change the way plus sized women are viewed.

 

Felix- The Producer

Joshua R Pangborn

 

Nana Reba- The Grandma

Rev.Yolanda is a singer/songwriter/trans-femme performance artist, and Interfaith Minister who's work as an Artist and Sacred Activist has been honored as a Blues Hall of Fame award winner, 2 time MAC Award winner, and as a member of The GLBT Hall Of Fame. 

Rev.Yolanda's current live music ministry is called: Church With A 2 Drink Minimum,  "A TRANS-tastic, Interfaith, Interspiritual, God Optional Musical Celebration of Life ".  Singing together, laughing, having brunch and celebrating life with inspirational music and message, welcoming all paths and traditions. We affirm the Sacred Mystery within, and embrace the diversity of humankind.

Rev. Yolanda's MAC Award winning cabaret show "Rev. Yolanda's Old Time Gospel Hour" is also a full feature documentary by Ike Allen of AVAIYA MEDIA-view the movie on AMAZON

Rev. Yolanda is currently working on a full length, autobiographical musical theater piece entitled "The Church Of The Alien Love Child Presents: The Passion of Rev. Yolanda".

 www.yolanda.net/church

 

 

 

Pixel- The Childhood Best Friend

Lydia Granered is a queer actor and musician originally from Nashville, TN. She brings her southern roots into all of her work. Her head is full of funny voices and Elvis songs, and she is not up to date on pop culture references. Playful yet soulful. Classic yet original. Great at high-fives. Her first-length album comes out February 2019! 

For more, check out lydiagranered.com. 

Oscar- The New Guy

Paul Antzoulis

 

 

 

Moses- The Famous Fiance

Hunter Thore grew up in North Carolina and moved to NYC to play a part in Robby Benson’s Open Heart at the Cherry Lane Theatre. After that he studied under Terry Knickerbocker at the esteemed William Esper Studio. NY Theatre credits include Call it Clover and Affections of an Alleycat at Theatre Row, Last Call, Tape, Beirut Rocks (The Flea), The Bump (US Premiere), and North of Providence. Aside from many short films he can currently be seen as Drake on The award winning web series, Skeleton Crew.

 

Mitchell- Professional Cuddler

Stuart Kiczek

 

 

 

Hilda- The Morning Show Host

Bryn is beyond excited to play the role of Hilda in "The Art of Blowing It".  Bryn got into the acting game a little late in life.  After many years of always longing to be an actress she finally summoned the courage to take an acting class in 2011.  She was hooked instantly, and never looked back.  Bryn refers to herself as a Quirky Southern California native, and relocated to the East Coast in 2013.  Since then Bryn has constantly been studying her craft at the Actors Gym in Hamden, CT and The Actors Green Room in NYC.  She's had roles in 7 commercials, most recently she played an overly aggressive massage therapist for Breathless Resorts and Spa's.  She's also had lead and supporting roles in 15 short films, one of which she co-wrote and co-produced titled "Swink" which was screened at the Actors Green Room best of last spring.  Bryn will also been seen in guest start roles in upcoming episodes of "Grave Mysteries" and "Evil Lives Here" for the Investigation Discovery channel.  She is so grateful to Ashley Menard and Josh Pangborn for casting her in a delicious role where she gets to play her quirky self.

Timmy Jimmy- Talk Show Host

 

It will feel like a Kevin Smith movie or a Wes Anderson Film cause you will see a bit of cross of for cast from Sidekick Productionland.  https://www.youtube.com/user/SidekickProd

Skeleton Crew's own Joshua R. Pangborn will be playing Felix the producer, Stuart Kiczek, will be playing the role of Mitchell, a former child star.  With Hunter Thore,  Paul Antzoulis, Joshua R. Price, Phil Korz, Mark Eugene Garcia, Brad Forenza, Gabe Awan, Bryn Berg, Lisa King, Ken Dillion,  Christian Martel, Barbara Thomas, and Rev. Yolanda lending their comedic talents to the hollyweird world that is The Art of Blowing it.  I am excited to work with these brilliant actors.  Lydia Grandered, Jesse Regis, Camila Melgar, Tony White, José André Sibaja,  Kim Magnas.

I am delighted to work with the visionaries at Oblivion Films Ibai Vigil & José André Sibaja.   Creator of Upcoming Youtube Hit Chaka and the Dog.   http://oblivionfilms.eu/

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for reading this. If you don't have the funds to contribute, look I get it. I work 3 jobs to pay my rent.  Life is hard.  But, if you have some Andrew Jackson's lying around click the buttons on the side.  And back to my broke friends. I love you and want to hug you. I feel the pain too.  But, you can share my campaign with your friends and then it will go all around this globe.  

 My vision is to get Macuaclly Culkin for season2  and the sell the show to Comedy Central.  Broad City did it. So can we. But, we need your help to make it and get to get it out there for people to see it.  

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

 

1. FOLLOW US:

It is absolutely FREE to follow us on here on Seed and Spark, as well as on our Instagram and facebook page Doing this is so incredibly helpful!

https://www.instagram.com/theartofblowingitthes...

https://www.facebook.com/theartofblowingitthese...

 

2. SPREAD THE WORD:

It costs you absolutely nothing but a few seconds of your time and is extremely beneficial to our campaign! Sharing our page and/or inviting others helps get the word out! It takes a village!

 

3. CONTRIBUTE:

While following and spreading the word is a great way to help, the most beneficial way to support us is by contributing to our campaign! Your contribution goes a long way and gets us one step closer to completing this project and reaching out to people who have experienced the pressure of being alone. We also have really awesome incentives that can get you involved in the process! To contribute, check out the incentives to the right OR you can contribute directly to a budget item that we need by checking out wishlist page located in the wishlist tab under the pitch video! We are so grateful for anyone who can contribute and join us in the moviemaking process!

THANK YOU!

We are so thankful to everyone who is a part of the project, including you! Thank you for taking the time to read and learn about our short film. We can't wait to share it with the world. Thank you!

 

I'd like to conclude with this- I love you. Thank you.

-Ashley Monique Menard

Qween to  The Art of Blowing

Star/Director/Writer and Sex Icon Extraordinaire.

 

All my love,

Ashley Monique Menard

story:
What is "On Air"?

On Air is an award winning, single camera sitcom that follows the cast and crew of a hit variety show and their lives after the camera's stop rolling. It takes the wacky and off the wall characters of Community, mixes it with the style of Brooklyn Nine-Nine, and puts them all in a 30 Rock like setting.

After the dismissal of his mentor due to sexual harassment claims, the star of a hit variety show clashes with its bubbly, energetic producer, who seems desperate for approval. Opposites attract... sometimes, in this hilarious sitcoms that show the best stories truly are the ones that happen off camera.

A week after the producer of Weekly Tonight, Carl Norman, is fired due to sexual harassment accusations, HR is interviewing the cast. Everyone is understandably caught off guard, most notably the show's easy going, sarcastic, and immature star, Josh Tilson, who co-created the series with Carl and feels a sense of loyalty to him. The rest of the cast is made up of Melanie Reed, the once disgraced child star turned social justice advocate, Jebediah Polumbo, the eccentric and politically incorrect English comedian, Chris Key, Josh's underachieving and stoner best friend since child hood, and new girl, Emma Ricci, who hails from Hollywood royalty and is trying to break free of her family's shadow.

The mega conservative Polumbo believes that Carl shouldn't have been fired based on one accusation, claiming "it's never been harder to be a straight, white, male than right now." while the uber liberal Melanie passionately disagrees, claiming that we should believe victims. The exchange is interrupted when Josh sees Alan Pattinson, the network executive's pushover son, and questions him about the Carl's termination. Alan reveals to the cast that he has enough on his plate, and in addition to a journalist coming in to interview them, the new producer of the show will also be introducing himself. Emma then notices an older gentlemen walk into the building, sporting a suit and brief case. He introduces him as Harold Krepps, a no non sense, boring, dry, individual, who comes off more as a robot than a human. Josh comes to the conclusion that this must be the new producer, and he spends the day with Harold, hoping to feel him out.

While Josh and Harold spend the day together, Melanie and Polumbo continue their debate about sexual harassment, while Emma, Alan, and Chris, all feeling they don't belong, try to figure their place among the cast and life in general. During this, Richard Dyer, a flamboyant, happy go lucky, and upbeat family man, is hanging out in the break room and gets to know each of the cast members.

Who Am I?

I'm Ryan Conway, the creator and star of On Air. I'm a 23 year old actor/comedian/writer who graduated from Sacred Heart University (In Fairfield Connecticut) last spring, with a degree in communications and a focus on film and television! 

For as long as I could remember, I always loved to make people laugh and smile. I just like making people happy. I think that there's already enough negativity in this world, so I just like to be positive and try to spread that with whatever I do, whether it's in my work or even just talking to someone on the street.

Quick story: At age 2, doctors found a brain tumor and diagnosed me with brain cancer. Luckily, I was fortunate and it was able to get it removed, and my parents paid for the best physical therapists to make sure that I was able to regain all of my motor skills and go back to who I was before. It was a long road - that's what they tell me, I don't really remember - but, all throughout I would apparently watch a lot of television, most notably comedies. I guess it gave me some kind of reassurance to watch something and laugh when going through what I did.

At age 10, I enrolled in John Robert Powers Agency. I took classes, had a couple auditions for commercials, etc. After a year, I quit (because I guess in my 11 year old mind, I should've made it big by then!) When I was 15, I got the bug again, and joined interFACE talent agency. There I was able to score background roles on shows such as Orange is the New Black and Blue Bloods. I left the agency after two years and went to college to pursue a communications degree.

I took multiple production/film/ television courses in my four years, and was involved in a variety of videos (I was the head writer and one of the stars of my university's variety show, Daylight, among other things). My senior year, I was tasked to come up with a final project that would utilize everything I learned throughout my undergraduate career. I decided to make my own sitcom, something that would make people laugh and smile, the way all the sitcoms I watched growing up did for me.

The result was On Air. It was a single camera sitcom I wrote, directed, and starred in. The cast was made up of myself and a number of friends, all of whom had never acted before, we used non professional equipment, etc. It was a very amateur production, and you could probably write a book on what a nightmare it was to shoot (Just to give you a sense of what we dealt with, we were forced to recast one of the main roles a week before the project was due). Despite all of this the original pilot was very well received by those who saw it. It won the award for "Best TV Show" at the Sacred Heart University Senior Honors, and even did well in festivals, earning the title of "Finalist" five times in addition to five "Official Selections". Point being, it came out so much better than I imagined.

Call it wishful thinking (I call it confidence), but I think we have something really special. Am I a bit biased? Sure, but I truly believe this could be something big, and I wanted to give it the care an attention it deserves.

I went back and rewrote the entire pilot script. It's funnier, more structured, the characters are more fleshed out, etc. and I would love for nothing more than to bring it to you. 

What we Need.

We are seeking $8,000 (flexible goal) to help fund the production of On Air's new pilot. The money would be handled by me, and would go towards getting a full crew behind the scenes, better equipment, paying our amazingly talented cast, craft services and meals so everyone is fed and hydrated during shoot days, hotels for talent that would be coming out of state, make up, music royalties, hand sanitizer and masks to stay safe and clean during COVID, etc.

As I mentioned before, the cast was made up of people who had no prior acting experience, we had non professional equipment, and we shot the pilot for no money, but it still came out great. This begs the question why would I need $8,000 to shoot it again? Well, a couple of reasons; We filmed the original pilot (37 minutes in length) in 6 months. All the actors were friends of mine and were doing it for free, so we shot on their schedule. I'm lucky I even finished episode 1, because we tried to shoot an episode 2 by the same means, but it proved to be lightning in a bottle, and I realized another episode couldn't be done in those conditions. Secondly, even though I am extremely proud of what we managed to do, I think it could be a lot better. The lighting, sound, and other technical aspects in the pilot are severely lacking, and I believe that if the technical aspect is on the same level as the content in the episode, it will be something truly great. Lastly, I mentioned above the success the original pilot has when it comes to awards and festivals. The way I see it, if we can accomplish all of that with what limited resources we had, imagine what we can do with some help.

If we do not reach our entire goal, then we'll still use whatever funds we have to produce the pilot episode for On Air, we would just have to adjust the budget. If we manage to make more money than we asked for, we will put it towards a potential second episode, publicity to get eyes on the pilot, even more resources to help production, etc. 

The Impact 

In this section, they told me to write how my project is valuable to the contributor (you) and the world. To be honest, I don't really know how to answer this. I'm not going to tell you"This needs to be in the world because A, B, and, C." However, I will say that I think the world could always use more positivity, more laughter, and more things that can bring us together, rather than split us apart, and I think that On Air, even if its contribution to that is small, can contribute nonetheless. 

Risks & Challenges

We're pretty much living through the definition of a risk and a challenge regarding the COVID-19 pandemic, which will admittedly make it hard to film. Rest assured, all of our crew would be socially distanced, they, along with cast members who aren't on camera, would be wearing masks, we would have hand sanitizer on set for people to clean their hands throughout the day, gloves, meals in individual containers, etc.

We will also require everyone who will be on set to get a COVID test before production, and we will check their temperatures every day when they arrive on set. It will also be mandatory for the cast and crew to quarantine two weeks before production.

It's also possible that someone involved in the production might be test positive for COVID-19. If this is the case, then everyone else would be required to get a COVID test and self quarantine. If the test  comes back negative, then those individuals would resume production. 

Other than that, a ton of things could go wrong, scheduling could be screwed up, an actor/actress could not feel comfortable coming in anymore because of COVID, or anything in between. However, you've heard about  my experience shooting the original pilot, and to be honest, the thing I learned most about that experience is how to adjust on the fly, and take things in stride. So, I believe whatever other obstacles come our way, we'll be ready to deal with them and come up with alternative solutions.

How Else Can I Help?

We understand that during this uncertain times, it might be hard to contribute, and that's totally fine! However, you can still help us grow and help our ultimate goal with getting this on the air(no pun intended. Okay, pun kind of intended). You can follow us on our Instagram @OnAir_TVShow. You could also watch and give a like to the original On Air pilot, which is currently on YouTube. You could help spread the word of it, and who knows, maybe the more people that know about us gives us some new opportunities. You can share this campaign to other people who might potentially want to invest. The possibilities are endless! Help us grow, help On Air get noticed, help us make this something big, by any means necessary!

story:
Why an ATWFF Season 2 feature documentary now?

The Around The World For Free concept - or as we like to call it, the "ultimate trip in humanity" - is based on the simple observation that there is no better way to travel and experience the world than through the eyes of the locals. By embarking on a penniless quest and relying solely on the kindness of strangers, plus a supportive online community, to get you from place to place, you set the stage for those great unforgettable journeys of a lifetime, creating lasting friendships and bonds, and re-affirming so much of the good that still exists in our often troubled world. ATWFF sees the world with eyes wide open, yet transcends politics. It allows viewers to vicariously travel with our hosts, on a feel-good journey of discovery which never grows old.

Our friend and ATWFF Season 2 host Jeff Schroeder embarked on one such epic journey. His 106-day non-stop trek took him through 12 countries and over 29,000 miles, from climbing Mount Fuji in Japan to delivering aid to floating villages in Cambodia, to skydiving in England and so much more. It was a real-time trip, guided by locals on the ground and the online audience, and told through a series of daily webisodes, which were edited and posted from the road. These real-time webisodes (56 in all) captured the quick essence of Jeff's trip, but could not tell his full and complete story, given the limitations of the format, doing it on the fly. The ATWFF team's intent, much like it had done with the pioneering Season 1 journey (with host and co-creator Alex Boylan), was to properly sit down in post-production, go through the many hundreds of hours of Jeff's footage, and properly craft a fresh feature-length documentary that told a more complete tale of the global trek, with additional participants and previously-unseen content that we simply could not do in the webisode format.

However, after the Season 2 filming with Jeff wrapped, the production team moved on to Season 3 (with host Parvati Shallow) and in the subsequent time period the project rights temporarily restricted our abilities to re-package the material into a new series or documentary... until now! Our boutique creative shop is once again in a position to delve into the great content which we still have "in the can", and do it justice. We are also working hard at bringing back new production seasons of our show - stay tuned - so we definitely want all of the existing seasons to shine.

Bottom line - Jeff's ATWFF story deserves to be told in full, as his many fans continually remind us!

How this Indiegogo campaign will help

In the changing media and broadcast landscape, it is difficult to secure funding via existing methods for the post-production component of a project. ATWFF 2's first iteration was a web show, and getting money from our traditional broadcast partners, to re-edit it into a new format - such as a feature-length documentary - is difficult. Crowdfunding creates far less red tape, allows us to move faster and provides much greater creative freedom in shaping the doc that we know our audience will want. It will "unlock" the potential that still exists in the great un-tapped footage from Jeff's season. We are very excited to create a feature-documentary version of ATWFF 2, we feel that it will really engage audiences in the long-form adventure-travel format, plus it's something we haven't done yet with ATWFF. Your help will allow us to share Jeff's full story worldwide, with fans and supporters plus millions more who crave the content beyond the webisodes. Season 1 of ATWFF aired multiple times domestically in the US (on WGN and Outside TV) and via National Geographic and other broadcasters in all territories worldwide. Besides our cable partners we are working hard to secure a VOD home for ATWFF 2 as well.

*** For this final leg of our campaign, we have updated our fundraising target to $7.5K, to go towards the feature documentary (please note however, the Indiegogo platform still displays our original target of $65K since the figure cannot be revised post-campaign launch)

The work to be done consists primarily of editing, as well as music and sound design, colour correction, and show graphics preparation. Most of these creative tasks will be executed personally by ATWFF co-creator and Emmy-nominated editor Zsolt Luka, who also directed the series, edited the Season 2 webisodes and also edited the TV episodes of the first ATWFF (hosted by Alex). Additionally, the funds will also cover some fees for closed-captioning and formatting/outputting/delivering the feature documentary for the broadcast and VOD markets.

Funding strategy

** REVISED ** We have internally scaled back our funding target from the initial $65K (posted) to focus solely on the feature documentary's post-production target of $7.5K, which will allow us to deliver the feature-length film.
If we are unable to hit the revised documentary fundraising target, we will reduce the scope of the film but still complete the production and bring it to market.

We gratefully appreciate all support for this endeavour!

The ATWFF team

ATWFF was created by Alex Boylan, Zsolt Luka and Burton Roberts. We are a tight-knit team of veteran travellers and media producers. Alex Boylan, whose early credits include winning The Amazing Race Season 2, has hosted and produced travel and lifestyle content for nearly two decades. Zsolt Luka has been a documentary, travel and children's TV director, editor and videographer since the mid-90's. Burton Roberts, himself a Survivor alumni and adventure traveller, has brought a strong business acumen to his roster of hosting and producing projects. Between us, our team has delivered for clients ranging from CBS to Lonely Planet and everyone in between, sharing nominations for Emmy, Webby, CSA and other awards. However, we all agree that Around The World For Free remains a definitive highlight in our careers, a groundbreaking project for its time (the first online interactive, audience-guided show in the pre-Facebook days). Its purity, deeply personal nature and energy remain simply unmatched by traditional production experiences, with the friendships created during living and adventuring with locals worldwide, lasting vibrantly to this day.

We also give big thanks to the select group of "preditors" who joined us in the field after our first season, and to colleagues at Around The World Productions, as well as our co-producing partners, for allowing us to create this show.


Helping without donating

You've heard it before, but sharing and spreading the word about our campaign, when it's just not feasible to contribute financially, is another very solid way to go. Not only because it helps more people intersect with our project, but the more views, buzz and shares are generated, the greater the chance of our campaign attaining "trending" status, which in turn leads to more eyeballs and so on - the more social activity, the more the platform delivers (those algorithms!). There's also a greater chance for those serendipitous crowdfunding moments which often help passion projects reach their final goals. So thank you in advance for sharing our Indiegogo campaign with those you think it will resonate with!


Perks & Updates

We wanted to present perks that of course appeal to Jeff's hardcore fans and loyal supporters of Around The World For Free, but we hope they also resonate with serious followers of travel reality and adventuring - please take a minute to check them out, and thank you! 

Finally, we will update you regularly during our campaign, so check back for additional nuggets that we will mine and post, from the ATWFF 2 footage vault!


On behalf of the entire ATWFF team,
Thank you!
Alex, Burton & Zsolt

We are a tight-knit team of veteran travellers and media producers. Alex Boylan, whose early credits include winning The Amazing Race Season 2, has hosted and produced travel and lifestyle content for nearly two decades. Zsolt Luka has been a documentary, travel and children's TV director, editor and videographer since the mid-90's. Burton Roberts, himself a Survivor alumni and adventure traveller, has brought a strong business acumen to his roster of hosting and producing projects. Between us, our team has delivered for clients ranging from CBS to Lonely Planet and everyone in between, sharing nominations for Emmy, Webby, CSA and other awards. However, we all agree that Around The World For Free remains a definitive highlight in our careers, a groundbreaking project for its time (the first online interactive, audience-guided show in the pre-Facebook days). Its purity, deeply personal nature and energy remain simply unmatched by traditional production experiences, with the friendships created during living and adventuring with locals worldwide, lasting vibrantly to this day.We also give big thanks to the select group of "preditors" who joined us in the field after our first season, and to colleagues at Around The World Productions, as well as our co-producing partners, for allowing us to create this show.
Helping without donatingYou've heard it before, but sharing and spreading the word about our campaign, when it's just not feasible to contribute financially, is another very solid way to go. Not only because it helps more people intersect with our project, but the more views, buzz and shares are generated, the greater the chance of our campaign attaining "trending" status, which in turn leads to more eyeballs and so on - the more social activity, the more the platform delivers (those algorithms!). There's also a greater chance for those serendipitous crowdfunding moments which often help passion projects reach their final goals. So thank you in advance for sharing our Indiegogo campaign with those you think it will resonate with!
Perks & UpdatesWe wanted to present perks that of course appeal to Jeff's hardcore fans and loyal supporters of Around The World For Free, but we hope they also resonate with serious followers of travel reality and adventuring - please take a minute to check them out, and thank you! Finally, we will update you regularly during our campaign, so check back for additional nuggets that we will mine and post, from the ATWFF 2 footage vault!On behalf of the entire ATWFF team,Thank you!Alex, Burton & Zsolt

story:
UPDATE:

Sweet. Everything further is going to festivals, taking this show on the road, and any graphics clean up we have to do for Amazon. THANK YOU!

First.

Hello, again. I'm so mad I have to ask you for some help, but here I am, here we are. Basically, I was hopping along the Amazon distribution road all merrily when WHAMMO! they were like "psst you need captions". And closed captioning is way, way out of my purview so I need to outsource this-- to the tune of $450. Read on!

Short Summary

Classic Alice is the brainchild of series creator and star, Kate Hackett. When over-achiever Alice Rackham gets a bad grade on an essay because she isn’t emotionally connecting to material, she decides to live her life according to classic novels. Her friend, Andrew Prichard, uses the opportunity to make a vlog-style documentary about the process, and together they create ‘Classic Alice’. 

We've ended our YouTube run with much acclaim -- yay! -- but we don't want to just rest on our laurels, so it's time to take Alice on the road!

To Kate's total SURPRISE!! Amazon requires FCC-grade closed captioning. This wasn't really very clear in their interface. Kate has hitherto recut everything, but when faced with closed captions, she started to cry.

So instead...

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $500 bucks. Less IndieGoGo fees, that nets us the bare minimum for our closed caption files ($425 was the best price Kate found). 

Anything more, we'll put toward:

a) nicer graphics for Amazon

b) better recoloring

c) getting Musica captioned! and uploaded!

and/or d) Film festivals.

    The Impact

    If you enjoy indie filmmaking and/or digital online content, please consider donating. We make this content out of our own pockets -- and having you on our team, supporting our move to different platforms, really, really helps us as artists. We have a "cache" or WHATEVER.

    Risks & Challenges

    No risk, no bumps in the road. This is all doable. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Spread the word! You know how this goes.

       

      I'm deeply sorry we're running this. I'm so angry that it was a surprise requirement, but here we are -- and if just 45 people toss in ten bucks, we're groovy.

story:
Sometimes...family just happens.

dear life. An emotion packed drama about a lost daughter, a dead mother, a half brother in denial, and the BEST makeshift family a person could wish for. 

Character driven, relationship based situations pair with real heart and tender moments to deliver an emotionally satisfying,  heartfelt chronicle of this modern, yet unconventional 'makeshift' family.

Premise:

Neely Eason was only 10 years old when she lost her mom. Neely's half brother Jack was 19 and hardly ready for the responsibility of taking care of himself, much less raising his kid sister. The people that were closest to their mom came together to support and care for Neely and Jack- allowing their lives to remain as 'normal' as possible.

Jack took off... 

Neely held on... for dear life.

Told in two timelines; THEN and NOW, this series chronicles the lives of Neely and Jack and the "family that happened" around them. Together they navigate friendship, love, and of course, drama- raising each other along the way. A heartfelt journey, "dear life." is about the intimate and intricate connections we make in life and families that grow out of circumstance.

A compelling and emotional story, dear life.  has been carefully and passionately crafted over the last eight years.  The story delivers the purest expression of what we each  have felt on our journey through life. Loneliness. Doubt. Fear. That, in the wake of those dark times, you need a support system. A connection. A family. 

And a family...can be anybody.

Our Project:

Our production team consists of actors, writers, and engineers. We all come from different places- on the map and in life...but we are a family...and we cannot wait to bring pieces of this  grounded and heartfelt story to life in the form of a series trailer showcasing several of the most heart hitting and story guiding beats. 

In order to do that for you, we need funding. We've spent months casting actors from the New England area. Some actors are coming from New York and we  need  funds for lodging and meals. Funds are also needed for certain shooting locations and production costs.

We have a budget of $2,500.

In exchange for your generous donations, we are offering some unique dear life.  perks. Each of which is integral to the story - and you will see why. 

We truly feel dear life.  will resonate with you. That you will see parts of yourself in these  characters. In their relationships. You will connect. You will feel. You will love. 

If you can't donate, we would really love and appreciate your help in spreading the word on social media. If you've made it this far...thank you.

We hope to see your name in the credits.

story:
Backstory

Our vision for Love in America was largely romantic at first, collecting video interviews and photos supporting a book on love stories from across America. But particularly after our 2016 Journey, we encountered a profound longing across the country for Americans to reconnect in a wider sense, to overcome divisions and redefine a shared American identity. Americans are lonely, uncertain who we are, unsure how to come together, and those divisions are often intentionally exploited, for many reasons. Having encountered through our work communities across the country with very different cultures and histories, but strikingly similar concerns for the land we share, we realized two things. First, every community and culture is built around the important things that its people have in common. And, love is the most essential and meaningful of these. The love we discover and reveal isn’t simple romance, but the kind Dr. Martin Luther King, a man who understood love’s power, meant when he said, “When I speak of love I am not speaking of some sentimental and weak response. I am not speaking of that force which is just emotional bosh. I am speaking of that force which all of the great religions have seen as the supreme unifying principle of life.” And America needs that unity, breaking the stereotypes that divide us and opening minds and hearts to one another - today, more than ever.

Not only is love our best hope, but it happens in America in unique, compelling, and often pretty funny ways! We knew through our experience on the American road that telling its tales creates a space for that power to bring many Americans together, offering genuine hope, a sense of shared purpose, and more than a few laughs...the next best thing to share and unite people!

To enable us to produce this series and to engage a wider audience, we need YOUR help! Contribute NOW to make Love in America a reality!!

The Team

Yep, it’s just the two of us, and YOU! We’re capable, working hard, and with your help, looking forward to growing!

Scotte Burns writing has been featured in OnStage Magazine, The Coachella Review, Evening Street Press, Nth Degree SciFi/Fantasy, The GNU Journal, the Rocky Mountain News, Westword, and other publications. He is a former secondary English teacher with a B.A. in English and an MFA in Creative Nonfiction.  In addition to teaching and writing, Scotte is a songwriter and musician/vocalist and has written much of the music for Love in America. He has also been a Renaissance Festival swordsman, a floral supply wholesaler, a traffic signal repairman, and cab driver. At home in the Black Hills of South Dakota, he leads tours and tells stories of Deadwood history and the life of Wild Bill Hickok. He loves dogs and some other people's cats.

Toni Burns is a natural born speaker, bewildered by Americans being more afraid of public speaking than death. With a B.A. in Organizational Development and Communications, she revels in turning her obsession for research and storytelling into engaging and entertaining live presentations. She has also co-authored two fantasy novels, Fated, Book 1 of the Lorn Prophecy and Fable, Book 1 from the Djenrye Chronicles. Her love of gardening and growy things blossomed into publication in Rodale’s Organic Gardening Magazine. A biker and bicyclist, bartender and author, Renaissance Festival full-plate-metal-comedic-fighter and cookie-baking mom, carnivorous environmentalist and dog lover, born in Greece and raised in Kentucky, Toni is a bit paradoxical. A uniqueness that drives her seeking to understand other people’s heads and hearts.

Married (to each other) for 37 years, Scotte and Toni have raised two kids and a menagerie of animals, breaking a couple bones and more than a few rules along the way.


The 2019 Journey Plan 

Rosebud Sioux Reservation, SD - Tribal Council; KOYA Rez Radio station

Grand Island, NE - Hope Harbor Family Shelter; Circle of Strength (Widows and Widowers support)

Davis City, IA - Essene Community (Brotherhood of Christ - early Christian sect)

La Plata, MO - Eco-Commune (White Rose Worker Farm)

St. Louis, MO - Algonquin Country Club; Hindu Temple; 40 Acre Club (nudist camp)

Paducah, KY - Islamic Center of Paducah; Mota and Avanelle Young (longest married couple in America - 81 years.)

Nashville, TN - Little Kurdistan; Pedal (Mobile) Tavern

Talladega, AL - Talladega Superspeedway (NASCAR Team); Alabama Center for the Deaf and Blind

Montgomery, AL - Dexter Ave. Baptist Church (MLK Memorial Church); Montgomery Biscuits (Minor League Baseball Players); AIDS Alabama

Jackson, MS - TransLife (Transexual support); Mississippi GOP

Memphis, TN - Baron Hircsh Congregation (Orthodox Jewish Synagogue); AfterLife Mortuary (First gay African-American women-owned funeral home in US); Bill and Dianne Dance (cable fishing show couple)

Hot Springs, AR - Oaklawn Center for Aging (Tai Chi class)

Norman, OK - Little Saigon; Nadia Comaneci and Bart Conner (Olympic gymnasts); OU Children’s Hospital

Hutchinson, KS - Masonic Lodge; Burgess Hill Farm; Kansas Cosmosphere Museum

Dodge City, KS - TyreeAg (crop duster couple)

Canon City, CO - ADX Florence (Federal Max Security Prison)

EXTENDED  JOURNEY

Taos, NM - Taos Pueblo; Taos Earthships

Albuquerque NM - 4 Guys Named Jose (Nat. Hispanic Cultural Center)

El Paso, TX - Mario and Ismelda D’Agostino - Animal Services

Tucson AZ -

Tempe, AZ (Phoenix) - Anthony & Kasey Michael (Ink Master tattooist)

Paradise Valley, AZ (Phoenix)  - Solid Rock Teen Center - Alice Cooper and Sheryl Cooper

Kingman, AZ -

Las Vegas NV - Las Vegas Wedding Chapel; Chicken Ranch Brothel (Pahrump); Chinatown

Moab, UT -

Aspen, CO -

Denver, CO -

Scottsbluff, NE -

Deadwood, SD -

 

What Is Needed

The minimum we need to put the two of us and the basic cameras and equipment on the 2019 Journey is 7000 USD. Every dollar of this minimum goal will go toward road expenses and budget equipment to shoot and produce footage for the series, which we’ll produce ourselves upon return (line-item budget available on request). If we exceed the goal, we'll extend the route and have even more to offer! Either way, we’ll continue to do everything we can between us to bring out these stories and to offer this much needed message with the same passion and devotion that’s taken us this far.

There’s so much more possible if the two of us could get some help, though, especially with a camera/sound person or two, help with scheduling and communications, professional post-production assistance, and marketing to reach that wider audience and grow the project in coming years, including offering the field work as an intern opportunity for multimedia students at our local Black Hills State University. We have contacted several interested pros who are waiting in the wings for the generosity and support of people who see the need for love in America. So, if we reach our minimum goal, we have a secondary goal/plan of 20,000 USD ready to make the good stuff happen sooner, and betterer (ahem), with their help!

The Perks

And, as if giving a voice to love in America weren’t enough, there is something else in it for you, too!! When you contribute, you can opt to receive something in return! Please check out our perks; They are pretty awesome! And, because this is just the two of us, they offer you something valuable while not keeping us from doing the work you’re actually supporting!

Want examples? $25? You just got early online access to all completed episodes of 'Love in America’' as soon as they are produced. $50? You also get officially thanked in the show credits and on our website, and receive Tales from The Heart of America (our book) stories as they are written! $100 gets the early access, credits, Tales, and a signed photo from the Journey you helped make happen! $250 brings you all the above, and an author signed copy, once published, of the Love in America book, Tales from The Heart of America! At $500, you’ll receive early access, credit, art photo, Tales, the signed book, and we’ll interview and tell the story of a couple of your choice on our podcast or along an upcoming Love in America Journey. $1000 Grand Donors receive all that, plus a guided motorcycle tour of the Black Hills including Sturgis, Crazy Horse, Deadwood, Needles Highway, Mt. Rushmore, and a few spots that don’t make the tourism guides! The first $5000 donor will receive all the above, and use of our Crooked Little House in Deadwood along with our storage unit for your bikes or car during all nine days of next year’s 2020 Sturgis Rally!

Yea, check out those perks.

What We Want to Achieve

As part of this project, we’ve interviewed people from the Taos Pueblo to the naval yards of Virginia, inner city Detroit to the ranchlands of Montana - and the upcoming Journey is our most diverse and ambitious yet! We want the inspiration, hope and unity of these tales to reach America through the documentary web series  - with the footage we produce later being adapted for an unscripted television pilot and possible documentary film. While we’ve gotten this far with just the two of us, learning enough videography, photography, audio, podcasting, marketing and other skills to bring you what you see here, we need help to keep going and to produce the upcoming journey at a  professional level and give this important message its best chance to reach a wider audience. If that positive dialogue is something you care about, then we urge you to contribute to our campaign! Please tell your friends and your family about it; post about it and share it with your networks!

We can only be our most powerful as a community, as a country, as positive partner in the world, when we realize our shared humanity - and the best way for Americans, for humans, to do that is through story, with everyone's voice valued as a part of the conversation.

By contributing to this campaign, you are enabling the start of that new, constructive conversation on American identity and community at the point of what truly matters most in all our lives - our love!

Risks and Challenges

Every project comes with its own set of unique risks and challenges, and ours is funding, first and foremost. Without support, none of this will happen, as we’ve already gone all-in making previous Journeys happen. The work would also be vastly improved and allow us to focus on the storytelling and making new story contacts if we could get some help. And, we journey by motorcycle, so there’s cars and deer, of course. But we believe we have diminished risk through experience, and by having had four years and 35k+ miles to hone our message, vision, and abilities.

If you have any questions or comments, please contact us on info@loveinamerica.us. You'll find us delighted to engage.

Thank you ALL again for your continued support!

Without support, none of this will happen, as we’ve already gone all-in making previous Journeys happen. The work would also be vastly improved and allow us to focus on the storytelling and making new story contacts if we could get some help. And, we journey by motorcycle, so there’s cars and deer, of course. But we believe we have diminished risk through experience, and by having had four years and 35k+ miles to hone our message, vision, and abilities.If you have any questions or comments, please contact us on info@loveinamerica.us. You'll find us delighted to engage.Thank you ALL again for your continued support!

story:
• Shonathon M. Stacey is a writer and actor, co-creator of the series, going to Full Sail University for his full time digital cinematography degree becoming a director.
  • Lawrence Brian Schwartz, co-creator of the series, is a writer and graphic artist.

  • Bringing this series to life will be not only a blessing for those involved, but also a joy for millions of viewers to watch here and around the world. Together, our first foray into the film and television business is the creation of an all-new comedy series, "Life With Roomies."

  • This series will help us build our bridge to make our series to become a reality and for those looking to make their dreams a reality as well.
  • $2,000 is our goal to be reached.
  • Our Perks include:
  • $10 - BASIC ROOMIE: Special thank you card and shout out from cast
  • $25 - ROOMIE COUCH POTATO: Special thank you card and shout out from cast, T-Shirt
  • $50 - ROOMIE BRONZE: Special thank you card and shout out from cast, T-Shirt, hat and meet the cast
  • $100 - ROOMIE SILVER: Special thank you card and shout out from cast, T-Shirt, hat, meet the cast and a signed Blu-ray/DVD copy of the cast and/or Netflix code.
  • $250 - ROOMIE GOLD: Special thank you card and shout out from cast, T-Shirt, hat, signed Blu-ray/DVD copy of the cast and/or Netflix code, and become a member of the production cast or crew.

The Cast:

Karl Abcott...            SHONATHON M. STACEY
Merl Gadecki...        BRANDON JEAN-BAPTISTE
Pete Purgresc...        KELLY COLLETTE
Jeremiah “Jer” Jacoffe...    NOAH CLARK
Heather Anodes...        PAULA R. CRANDALL
Dougray “Lord” Land...    LAWRENCE BRIAN SCHWARTZ

Character breakdowns:

KARL ABCOTT - a young man in his late 20’s, brown-red hair, about 5’10.’’ He’s confident,
unassuming and very likeable; the unofficial leader of the “roomies” who has to make sure
to keep every other roomie’s heads out of the clouds, including his, and keep them fighting
to be inside.

MERL GADECKI - a young man, mid 30’s, about 6’. Even with a tumultuous
childhood, growing up and all, he’s not too optimistic about moving in with Karl, especially
since his newest challenge brings him in with three other roommates scrunched in and he‘s
up in arms about whether or not he’s made a good choice about it.

PETE PURGRESC - a young man, mid 20’s, mid-height, scruffy-looking, black hair and
Canadian. In good spirits much of the time, but feels just as Karl and the other do that
they’re cornered into the back wall and he’s only along for the ride, but he’s there to
pitch in.

JEREMIAH “JER” JACOFFE - a young man, early 20’s, brown brunette hair, mid-height,
almost heavy-set and feels he’s tagging along also, but he thinks this whole story’s over
before it even starts. None too bright at one time or another, he may as well be on some
occasions a foil for the roomies which may prove true to land all of them homeless.

DOUGRAY “LORD” LAND - late 30’s/early 40’s, but looks real young for his age, large and
tall, persistent and major authority figure at times, especially for a landlord like him. He
feels that the roomies are slackers trying to pass him off easily for a fool just to stay at
Somber Wind. But he believes to knows better and he’ll do just about anything to see
them out of his complex for good.

HEATHER ANODES - mid 30’s, red haired and slender-type. One of the assistants
to Dougray who takes no guff from anyone and is clearly loyal to the “Lord of the Land.”
But soon after, she might take a different perspective on how the roomies are handling
their situation and lend them a hand.

The Crew:

Directors: ADAM HECHT and SHONATHON M. STACEY
Producers: SHONATHON M. STACEY & LAWRENCE BRIAN SCHWARTZ
Creators: LAWRENCE BRIAN SCHWARTZ & SHONATHON M. STACEY 
Casting Director: SHONATHON M. STACEY

More cast and crew to be announced shortly.

Our Dates of filming start on August 24th, 25th and 31st and then September 1st, 7th and 8th.

DEADLINE: 

November to be completed and edited for Netflix.

This series has been eight years in the making to make it as reality and we created "Life With Roomies."  Bringing this series to life will be not only a blessing for those involved, but also a joy for millions of viewers to watch here and around the world.

Life has been a constant struggle to make our series come true, but we have stuck through the hardest times to make "Life with Roomies" our dream project a reality.

And we would love for you to help pitch in any way you can! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo tools that are also provided for you.

We can't wait for you to come with us on this fantastic comedy series!

- Shonathon M. Stacey and Lawrence Brian Schwartz

story:
OFFICIAL WEBSITE  -  IMDB  -  FACEBOOK -  INSTAGRAM  -  TWITTER  -  YOUTUBE 

   

  

  

ABOUT THE SERIES

Reckless Juliets, a cross between Heathers and The Virgin Suicides, is a web series focusing on four friends navigating their way through high school, and dealing with issues surrounding their home lives, while being young women of the Millennial generation.

The show's storytelling combines dark comedy with character driven drama featuring a talented young cast. Some of the themes that we touch on are mental heath, body positivity, suicide awareness, teen rebellion, LGBTQ representation, and most importantly, the complexity of women and their friendships with one another. Because as shocking as it may sound by what audiences see on film and television nowadays, YES, women are quite interesting to watch and all have stories waiting to be told. 

Episodes one through five are online for your viewing pleasure, but we need help to make the last half of the season a reality. That's where you, the fans, come in. If you haven't seen our episodes yet, don't worry, they're all listed below for your convenience. You can also learn more about our incredibly talented cast and crew, see behind the scenes photos from set, and find out about the perks that you receive when you donate!

All donations go towards helping us shoot episodes six through ten (our final episode), and will help pay for actors, crew members, catering, locations, insurance, wardrobe, production design, festival submission, marketing, and post-production costs.

Jon Schweigart (Cinematographer), Will Hawkes (Michael), Marisa Thilman (1st AD), Jared Zeizel (Script Supervisor), and Amirah As-Salaam (Production Assistant) behind the scenes of Episode 5.

    FULL EPISODES

     



    UPCOMING EPISODES that donations will fund.

    Episode 6 ("Last Night Was Crazy")--Shooting April 1st-April 3rd
    Carmody pulls a prank in a convenient store. We meet Shasta's ex-girlfriend, Fiona. The girls have a sleepover. / Cast: Britni Raine, Sadie Eve, Natasha Stricklin, Lelia Yvetta, Julian von Nagel, Sierra Pond, Samantha Hodges, Ben Bergstrom, & Adrian Rivero.

    Episode 7 ("The Afterlife's A Bitch, Just Like Me")--Pre-Production
    Sunday dinner at the Shaw's is crashed by Annie's ghost. / Cast: Britni Raine, Alison Kohlhardt, & Melody Bernhoft (2 un-cast roles)

    Episode 8 ("The Mannequin Thief")--Pre-Production
    Shasta learns that Phillip, the town's drug supplier and her boss, has stolen mannequins from a local department store, and has to handle one of his disgruntled "employees". / Cast: Natasha Stricklin (3 un-cast roles)

    Episode 9 ("Crush")--Pre-Production
    Chloe and the much older object of her affection butt heads. Hadley is having trouble adjusting to living back at home. Michael is cornered by "The PTA Nazi". / Cast: Sadie Eve, Mia Topalian, Gavin Magnus, Ben Bergstrom, & Will Hawkes (2 un-cast roles)

    Episode 10 ("Goddamn You're Punk Rock")--Pre-Production
    A viral video leaves Carmody's future in question, Chloe decides to be proactive, Wynn is faced with a difficult decision, and Shasta's acting strange. / Cast: Britni Raine, Lelia Yvetta, Sadie Eve, Natasha Stricklin, Sierra Pond, Julian von Nagel, Samantha Hodges, John Paul Sales, Braxton Baker, Will Hawkes (5-6 un-cast roles)

    MEET THE CAST

      BRITNI RAINE | "CARMODY SHAW"

    Born to Military parents, Britni Raine became a nomad at birth, moving from place to place across the country for most of her childhood, before finally settling in the Chicago suburbs. She began studying voice and acting in the city seriously and passionately, knowing at the age of nine that her end game was in front of a rolling camera.​

    It would only be a few short years before Britni would land her first professional role in David Huzieran’s short Ordinary World. After the director saw her heading to the extra’s holding and auditioned her right on the spot. Shortly after relocating to Los Angeles, she would play the distraught, reckless party girl in Marttie Go’s High School, I Hate You, and be given the opportunity to study with Erica Daniels of Steppenwolf Theatre, Adam Belcuore of The Goodman Theatre, and Bob Mason of The Chicago Shakespeare Theatre, requiring her to move back to The Windy City.​

    From then on, Britni would be the first to workshop the character of Zoe in broadway’s Airline Highway (nominated for four Tony awards in 2015), under the direction of Tony award winner Joe Mantello, would go on to win the recurring bad-influence, druggie Jenna on Lifetime’s Army Wives, and take on the comedic role of Kianna, seen most recently in Showtime’s Shameless.

    Now based in Los Angeles, Britni is also completing an online degree in psychology with the University of Arizona, and currently writing/starring in an untitled short film with fellow Chicagoan actress, Melanie Neilan. The film revolves around a seemingly odd and abusive relationship between two young women, and the microcosm-like ways in which young adults express love and sexuality through individual romantic relationships.

      LELIA YVETTA | "WYNN LARAMIE"

    I was born in Cologne, Germany, to a German father and American mother. Shortly after I was born I moved to Austria, then Holland and eventually back to Germany, Munich, where I lived until I finished high school. I had been a part of multiple plays throughout junior and middle school, but it was in high school that I really fell in with acting and the art of storytelling.

    I started doing whatever I could to act: I went to summer camps including SOCAPA and NYFA, I would work with the film students at my school, I helped the Theater Department in school, as well as acted in a few plays, and I directed, produced and acted in my own short film. It was around this time that my mother also began producing her own short films and I, seizing every opportunity I could, would help her on set being a Runner whenever possible.​

    The summer between my junior and senior year I was introduced to Anthony Meindl and Anthony Meindl’s Actor’s Workshop (AMAW) and I immediately fell in love with the work he does and helps create. After graduating from high school I moved to the US to pursue a career in Acting. I spent the first 4 months interning at and acting with the Community Theater in Truckee, as well as starring in my first feature film, 2hrs; a film I not only acted in, but was also a Runner on set and Locations Assistant for. In December 2015 I moved to L.A to finally study full time at AMAW. Film and acting have become a huge part of my life. I love the creative, limitless, exciting energy found on film sets, and the boundless potential every moment holds while acting and discovering a scene.

      SADIE EVE | "CHLOE BENNETT"

    COMING SOON

      NATASHA STRICKLIN | "SHASTA MORGAN"

    I grew up in Corona, CA and moved to Downey in 9th grade so I can be closer to LA to pursue my acting career. I was always pretty shy & stuck in my shell growing up until my mom decided to have me try an acting class for fun when I was twelve. My mom started acting/modeling in New York when she was sixteen and thought maybe it would be something I'd enjoy as well.​

    When I first started classes I was afraid to mess up or look stupid. But as classes went on I slowly came out of my shell & was no longer afraid to take chances. As I got older and started to understand more about myself, acting classes also became like therapy sessions. It forced me to let out emotions and feelings I never knew how to express and release.

      SIERRA POND | "FIONA GAYNOR"

    I was born in Northern Virginia and lived near the D.C. area until I was 7 years old.  My family then moved to Raleigh, North Carolina, where I spent 8 more years.  According to my mother, I came out of the womb a drama queen.  Singing and acting has always been my number one passion, and my parents knew it.  They sent me to singing lessons, dance classes, musical theatre productions—all of which I excelled in and loved. 

    When I got older I fell in love with rock music, starting with Evanescence and spreading to 80s hair bands and modern heavy metal.  To this day I continue to sing in the shower, around friends, on stage—everywhere.  Even the grocery store.

    When I was 15 I starting attending monthly acting classes in Nashville with Gray Studios.  They were stationed in LA, and it wasn’t long before they were encouraging me to become stationed there as well.  The summer of 2014 was the first time I went to California with my mom, and since then I have fallen in love with the exuberant energy of the professional acting world. 

    Being an energetic person myself, the eternal “life” of the city never ceases to amaze me.  I started taking classes with Gray Studios every week and eventually worked my way up to the David Gray Master Class.  I also work weekly with Amy Lyndon, a booking coach who has appealed to my analytical side.   Both classes have helped me grow tremendously, and aided in my discovery of what kind of actor I am.

    Aside from acting, I like to play video games, hang with my friends, learn stuff at my college, and discover new things.  I’m always down for a hike or trip to Six Flags.  I think it’s important to be well-rounded, as it can greatly benefit not only my acting career, but also my personal life!

      JOHN PAUL SALES | "SCOTTY RICHTER"

    John Paul Sales is a small town boy at heart who made a splash in Texas by winning a Statewide Acting Competition as a Sophomore in High School, an experience documented in the film “BURY THE SHOW.” Just a few days after he graduated High School, he packed up his car and drove to Los Angeles to pursue his dreams.​

    His first job was the lead in a short film with director Casey Zimmerman who said “John Paul takes time to find the authenticity in the scene and the core of his character. I had complete trust in him to bring the emotion in some very intense scenes.”​

    Since then, John Paul has gone on to book several commercials, including a project very special to him: the PSA “UNACCEPTABLE ACCEPTANCE” which brings attention to the issue of date rape on college campuses. He can be seen in several episodes of “Blood Relatives” on ID and as one of the leads in the upcoming feature film “AMERICAN EXORCISM” directed by Tripp Weathers.​

      JULIAN VON NAGEL | "FISHER STURACK"

    Julian von Nagel was born and raised in the heart of San Francisco. He discovered his love for acting during high school when he was cast as Moritz Stiefel in the musical Spring Awakening. He went on to study theater at DePaul University in Chicago, but the desire to work in film & television ultimately drew him to Los Angeles. He moved to Hollywood mid 2015 and has since been working as an actor.

      SAMANTHA HODGES | "MARGOT STEWART"

    Samantha Hodges was born on November 9 in Monterey, California. When Samantha was 3 years old, she and her family moved to the southeast. She began performing in local plays when she was 8 years old and attended acting classes in Dallas, Texas and New Orleans, Louisiana. Samantha later moved to Los Angeles, California to pursue her dream of acting.

      BRAXTON BAKER | "RYAN FORD"

    Colorado-born, Braxton spent most of his childhood in Duluth, Minnesota with his parents, sister, and house full of dogs and cats. He credits his love of theatrics to classics like “Singin’ In The Rain” and of course his family who exposed him to these things at such a young age. At around 8, he began acting at the Duluth Playhouse and starred in it’s youth productions of Into the Woods, Les Miserables and Guys and Dolls. ​

    Soon enough, Braxton’s ambitions brought him onto the Minneapolis theater scene most memorably as Bartholomew in The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins on the Children’s Theater Company (CTC) mainstage. At the CTC, he also starred in youth productions of Rent, Hair, and Bare as part of it’s Theater Arts Training program. ​

    Braxton relocated to Los Angeles in November 2015 and, apart from a bunch of USC student films, booked a lead role in Larry Thomas and David Castro’s independent film DADS! and can be seen in an Air Hogs national commercial. He loves acting and hopes to continue it in any and all ways possible. ​

      WILL HAWKES | "MICHAEL LARAMIE"

    An early, uninhibited, creative instinct, born of his Redwood-canopied, Northern California upbringing, and cultivated through experiences in varying jobs – carpenter, candy-maker, private investigator – and adventures across six continents, continues to serve Will as an actor today. 

    He has recently been on New Girl, Grey’s Anatomy and Grimm and the feature film, Jake Squared, starring Jane Seymour and Jennifer Jason Leigh. He has worked with esteemed directors Bennet Miller, John Hillcoat and Jonathan Frakes. Will is set to begin filming the indy-thriller Devil’s Hollow this Summer in Lexington, Kentucky.

    MEET THE DIRECTORS

    Actor/Director, Upasana Beharee, is known for pushing the limits with her filmmaking. Best described as an actor’s director, she uses her acting abilities to draw out entertaining and relatable performances. Her work is darkly comedic with social commentary and a sharp edge. / Upasana will be directing our third minisode (“Hurricane Hadley”) and Episode 6 (“Last Night Was Crazy”)  

    Risks & Challenges

    No matter what the production, there are always challenges to overcome. Donations will help us rise above those challenges and create something really special. And it will all be because of YOU.

    Ways To Help Us

    If you can't contribute $$, don't fret. Sharing the link to our Indigogo page on your Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram is also an extremely helpful way to spread the word! Any questions about the project or the campaign can be sent to recklessjuliettv@gmail.com
