I started doing whatever I could to act: I went to summer camps including SOCAPA and NYFA, I would work with the film students at my school, I helped the Theater Department in school, as well as acted in a few plays, and I directed, produced and acted in my own short film. It was around this time that my mother also began producing her own short films and I, seizing every opportunity I could, would help her on set being a Runner whenever possible.​
The summer between my junior and senior year I was introduced to Anthony Meindl and Anthony Meindl’s Actor’s Workshop (AMAW) and I immediately fell in love with the work he does and helps create. After graduating from high school I moved to the US to pursue a career in Acting. I spent the first 4 months interning at and acting with the Community Theater in Truckee, as well as starring in my first feature film, 2hrs; a film I not only acted in, but was also a Runner on set and Locations Assistant for. In December 2015 I moved to L.A to finally study full time at AMAW. Film and acting have become a huge part of my life. I love the creative, limitless, exciting energy found on film sets, and the boundless potential every moment holds while acting and discovering a scene.
  SADIE EVE | "CHLOE BENNETT"

COMING SOON

  NATASHA STRICKLIN | "SHASTA MORGAN"

I grew up in Corona, CA and moved to Downey in 9th grade so I can be closer to LA to pursue my acting career. I was always pretty shy & stuck in my shell growing up until my mom decided to have me try an acting class for fun when I was twelve. My mom started acting/modeling in New York when she was sixteen and thought maybe it would be something I'd enjoy as well.​
When I first started classes I was afraid to mess up or look stupid. But as classes went on I slowly came out of my shell & was no longer afraid to take chances. As I got older and started to understand more about myself, acting classes also became like therapy sessions. It forced me to let out emotions and feelings I never knew how to express and release.
  SIERRA POND | "FIONA GAYNOR"

I was born in Northern Virginia and lived near the D.C. area until I was 7 years old.  My family then moved to Raleigh, North Carolina, where I spent 8 more years.  According to my mother, I came out of the womb a drama queen.  Singing and acting has always been my number one passion, and my parents knew it.  They sent me to singing lessons, dance classes, musical theatre productions—all of which I excelled in and loved. 
When I got older I fell in love with rock music, starting with Evanescence and spreading to 80s hair bands and modern heavy metal.  To this day I continue to sing in the shower, around friends, on stage—everywhere.  Even the grocery store.
When I was 15 I starting attending monthly acting classes in Nashville with Gray Studios.  They were stationed in LA, and it wasn’t long before they were encouraging me to become stationed there as well.  The summer of 2014 was the first time I went to California with my mom, and since then I have fallen in love with the exuberant energy of the professional acting world. 
Being an energetic person myself, the eternal “life” of the city never ceases to amaze me.  I started taking classes with Gray Studios every week and eventually worked my way up to the David Gray Master Class.  I also work weekly with Amy Lyndon, a booking coach who has appealed to my analytical side.   Both classes have helped me grow tremendously, and aided in my discovery of what kind of actor I am.
Aside from acting, I like to play video games, hang with my friends, learn stuff at my college, and discover new things.  I’m always down for a hike or trip to Six Flags.  I think it’s important to be well-rounded, as it can greatly benefit not only my acting career, but also my personal life!
  JOHN PAUL SALES | "SCOTTY RICHTER"

John Paul Sales is a small town boy at heart who made a splash in Texas by winning a Statewide Acting Competition as a Sophomore in High School, an experience documented in the film “BURY THE SHOW.” Just a few days after he graduated High School, he packed up his car and drove to Los Angeles to pursue his dreams.​
His first job was the lead in a short film with director Casey Zimmerman who said “John Paul takes time to find the authenticity in the scene and the core of his character. I had complete trust in him to bring the emotion in some very intense scenes.”​
Since then, John Paul has gone on to book several commercials, including a project very special to him: the PSA “UNACCEPTABLE ACCEPTANCE” which brings attention to the issue of date rape on college campuses. He can be seen in several episodes of “Blood Relatives” on ID and as one of the leads in the upcoming feature film “AMERICAN EXORCISM” directed by Tripp Weathers.​
  JULIAN VON NAGEL | "FISHER STURACK"

Julian von Nagel was born and raised in the heart of San Francisco. He discovered his love for acting during high school when he was cast as Moritz Stiefel in the musical Spring Awakening. He went on to study theater at DePaul University in Chicago, but the desire to work in film & television ultimately drew him to Los Angeles. He moved to Hollywood mid 2015 and has since been working as an actor.
  SAMANTHA HODGES | "MARGOT STEWART"

Samantha Hodges was born on November 9 in Monterey, California. When Samantha was 3 years old, she and her family moved to the southeast. She began performing in local plays when she was 8 years old and attended acting classes in Dallas, Texas and New Orleans, Louisiana. Samantha later moved to Los Angeles, California to pursue her dream of acting.
  BRAXTON BAKER | "RYAN FORD"

Colorado-born, Braxton spent most of his childhood in Duluth, Minnesota with his parents, sister, and house full of dogs and cats. He credits his love of theatrics to classics like “Singin’ In The Rain” and of course his family who exposed him to these things at such a young age. At around 8, he began acting at the Duluth Playhouse and starred in it’s youth productions of Into the Woods, Les Miserables and Guys and Dolls. ​
Soon enough, Braxton’s ambitions brought him onto the Minneapolis theater scene most memorably as Bartholomew in The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins on the Children’s Theater Company (CTC) mainstage. At the CTC, he also starred in youth productions of Rent, Hair, and Bare as part of it’s Theater Arts Training program. ​
Braxton relocated to Los Angeles in November 2015 and, apart from a bunch of USC student films, booked a lead role in Larry Thomas and David Castro’s independent film DADS! and can be seen in an Air Hogs national commercial. He loves acting and hopes to continue it in any and all ways possible. ​
  WILL HAWKES | "MICHAEL LARAMIE"

An early, uninhibited, creative instinct, born of his Redwood-canopied, Northern California upbringing, and cultivated through experiences in varying jobs – carpenter, candy-maker, private investigator – and adventures across six continents, continues to serve Will as an actor today. 
He has recently been on New Girl, Grey’s Anatomy and Grimm and the feature film, Jake Squared, starring Jane Seymour and Jennifer Jason Leigh. He has worked with esteemed directors Bennet Miller, John Hillcoat and Jonathan Frakes. Will is set to begin filming the indy-thriller Devil’s Hollow this Summer in Lexington, Kentucky.
MEET THE DIRECTORS

Actor/Director, Upasana Beharee, is known for pushing the limits with her filmmaking. Best described as an actor’s director, she uses her acting abilities to draw out entertaining and relatable performances. Her work is darkly comedic with social commentary and a sharp edge. / Upasana will be directing our third minisode (“Hurricane Hadley”) and Episode 6 (“Last Night Was Crazy”)  


Risks & Challenges
No matter what the production, there are always challenges to overcome. Donations will help us rise above those challenges and create something really special. And it will all be because of YOU.


Ways To Help Us
If you can't contribute $$, don't fret. Sharing the link to our Indigogo page on your Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram is also an extremely helpful way to spread the word! Any questions about the project or the campaign can be sent to recklessjuliettv@gmail.com

story:
THE SHOW

Every single person has one thing in common: we’re all gonna die.

But when? How? Will it be horrific? Will it be funny? Most importantly, will it be entertaining?

"20 Seconds to Live" is the anthology web-series that dares to ask and answer those questions. Every episode features a different storyline and cast of characters. At some point, a 20-second timer appears on screen and begins counting down. When it gets to zero, someone dies! Who gets it and how is most of the fun. 

We shot and released our first eight episodes, completely financing them out of our own pockets and pulling whatever favors we could. Filmmaker Adam Green (the "Hatchet" movies) released our show on his website Ariescope.com free and uncensored for anyone to enjoy. Other free places to see our show include Facebook and Seeka.tv. We've also screened at nearly 20 film and web festivals all over the world and have won a few awards including:

Best Web Series – Nashville International Film Festival

Best Sci-Fi/Fantasy/Horror – Berlin Web Fest

Special Festival Award – Raindance Film Festival (London)

Best Horror – Hollyweb Festival

WHAT WE NEED 

Our first season was made for almost no money. Whatever we had paid for food, fake blood, and an evil doll or two. Locations were mostly donated and just about everyone worked for free. Our friends were most gracious in providing resources to us, but it’s time to start paying people, even if it’s terribly. 

Our producer Cat has crunched the numbers, and it's going to take $10,000 to make a 3-episode season. That seems like a lot, but that’s probably the snack budget for one day on a Transformers movie. If we raise less than our goal, we’ll put all of that money into one or two great episodes. If we raise more than our goal, we’ll make more episodes.

This isn't about anyone getting rich, this is about making cool stuff for fans who love their horror with a good dose of humor. If that's not you, then you're on the wrong Indiegogo page and you should hit the back button on your computer. Unless you just like helping strangers, then by all means, stick around!

THE TEAM

BEN ROCK (Director, co-creator) makes people very uncomfortable until they are eventually okay with it. As the production designer for “The Blair Witch Project," Ben designed the iconic stickman and also wrote and/or directed multiple Blair Witch spin-offs. Since then he's directed cutting-edge viral content for "Hellyboy" and "True Blood,"  as well as the award-winning Warner Brothers sci-fi feature film “Alien Raiders." Ben and his wife Alicia have two dogs that can swallow a man whole, so just think twice before breaking into his house.

BOB DEROSA (Writer, co-creator) believes that The Little Engine could cuz of sheer f-ing force of will. The Florida-born screenwriter has written for the big screen (“Killers”, “The Air I Breathe”) and the small (“White Collar”). When he’s not writing, Bob studies Kenpo karate and spends time with his wife Jen and their three kids, who look suspiciously like cats.

CAT PASCIAK (Producer) is tougher than you. She survived an actual dust storm while shooting the X-Box documentary “Atari: Game Over” and as a producer on many reality television shows she survived…all of it. In high school, she was voted “Most Likely To Personally Procure A Pig’s Heart For A Video Shoot” and wouldn’t you know it, she did just that for “20 Seconds To Live”. Despite her tough exterior, she still considers herself a hopeless romantic at heart (her heart, not the pig’s.)

THE FINALE

Thank you for reading this far! Next week's winning lottery numbers are...just kidding, we have no idea. But you're still here, which means maybe you're interested in helping us make more of our show. Glance over there to the right and check out our perks, we have some fun stuff to share such as your own personalized death certificate with a ridiculous cause of death just for you:

And if money's tight, we understand. Please consider sharing our campaign with your friends and/or enemies. We're not picky.

In closing, let's be honest...death sucks. One of the reasons we make our show is so we can laugh in death's stupid face, if only for a little while. We invite you to join us!

story:
$28,000 Goal -- UNLOCKED!

$34,000 Stretch Goal -- UNLOCKED!

 

STRETCH GOAL #2 -- $40,000

At $40,000, this stretch goal will be unlocked:

Video of Aron Eisenberg portraying Raejin Tektonopolis in one of his ancillary content scenes will be released. 

 

STRETCH GOAL #1 -- $34,000

At $34,000, these two stretch goal rewards will be unlocked:

1. Video of Richard Hatch portraying Admiral DiCarrek in one of his ancillary content scenes will be released. 

2. ALL reward levels that include at least one cast photo will get one ADDITIONAL AUTOGRAPHED CAST PHOTO included with their reward package.

(This includes the $45, $55, and $65 levels, and any level that mentions one or more cast photos in the reward package.)  

 

What is Blade of Honor?

Blade of Honor is an epic and bold science fiction series which brings together the talent and experience from successful productions such as Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Battlestar Galactica, Heroes, Star Trek: Voyager, Renegades, Cowboys & Engines, 5th Passenger, Avengers S.T.A.T.I.O.N., Nobility, Man at Arms, Space Command, and many more.

 

The Blade of Honor Mission

Now that principal photography is complete, our number one goal is to complete post production for this episode with the most powerful imagery, stunning visual effects, and incredible music and sound possible so that the show is picked up by a network and we can devote ourselves - full time - to making this series and presenting it to the world. 

When that happens, you will have the joy and satisfaction of knowing YOU are responsible for bringing this series to life, you delivered it to the public, you made it happen.

Please take a look at our trailer:

 

 

The All-Star Cast

We have an incredible cast of sci-fi legends and up-and-coming stars.

 

 

The Actors of Blade of Honor

  • Richard Hatch (Battlestar Galactica 1979, BSG 2004, Days of Our Lives)
  • Tim Russ (Star Trek: Voyager, Renegades, 5th Passenger)
  • James Kyson (Heroes, Sleepy Hollow, Nobility)
  • Aron Eisenberg (Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Renegades)
  • Julia Morizawa (Star Trek: Hidden Frontier, Star Trek: Odyssey)
  • Brandon Stacey (Star Trek: New Voyages, The Big Short)
  • Rivkah Raven Wood (Star Trek: New Voyages, Star Trek: Hidden Frontier)
  • Jasmine Waltz (Demon, Femme Fatales, Celebrity Big Brother)
  • Jodie Bentley (All My Children, One Life to Live, As the World Turns)
  • Ryan T. Husk (Star Trek Into Darkness, 5th Passenger, Star Trek: Horizon)
  • Madison Russ (Renegades, Star Trek: Renegades)
  • Jeff Bond (Star Trek: New Voyages, The Alien Legacy)
  • and more sci-fi actors in future episodes, like Cirroc Lofton and Jennifer Nash!

We've also got a host of up-and-coming sci-fi actors featured in this first episode, such as John Caballero (Star Trek: Horizon, Renegades), Katherine Roberts (The Assassin's Apprentice, 5th Passenger), Malissa Longo (Renegades, Cozmo's), DW McCann (Cozmo's, Renegades), Reka Rene (5th Passenger, The Assassin's Apprentice), Pyar Anderson (Space Command, Cozmo's), Venezia Zavala (When the Fever Breaks, 5th Passenger), and many more. 

Richard Hatch

We didn't know it at the time, but Blade of Honor was to be our dear friend Richard Hatch's final production. We feel so fortunate that, although he will not be with us for the duration of the series, he did see us off with a powerful performance for our pilot episode. 


Please take a look at our tribute to our wonderful friend, Richard Hatch:

 
 

Post-Production

A few months ago we shot Blade of Honor, episode one. We can't tell you how happy we are with the performances, look, feel, and all around quality of the product.

Now, we've done a lot of editing and sound engineering, but we need a bit more funding to complete post-production - stunning visual effects, brilliant color correction, etc.. This final funding effort will push Blade of Honor into a different stratosphere, and really allow us to make the final product huge, jaw-dropping, and something we can all be proud of. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Post production can make or break a production. And we plan on it MAKING us! Besides the perks and rewards you'll get in return, here's where your donations are going:

  • Space Battles, starships, space-scapes, etc..
  • Special effects, airbending, landscapes, etc..
  • Green screen composition
  • Music and scoring
  • Sound effects and foley
  • Editing
  • Color Correction

Our VFX team, alone, is an all-star crew:

  • Tobias Richter (Star Trek: Renegades, Star Wars: Rogue Squadron, Nobility)
  • Pony Horton (Star Trek: New Voyages, Eternity, Masque of the Red Death)
  • Tommy Kraft (Star Trek: Horizon, Runaway, Star Trek: Renegades)

 

 

The Impact of Blade of Honor

Blade of Honor is intended to be a series that pushes the boundaries of sci-fi and humanity, examines the secrets and dogma of society, and blows away its viewers with rich story arcs, an unending rich world, and conflicted, memorable characters.  We intend to do this with the best sci-fi cast and crew.

We also intend to take Richard Hatch's final performance and make it COUNT. We want his legacy to continue on, and we intend to make his friends, family, and fans proud. Blade of Honor was his legacy to all the fans he loved so dearly, and now it's up to us to run with it.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is donation-based, and you can be a huge help in other ways:

  • Tell your friends! Email, text, word of mouth, etc.. Send them over to this page!
  • Use the share tools on this page to share it anywhere you want.
  • Or just post this on your favorite social media sites - Facebook, Twitter, etc..
  • Connect us with your friends you think would be interested in helping.
  • Contact us for publicity/interviews! We're always available and our actors will do their best to be the same.

 

Social Media

Stay connected with us!

Facebook Official Page: https://www.facebook.com/bladeofhonorseries/

Facebook Fan Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/bladesofhonor/

Twitter Official Page: https://twitter.com/BoHseries

Official Website: http://bladeofhonor.tv/

 

PERKS

Here are some examples of the perks available in this campaign.

 

The Richard Hatch Commemorative Challenge Coin (front and back)

 

 

The Richard Hatch Autographed 8x10 Cast Photo

 

 

Autographed Cast Photo Examples: James Kyson, Tim Russ, and Aron Eisenberg:

 

The Bridge Officers Signed Cast Photos Collection

 

 

Richard Hatch's Screen-Used Guns

 

 

James Kyson's Screen-Used Guns

 

 

Neuro-Connect/Neuro-Sleep Headpiece

 

 

Guns/Props Used on Blade of Honor

 

 

Patch #1

 

Thank You!

From producers Mark Edward Lewis, Steven Stone, Ryan T. Husk, Clay Turnage, and EVERYONE in the Blade of Honor family, we thank you from the bottom of our hearts, and want to assure you we will make this the absolute best product it can be - for you, because of you.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hannah Rad and I'm inviting you to be a part of "Sorry to Keep You Waiting", a short series I'm developing as I take a solo road trip through California. 7 locations; 7 stories and experiences vital to my mental health journey.

Contributors (that's you!) fund ideas (like this one) that they can be passionate about and to people (that's me!) they trust. Here's some more info:

  • I'm Hannah Rad, a Los Angeles-based TV / radio host, DJ and content creator with on-air and production credits spanning 10+ years.
  • Where have you seen me / my work? Revolt TV, MTV, E!, ESPN, X Games, Red Bull TV, Twitch, LiveXLive, YouTube, SiriusXM, etc...
  • After moving to LA 2+ years ago, everything kinda came to a crashing halt, resulting in some really dark days, weeks, months... and a spiral of active anxiety that prohibited me from actually producing anything I deemed valuable. Sure I'd pop up on a project or show every now and again and strategically post social content looking like I was "killing it". In reality, those moments attributed to 5% of my time. The rest? I was lost. 
  • So what will you, as contributors, help me achieve? "Sorry to Keep You Waiting" is a self-love letter; a short series that helps me demolish the brick walls in my path, by sharing an authentically vulnerable story / experience on a solo adventure throughout the state of California, etc... with a dual aim: (1) produce something I'm proud of and (2) rediscover myself by sharing more. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Funding will be attributed to production and promo of this project... of which I'm producing, shooting, editing and launching this on my own.
  • Gas: there's lots of driving. Let's fill up that tank!
  • Food: this will operate as a proper production with expenses. We're gonna order me some meals on the official budget.
  • Accommodation: some days of shooting will require overnight stay
  • Shooting / Editing: Well, that's time... and time is money. Pocket change is nice.
  • Equipment: I'm shooting with a Canon 5D Mark IV and an iPhone. But to take this to the next level, I'll use funds to purchase a second camera and accessories.
  • Promo / Social: development of all social channels as well as paid promo to help boost the project.

 

  • Perks: basic rule in life... gotta give to receive. You'll get something fun :)

 

  • Now if I don't reach the funding goal? No worries. All donations will still be rewarded at the level given and the project will still move forward as planned. 

 

Where I'm Going / How Funds Will Be Allocated

Here's an idea of where your generous contribution will be dispersed. Prices are average for August 2020 and subject to change slightly.

  • Episode 1: Joshua Tree - $45 (gas) + $150 (AirBNB) + $100 (meals / water) = $295
  • Episode 2: Death Valley - $35 (gas) + $125 (AirBNB) + $100 (meals / water) = $260
  • Episode 3: Mammoth Lakes / Yosemite  - $25 (gas) + $150 (AirBNB) + $100 (meals / water) = $275
  • Episode 4: Mono Lake / Yosemite- $25 (gas) + $150 (AirBNB) + $100 (meals / water) = $275
  • Episode 5: Lake Tahoe - $25 (gas) + $250 (AirBNB) + $100 (meals / water) = $375
  • Episode 6: San Francisco - $40 (gas) + $350 (AirBNB x 2) + $100 (meals / water) = $490
  • Episode 7: Big Sur - $30 (gas) + $200 (AirBNB) + $100 (meals / water) = $330
  • estimated total $2300 + incidentals ($500) = $2800

 

  • Therapy: video call access to a licensed therapist throughout this trip (as well as pre / post production) -  $129 / 25 minute session
  • estimated total for 10 sessions = $1290

 

  • Gear: as mentioned above, I will purchase one GoPro HERO8 Black Bundle ($399). Additionally, there are extra camera batteries ($14 x 3) and a lavalier mic for the iPhone ($50)
  • estimated total for gear = $500

 

  • Editing: industry rule of thumb is $100 / minute. Each episode will roughly be 6-7 minutes so at max, it's $700 an episode. (note: either myself or an outside editor will be hired to complete.)
  • estimated total for 7 fully edited episodes: $4900

 

The Impact:

  • This project is valuable to you, me and to the world. There's a resonating stigma around mental health and the admittance of "going through it" but if not now, then when? 
  • I've been blessed to have a lucrative career for the most part, and the tools I've learned to help me create this project will help me better relate to the world and to others who experience similar issues.

 

  • The state of the world is unforgiving, so why crowdfund during these uncertain times? Creative people around the world have been hit hard by the pandemic, and by launching a project with your help, I'll be able to give back as well.
  • The current tally of funds allocated sits with $500 reserve. I will donate that and any additional funds leftover to the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI), whom understand and align with the idea that the LGBTQI+ community has many unique assets and gifts, while also facing many unique challenges.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Understandably and compassionately, I know we are in uncertain times... and some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • Let's blast this out on social: Instagram Twitter
  • Subscribe on YouTube. It literally costs you nothing.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools if you're feeling platform-specific

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Cassidy and I am an actor who graduated college and moved to the west coast to follow my dreams. A walking cliche- I know. But what I didn’t know was how HARD it was going to be to move to a new city, on my own, for the first time, and be an adult. I didn’t know how to bargain for an apartment, or what to look for in a new mattress, or how to meet neighbors who aren’t living in a college dorm, or how to pay taxes (I still don’t know that one), or how to balance having a 40-hour a week job and a social life and a creative life and and and…. you get my point.

 

BUT something I noticed along the way was that every time I told one of my “Adulting” stories they were extremely relatable. So many people I know had been through what I was going through and knew the feeling all too well. Which got me thinking about this term “Adulting.” It’s something we all attempt to do- to be real people, get real jobs, have a real life, and do what we were meant to do. But sometimes this “Adulting” thing is just so damn hard. Sometimes you’re having a great day, blasting music in your car, avoiding traffic, and getting to work EARLY. And sometimes you arrive late to work with a giant coffee stain on your shirt because you were trying to do two things at once.


It happens to all of us. And that's the motivation/inspiration behind this web series. And that's what I want to share with you all. 

What We Need

Season 1 of Adulting consists of 5 episodes. I was able to film the first episode with a lovely crew of people who were willing to work for copy/credit/meals, and everything else came out of my pocket. The filming of the first episode went really smoothly,  but unfortunately it is not something that the group of us can financially continue to do for free/with funding from my bank account. So that’s why we’re coming here.

 

We have 4 more episodes to film, each episode taking 2-3 days to film it. I already have a crew ready to go, I just need the money to make it all happen.

 

The money we are raising goes strictly to paying the crew, paying for equipment, paying for locations, and paying for meals on set. I also budgeted some money aside for distribution, as I plan to submit the web series to as many festivals as I can to get as many eyes on the project as possible. 

The Impact

This is something we can all relate to, and I think now more than ever our world (and our country) could use a little more humor, and a little more reminders about how similar we all are to one another. By contributing to this project, you will be helping us continue to do what we love- tell stories.  Stories can change people, stories can bond people together, stories can open people's minds, and it is so important that we tell them, and keep telling them. We just need your help. 

Risks & Challenges

The only challenges we've had so far are financially. I have been able to book locations and gather a cast/crew without too much difficulty. So I don't anticipate facing any challenges that we can't overcome. We are a resourceful and hardworking group of people who are determined to make this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we get it. Times are tough- that's why we made this campaign in the first place. BUT if you could share this campaign on your social media, tell a friend about it, follow us on social media (@adultingwebseries) that would all help us get the word out about our project and get as many contributions/supporters as possible! Without you, we can't make this happen.

Thank you so much for reading this and for your interest and support. It means so much to each and every one of us!!

story:
What Your Donation Will Do

Fund our applications for the following festivals:

  • New Jersey Web Fest
  • Miami Web Series Festival
  • New York City Web Fest
  • HollyWeb Festival
  • Baltimore New Media Web Festival
  • The Independent Television Festival

Why Festivals?

The creators of Hard Feelings have plans to meet with agents and networks in hopes of adapting the web series for television, but before then we need our following to grow. Exposure on a nation level will help us do that, and so will any awards/nominations we receive from these festivals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Watch Hard Feelings if you haven't already!
  • Give us a shout out on your social media if you feel so inclined.
  • Tell your friends about us!
  • Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, etc.

story:
Natural Hair Matters...

Hi, I'm Natasha Gaspard, Brooklyn native, daughter of proud Haitian parents, Emmy Award-winning television producer, Naturalista and Founder/CEO of Mane Moves Media, Inc.  I've been producing content for television, the web and live events for over 10 years and I'm so excited to share this project with you!

My passion is creating a space where Black beauty matters and that is why I created Mane Moves Media.  MMM is a natural hair and beauty-focused video network featuring lifestyle content for women of color!  This July 21st our programming will include a live online broadcast of CURLFEST, the largest natural hair and beauty festival in NYC!  Last year, we were the first media company to offer live coverage of CURLFEST and over 30K people from all over the world tuned in to see Black beauty celebrated!  This year, we are looking to cover this amazing festival again and we will need your help in making that happen!  

What is CURLFEST?

CURLFEST is the ultimate celebration of natural beauty created by a group of dynamic women who call themselves the Curly Girl Collective!  The event is an opportunity for women of color to connect, see live demos, learn about hair products, engage in chats, shop, play games, dance and to see their beauty reflected. 

What is CURLFEST Live 2018?

The live 2 hour show that will produced by Mane Moves Media and streamed on Youtube from CURLFEST.  Viewers will be able to log on to our website and watch our live show featuring everything the festival has to offer along with live interviews, product demos and aerial footage of the Prospect Park.  Watch what we did last year. 

 

We're Bringing It For CURLFEST Live 2018! 

  • Our live coverage will begin with an all-access backstage pass to the VIP suite where we will interview, on the purple carpet, all of the major beauty bloggers and influencers that will be in attendance!
  • The Curl Patrol with MsHairandHumor is back!  We're bringing you all of the hottest hairstyles and street style fashion on the scene with the attendees who came to slay! She will also be giving away some goodies to those who can answer her tough trivia questions.
  • CurlyCam is a new feature we're adding to the show! This is where attendees of the festival will capture 360 views of their hairstyles for viewers to vote on!
  • Hair Styling Contest- during the live show we are featuring 3 of the hottest natural hair stylists to compete for 'Best Curlfest Hairstyle'!  Viewers will get to see the hairstyling in progress during the live show and vote for their favorite style at the end of the show!  Celebrity 
  • Live Segments- so much excitement happens on our live set!  Our amazing hosts will be interviewing all of the movers and shakers of the natural hair industry, celebrities and the product sponsors you all know and love!   
  • Live Drone footage- CURLFEST boasted over 25K attendees last year...this is definitely a festival that will not disappoint and we will be securing all angles for you to see all that's going down!

*CURLFEST Live 2018 show breakdown

What We Need

The $5,000 I'm raising will be used toward the production costs for the broadcast including:

  • Production equipment- cameras, tripods, lenses, microphones, mixers, and wireless transmitters, etc.  
  • Crew- It takes an entire crew to put on a live show from directors, to camera persons to production assistants.  We will pay and feed the crew
  • Hosts- our talented hosts will be on deck to keep the party going!

What You Get...

We want to truly thank you for supporting our efforts in bringing CURLFEST to the world!  By donating to our campaign we have a few items you can take advantage of:

$5- Naturalista Shout Out: We will sing your praises on social media by shouting you out for supporting our cause via @manemoves Instagram and IG

$10 - A Friend of the Show: you will receive a customized virtual social media sticker including your picture thanking you for being a part of our tribe!

$25- CURLfriends - Our lovely hosts will give you a shout out on the live show to thank you for the support!

$35-Slay Cards- With sayings like "Your Hair is Everything" and "Your a Natural Born Beauty" our  signature deck of Slay Cards will surely put a smile on the faces of any Naturalista! 

$50 - T-Shirt- Rock your Mane Moves t-shirt loud and proud!

$100 - "Natural Hair Story" : We will feature you as a Naturalista to Know and share your hair story on our Instagram page  

$250 - Full service Natural Hair Reboot with Shea Moisture Beauty Ambassador Diane C. Bailey! 5 Lucky ladies will receive the star treatment from a master stylist including shampoo, steam treatment cut and style  (no extensions)

$250 - Loc Star Service by Jennifer Lord of Natural Hollywood- 2 lucky ladies with locs will receive the star treatment from premium hair artist & natural hair care specialist Jennifer Lord.  Service includes shampoo, condition, oil treatment, re-twist and style!

$500 - Be a guest on the show- We will Skype you in from where ever you are in the world to interact with our influencer hosts.  Just make sure you have a Skype account and a solid internet connection!  

$750 - Sponsored Messages: We will run your commercial during a break in the live show!  Reach the thousands of women around the world that will be tuning in live to see natural hair and beauty celebrated

$1000- Big Boss- This level is for our bosses who are making big moves and want everyone to know about it!  If you will be in NYC for CURLFEST you will have a 2 min segment on the live show to talk about your product. If you do not live in NYC and will not be attending the festival, we will Skype you in on the day of the show!  Share your business with the world!

 

The Impact

I think back to when I was a little girl and how there were hardly any images of women with natural hair on TV, in magazines or in any commercials.  Fast forward to 2018 and there are a handful of Black actresses who wear their natural hair on TV.  Media images are powerful...that is why corporations pay the big bucks on advertising...because it works!  I want to do my part and ensure that little black and brown girls worldwide get to experience what it's like to be proud of your beauty, your heritage and your people.  Your contribution to this project will allow just that.  Viewers will get to experience the magic that is CURLFEST does that and so much more.

  

Risks & Challenges

I've done the hard work to ensure that this live online broadcast goes on without a glitch but as you can imagine, live TV is unpredictable.  I am hiring television professionals who have experience in producing live television which decreases the risk of anything going wrong.  We will test the equipment the night before, set up early to test again to ensure that we are able to deliver a quality broadcast.  CURLFEST will be held outdoors at Prospect Park.  If it rains and the date is cancelled we will produce the live show on the proposed rain date given by the organizers of the festival.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I know in your heart of hearts that you want to support our cause however, if you are unable to give at this time please share this project with your friends, family or anyone you think who would like to support our cause.  CURLFEST is going to be the best event ever and we are eager and honored to bring this much #blackgirlmagic to the world!  

Make sure to use Indiegogo’s Sharing Tools and help us reach as many people as you can! 

 

Thank you and see you on CURLFEST Live 2018!

$50 - T-Shirt- Rock your Mane Moves t-shirt loud and proud!
$100 - "Natural Hair Story" : We will feature you as a Naturalista to Know and share your hair story on our Instagram page  
$250 - Full service Natural Hair Reboot with Shea Moisture Beauty Ambassador Diane C. Bailey! 5 Lucky ladies will receive the star treatment from a master stylist including shampoo, steam treatment cut and style  (no extensions)
$250 - Loc Star Service by Jennifer Lord of Natural Hollywood- 2 lucky ladies with locs will receive the star treatment from premium hair artist & natural hair care specialist Jennifer Lord.  Service includes shampoo, condition, oil treatment, re-twist and style!
$500 - Be a guest on the show- We will Skype you in from where ever you are in the world to interact with our influencer hosts.  Just make sure you have a Skype account and a solid internet connection!  
$750 - Sponsored Messages: We will run your commercial during a break in the live show!  Reach the thousands of women around the world that will be tuning in live to see natural hair and beauty celebrated
$1000- Big Boss- This level is for our bosses who are making big moves and want everyone to know about it!  If you will be in NYC for CURLFEST you will have a 2 min segment on the live show to talk about your product. If you do not live in NYC and will not be attending the festival, we will Skype you in on the day of the show!  Share your business with the world!
 

The Impact

I think back to when I was a little girl and how there were hardly any images of women with natural hair on TV, in magazines or in any commercials.  Fast forward to 2018 and there are a handful of Black actresses who wear their natural hair on TV.  Media images are powerful...that is why corporations pay the big bucks on advertising...because it works!  I want to do my part and ensure that little black and brown girls worldwide get to experience what it's like to be proud of your beauty, your heritage and your people.  Your contribution to this project will allow just that.  Viewers will get to experience the magic that is CURLFEST does that and so much more.
  

Risks & Challenges
I've done the hard work to ensure that this live online broadcast goes on without a glitch but as you can imagine, live TV is unpredictable.  I am hiring television professionals who have experience in producing live television which decreases the risk of anything going wrong.  We will test the equipment the night before, set up early to test again to ensure that we are able to deliver a quality broadcast.  CURLFEST will be held outdoors at Prospect Park.  If it rains and the date is cancelled we will produce the live show on the proposed rain date given by the organizers of the festival.  

Other Ways You Can Help
I know in your heart of hearts that you want to support our cause however, if you are unable to give at this time please share this project with your friends, family or anyone you think who would like to support our cause.  CURLFEST is going to be the best event ever and we are eager and honored to bring this much #blackgirlmagic to the world!  
Make sure to use Indiegogo’s Sharing Tools and help us reach as many people as you can! 
 
Thank you and see you on CURLFEST Live 2018!

story:
So much of the ways that young women understand, misunderstand, love, critique, and guide one another is founded in our relationships with other young women. More specifically, in the conversations where we share and experience the harsh truths that help us bridge the gap between adolescence and womanhood. The series will feature four young women of color, not as caricatures of themselves, but as three-dimensional characters speaking freely on the struggles they face as they discover who they are.

Instead of a contrived setting in which conversations adhere to a strict political correctness, audiences will see these four college-aged women engage in an illuminating series of candid, oftentimes vulgar, and always unladylike, conversations about their lives. Colorful exchanges of shared passions, failures, successes, fears, and insecurities will found confrontationally truthful dialogue about sex, relationships, the student-to-career-woman transition, and race... over wine, burgers, and joints.

Each 4-5 minute episode will take place in a different setting. The first episode we may see them 'hot boxing' in a bathroom. The next, we could see them having tequila influenced conversations at a bar. In placing the characters in relatable, realistic settings, the goal is to allow the audiences to feel included in the conversation.

story:
Due to COVID-19, our first campaign wasn't quite as successful as we hoped--so we're launching this follow-up project!

 

 

Project Statement

The Last Great Video Store is an absurdist comedy web series in the vein of Wet Hot American Summer and Hot Rod. It follows four teenagers who work at a dying video store in 2013, as they attempt to chill, have a good time, and ultimately save the business from closure.

 

 

Andrew Paterson - Writer/Director

Andrew is an LA-based filmmaker hailing from the small town of Eugene, Oregon. He's been working day and night at a career in film over the last several years and is in the final stages of post-production for his first feature, a contained sci-fi story. He's excited to dive into the comedy space with this new web-series, and couldn't be happier that he's doing it alongside his closest friends!

 

Zoë Hughes - Executive Producer

Zoë is an LA based artist & art historian with specific interest in contemporary installation art. Recently, Zoë has began applying her knowledge of artistic movements into film through set design and art direction. She is particularly excited for this upcoming project because it has given her the opportunity to do a deep dive into recent pop culture history and trends.

 

Joey Carlson - Executive Producer/Leading Actor

Joey is a jack of all trades living in Los Angeles to pursue his dreams of being an actor, writer, and producer. When not on set, you could find him in the lab, researching modern physics and helping to engineer solutions to climate change. Growing up in Eugene, he gained a deep appreciation for film, and is ecstatic to be acting in the heartfelt yet absurd comedy The Last Great Video Store.

 

 

Link to Previous Project (where you can see perks and graphics!)

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-last-gre...

story:
FRIENDLY FIRES

Aaron is a filmmaker and theatre artist based in Toronto.

In 2009, he graduated the Humber Theatre Performance program with Honors, and the Acting Achievement Award.

After graduating he presented two plays, "Ambiguous" (winner of Trey Anthony’s award for artistic merit) and "Charming Monsters" (which garnered two literary reviews) at the Toronto Fringe Festival.

Aaron went on to directed Tennessee Williams' play, "And Tell Sad Stories of the Deaths of Queens," as a part of The Playwright Project. He also directed Dave Carley’s play, “INTO” at the Berkeley Street Theatre.

Aaron made three short films as part of the Script to Screen program at Centennial college. “Power Lines” and “Love Wins” are currently touring Canada, UK, and the US. “Respect” was chosen as the main class project, and Aaron was elected to direct the fully funded project to be released in 2021.

Since the Script to Screen program, Aaron co-directed “Surprise in the Night” for Shimaro Entertainment, and produced the proof-of-concept, “Baby Fever,” which will be turned into a feature film, and released 2022.

Recently he directed two short films during quarantine that are currently touring online festivals. His latest film, “The First Step” is supported by the Toronto Arts Council and VideoCabaret.

Aaron created the web-series, "Friendly Fires" in 2017 based on his experiences as a non-union Actor, and it was written as the prequel for his short film, “Respect.” 
 

Since the web-series is earlier in the timeline than the film - I need help producing the last two episodes of “Friendly Fires” before “Respect” is released.
 

Then we can all rejoice in a perfectly planned and executed story across multiple platforms.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $4,000.00 to complete the post-production on episode 4, and fully produce episode 5 & 6.

The cast & crew work for free, but there are expenses:

transportation for the equipment & crew $200

Cast & crew meals for 4 days on set $800

Post-production (edits, colour, sound) $2,500.00

marketing / distribution $500

total $4,000.00

PERKS:

For a donation of $1,000.00 you will receive 3 associate producer credits on IMDb, and in the credit section of the episodes. We’ll  give you a shout-out on social media to promote any work you’re doing, and to thank you for the contribution. We can also give you a small role on set.

 

For $500 you will receive 1 associate producer credit on IMDB and in the episode. You will also get a shout out on social media, and I can proofread or edit a short work of your choice.

for $250 you can get 3 “Thank You” credits on IMDb, and in the credits of the episodes. A “Thank You” on social media. I can also edit your resume, or help with agency submissions.
 
$100 you can get a “Thank you” credit on IMDb and in a episode. I can promote your work virtually on social media.

This is a fantastic opportunity to build your credits online, and make future connections in the industry. I can help you with proofreading and editing your work, and  help coach your acting auditions. I have lots of connections and can help you look for agents, apply to auditions or finesse your resume.

Thank you for the consideration 

Aaron Rothermund 

Filmmaker

story:
EXCLUSIVE GIVEAWAY
\\ ON SET EXPERIENCE //
We are offering an exciting opportunity to join us on set  for one of our biggest shoot days in an extremely mysterious and spooky location in the Sydney Region. (Refer to our Perks for more info).

Here's our Story...

We would like to take this time to introduce our key creatives for this project; Brittney White, Mark Ford, Chris Bax.

Brittney (Producer)

Credits include- Rolling Stones Documentary (Writer/Director/Producer), Genesis (Producer), Hypersomnia (Producer), A Model Of Consistency (Writer/Director/Producer), There’s No One Here (Producer), Guilty Pleasures TVC (Producer), Floating Away Music Video (Co-Producer).

Mark Ford (Writer/Director)

Credits include- Genesis (1st Assistant Director), A Model Of Consistency (1st Assistant Director/Producer), Paranormal Australia Documentary (1st Assistant Director), There’s No One Here (1st Assistant Director), Guilty Pleasures TVC (Writer/Director).

Chris Bax (Writer/Director)

Credits include- Genesis (Writer/Director/Editor), Paranormal Australia Documentary (Writer/Director/Editor), A Model Of Consistency (1st Assistant Cameraman), There’s No One Here (Production Designer/Editor), Guilty Pleasures TVC (1st Assistant Director/Editor),

What We Need

As full time students our budgets do not exceed past two minute noodles and rice.... So we need YOUR help to reach our goal to make this high quality production that this Pilot Episode deserves.

As this is a Sci-Fi/Thriller a large portion of our budget must be spent on Production Design. We will be fitting out various characters with costume as well as using astounding, beautiful locations to really bring to life the content.

Why $4,000?

  • We are filming at several locations which we will need to pay a hire fee
  • Van rental for equipment and cast
  • Fuel for Van and other cars transporting crew
  • Catering for 10+ crew member, 3 main cast, and extras
  • Production Design (costumes & props)
  • Professional make-up and hair artists


 

Any money we raise over this budget will be sent on hiring extra lighting equipment and camera lenses to add to our production value of the piece.

The Impact

Without your help our project will fall into the regular student film that finds its way into a lonely unseen YouTube channel.....However this is our passion and we will not see our story fall into the darkness of YouTube’s bowels but will present a film that will explode onto screens at film festivals not only locally but potentially on a global scale!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest advantage is that we will have a production regardless of time, funding and value. We have the backing of SAE equipment and facilities and do not need to fork out for expensive daily equipment hire. Instead we can focus all our funding on making our production go from okay to AMAZING with the help of YOU after all.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, if you donate, or if you can't, just spread the word! Re-tweet this campaign, share it with your Facebook friends, post about it on Instagram, MySpace or whatever the kids are using these days.  

Or, simply reach out and ask how you can help out on set in any way.

Thank you so much for taking the time to look over our pitch!

story:
Welcome to MaudeWorld!

Hail and well met friends, and welcome to MaudeWorld!

My name is Alex Maude, I am an actor, voice actor and dungeon master for the ever popular 5th edition of the worldwide phenomenon that is Dungeons and Dragons!

We are raising money for a new D&D YouTube show: MaudeWorld (the name wasn't my idea). Emulating the likes of the brilliant Critical Role and High Rollers, we are a group of friends and creatives who want to bring you epic fantasy story telling with high production values.

Your generous contributions will allow us to invest in better equipment and software; as well as  hiring the artists and composers we need to improve our current production values.

Our Pilot Episode!

Want to just dive straight into the action? Check out our Pilot Episode right here! This is MaudeWorld in its current state:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A3OdjANga50

Our Budget.

To make the version of MaudeWorld that we really want to make we need £4000.

This is our approximate budget:

Cameras: £1,100

Camera Accoutrements (SD cards, tripods etc): £200

Microphones: £500

Lighting: £750

Software: £500

Artist and Composer Fees: £650

Miscellaneous Expenses (inc Crowdfunding Fees):  £300

Total Cost: £4,000

Your Perks.

D&D is, at its heart, an awesome rule set to facilitate imagination and storytelling. And we feel that the best perks we can offer our viewers are ones that allow them to make their mark on an awesome story.

As such many of our perk tiers will allow you to make your mark on MaudeWorld! From giving a name to an NPC to creating a quest line with the DM; or even making a guest appearance! See our perks list for greater details.

Also, anyone who donates at least £5 to our story will receive an exclusive one shot that we will film after the campaign proper has commenced as our way of saying thank you to all those of you who help make MaudeWorld the reality we want it to be!

Why MaudeWorld?

I told you! The name wasn't my idea! Oh wait... you mean why should you watch the show?

Well several things: First is our creative pedigree. Our group of friends contains professional actors, writers, game developers, improvisers and more. All of us are excellent role players and we feel these skills help create a highly enjoyable and watchable show.

We also aim to provide a show with episodes that are shorter on average than other popular shows of the same type (about 2 hours in length). This is aimed at both people who want more high quality D&D shows to watch (something I often see a call for online); and at those who simply don't have the time to commit to a solid 4 hour block of D&D content, much as they would like to.

Our commitment to production values is another reason. This is one of the main reasons we are running this campaign in the first place: To improve and polish our current set up to make something even more enjoyable to watch!

Our Commitment to You.

We understand the risks associated with crowdfunding, especially with flexible campaigns like this one. But, as with all creatives, we are driven, truly, maddeningly, deeply driven by our passion.

As such, we will continue to make MaudeWorld even in the unfortunate instance that this crowdfund is unsuccessful, because, quite simply: We love D&D and we want to share our stories with you all, even if they don't meet our high production standards.

Speaking personally as a DM, this is a world I have been wanting to share with people for a long time and I have been excited about the prospect of creating this show for many many months. I have been inspired by so many other great DMs and D&D shows out there and what good is a wonderful idea if you don't share it with as many people as you can, right?  

Spread the Word!

Passion is all well and good, but we wouldn't be making a show and running a crowdfund campaign if we didn't want people to watch it!

So please, follow us on social media and here on IndieGoGo for more updates about the show and the campaign. Help spread the word and tell your friends and ask them to give just a few minutes of their time to check us out. The success of campaigns like this is dependant on word of mouth so please spread this as far and wide as you can. You never know who might be interested and every donation helps!

Our Social Media.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MaudeWorld

Twitter: https://twitter.com/maudeworld (#MaudeWorld)

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/maudeworlddnd/

E-mail: maudeworlddnd@gmail.com

Final Thanks.

All of our cast and crew are immensely grateful to all of you for your time and your donations. We need all of you to make the show that we want to make and mere typed words are insufficient to express our gratitude. But nonetheless. Thank you.

story:
Overview

Conversations in Apartment 3A follows two women, Sami (Melissa Lynch) and Kate (Keisha Bissram). They're both friends in their late-20s hitting roadblocks in their lives. Sami gets laid off from her dream job while Kate's client is consistently throwing her under the bus. Both roommates struggle to balance their personal and professional lives while staying sane in New York City.

While Kate and Sami move along their journey they clash with an array of complicated yet genuine characters. 

Why New York?

In pop culture, New York has been portrayed as this wonderful city (which, it is) with an awesome nightlife scene (and yes, it is awesome) and a vision of social media obsessed millennials.

But what about the people who have those everyday battles? Who love their profession but feel aren't where they'd like to be?  The ones who actually have a diverse group of friends? Who date interracially? Or those who are just confused about the dating scene in general?

Where are those stories? 

While residing in the city Keisha wanted to produce a project that taps into our generation (i.e. the millennial crowd) and portrays a more relatable side to what it's like for a 20-something year old living in the "glamour" of New York City. 

Now What?

The story has been created, the team has been assembled, and now we need to film it! We're here to ask you for a huge favor... We need your support to film this story!

Donate to our IndieGoGo campaign so we can film Conversations in Apartment 3A! We need to raise $15,000 dollars!

All of the fundings will go directly towards:

Transportation, craft services, insurance: 31%

Tech equipment, editing, & more: 38%

Wardrobe & Art: 15%

Marketing & more: 12%

Locations: 4%

Follow our Facebook (Conversations in Apt. 3A) and Instagram (@capt3a)!

Achieving our budget goal with your contribution will help us tell Kate and Sami's story!

Stay tuned for more information, updates, and behind-the-scenes photos on Facebook, Instagram, and IndieGoGo.

Cast and Crew Members

Keisha Bissram - Actress/Writer (Staten Island, NY)

Keisha has been writing since she was a child and acting for four years. She did most of her training as an actress at The Barrow Group.

While her favorite films are the Star Wars saga,Welcome to the Dollhouse and Mary & Max, she indulges in anime shows and films. (Favorite Sailor Scout: Makoto Kino/Sailor Jupiter)

Clare Cioffero - Director (New York)

Clare has been acting and writing since childhood, working for a time as writer for a small midwestern arts alternative weekly magazine. After a long break she is back to acting, most recently in short films and student films. 

Melissa Lynch - Actress (Wilmington, DE)

Melissa Lynch earned her B.A. at Northwestern University, where she earned a major in Theatre, a minor in the Business Institutions Program, as well as certificates in the Musical Theatre Program and the Leadership Program. She also took several classes at The Barrow Group in NYC. When she was four, her favorite movies were Gone with the Wind, Ghost, Creature from the Black Lagoon, and The Little Mermaid. Her current tastes are just as random. 

Moses Akempta - Director of Photography (Bronx-born, Yonkers-bred, NY)

"now living in the greatest city in the world (in the greatest city in the world! Werk werk)"

Moses graduated in 2013 with a Bachelor's in Media Communication Visual Arts at Pace University. After doing a couple student films & Battle Behind the Bottle, an award winning student documentary, he started off as a Production Assistant then an eventual Assistant Camera on the web series Math Warriors, Production Assistant on Lethe, then moved on to direct, shot, & co-wrote original film, Subsist.

Moses can do a Morgan Freeman & a movie trailer announcer voice. (mad skills, yo.)

Katarina La Poll - Camera Assistant (Bay Area, CA)

Katarina been doing theater since she was 9 and acting on and off since. She started taking acting classes again when she moved to NYC at The Barrow Group. She's currently studying at the William Esper Studio.  

Most recently she was the lead in an indie project, Where Go The Trains, over the summer where she played a post-apocalyptic adventurer. She wants to continue being in the arts and have a big fluffy dog.

She could watch Chicago and Step Brothers a million times.  Her most recent favorite film is American Honey. Or most any thing with Steve Carell. 

"...Steve Carell is my celebrity crush. (No man has ever made me laugh so hard!)"

Nelly Savinon - Wardrobe Supervisor (New York City)

Nelly studied acting at The Barrow Group for three years. She recently worked on the feature film The Light of the Moon. Her favorite film is the Oscar-award winning film Moonlight. 

She loves mix tapes, especially from the 90s. When asked to share a deep, dark secret she responded - "As Salt n Pepa would say: It's none of your business :)"  

Taylor Zaneri - Art/Wardrobe (New York)

Taylor studied at The Barrow Group for three years. She recently worked on the short film The Better Person. She's fluent in Italian and her favorite film is Casablanca. 

A deep, dark secret.. "I'm a diehard Yankees fan, maybe that's not so dark..."

Funty Bello - Sound/Music (Houston, Texas)

Funty received her BA at Baylor University and MA at NYU in Music Technology. Her favorite films (a tough choice for her) are the Lord of the Rings trilogy.

She loves babies (until they can talk) and she has a current love affair with Chobani Flips ("Like every flavor. O. M. G.")

Monica Hunter - Lights

Megan Channell - Campaign Marketing

Megan is an actor. Her work includes Mr. Robot, Power, the NBC pilot Songbyrd, I Love You but I Lied, All My Children, Contest, Sarina's Song, and over 70 commercials. You can currently see her jumping out of an orange cloud to promote vitamin supplements. 

Favorite quote: "Norm!" - Coach from Cheers.

story:
What is Twenty?

My name is Lily Richards and I am the writer, director, and star of Twenty The Webseries. I created Twenty to open a doorway for comedies that are relatable to everyone while highlighting the experience of LGBT women in today’s world.

By donating to Twenty you are allowing us to create a much anticipated Season 2. This project has been such a light in the lives of the whole creative team, the cast, the crew, as well as so many viewers who were able to relate to and find comfort in the show. By donating to Twenty, you are helping to change the narrative of LGBT women in film and television by showing that shows like Twenty deserve to be seen! 

 

The Team

Lily Richards (22 years old) an Caitlin Combe (23 years old) met in Boston, MA. They graduated from Emerson College in 2016 and moved to Los Angeles. They have been dating for over 3 years and this is their first collaboration. Driven by two young women, Twenty has attracted a large number of other strong women to join the team both in front and behind the camera. 

 

What We Need

In order for Season 2 to happen we need to raise $20,000. 

Season 1 was funded entirely out of pocket by the director/writer and producer. Although we would love to be able to do that for Season 2, it is not financially possible. The allocation of the $20,000 is simple. 

  • $4,000: Updating our equipment. With new equipment we would be able to make Season 2 look, sound, and run even better than Season 1. 
  • $5,000: Food and Beverage. We provide our cast and crew with breakfast, lunch, and dinner when they are on set with us. We will probably shoot 18 to 20 full days to complete Season 2 which breaks down to around 50 to 60 meals. We’ve got a lot of mouths to feed! 
  • $2,000: Marketing. The most important part is getting Twenty out into the world. $2,000 for marketing would allow us to cover the cost of submit twenty to film festivals as well as the cost of buying business cards and other advertising items so that we can show twenty to as many people as possible. 
  • $4,000: Cast and Crew Expenses. One of the most magical parts of Season 1 was that everybody involved worked for free. If we managed to raise $4,000 dollars we would be able to pay our cast a minimal stipend to show how much we appreciate their hours of hard work.
  • $5,000: Locations, Props, Gas, and Accidentals. You never know what's going to come up on set, and since we film in Los Angeles (where parking is ridiculous) we want to make sure we are covered for any potential problems or challenges we may run into along the way. 

 

 

What You Get

We have several perks that you can get if you contribute to Twenty.

These perks include:

  • Instagram story shout out!
  • Handwritten Thank You card from the Creators.
  • Twenty Gift Bag
  • Plant named after you in the Twenty Offices. 
  • Executive Producer Credit. 
  • Personalized Thank You video from the cast and crew. 
  • A character named after you in Season 2!
 

Why now?

As a 22-year-old proud member of the LGBT community, I wish that something similar to Twenty had been available to me when I was growing up. Societal expectations for female sexuality are often dictated through a male dominated perspective. Young female sexuality is almost always talked about in relation to men, and in many ways men are expected to find your sexuality for you. This narrative is harmful to young men and women regardless of sexuality, but for queer women it can often be detrimental to developing a true understanding of self. Discovering and owning your sexuality as a young queer woman should be exciting and empowering and I hope that Twenty can open a doorway for more media that fosters that kind of self-discovery. By donating to Twenty, you are helping to change the narrative of LGBT women in film and television. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Whenever you are creating content there is always a risk that something will go wrong on set that you can't fix in the editing room! However, we have dealt with such challenges in Season 1 and managed to come out on top every time. There is no malfunction we cannot handle! 

In addition, 3 of our main cast members live out of state. We managed to coordinate for them to fly in and film all of their parts before, and we will certainly be able to do it again. It is quite an obstacle but we are skilled at overcoming it. 

 

What else can you do?

If you want to support Twenty but don't feel that you can contribute financially you can help tremendously by subscribing to our Youtube channel and liking our videos.

Most importantly, you can spread the word! Let others know about Twenty and this Indiegogo!

Help get Twenty out to the world! 

​You can follow us on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and Tumblr. Feel free to also check out our Website.

story:
GIRL POWER IS SUPER SICK, BRUH

Welcome to State University, the premiere All-American university located somewhere in the United States. This place has everything: greek life, Division I sports, five kick ass sorority sisters doubling as a masked crime fighting unit keeping the campus safe from evil, a Chipotle. But when one of their sisters is murdered at the hands of a new villain who calls himself “The Douche,” the stability of the sisterhood, the college, and the entirety of America are put into jeopardy. Part Buffy the Vampire Slayer, part Scream Queens, Kappa Force is the antidote to these trying times.

WELCOME TO THE PAGE Y'ALL

Hello there! And welcome to the crowdfunding page for KAPPA FORCE, a new web-series written and created by ME, Addison Heimann, and directed by the dope AF Hannah Welever. It's also produced by me and some chick named Emilie Modaff who is fine, I guess (nah she fire). We're millennials, can't you tell by our ephemeral vernacular!??!?

But seriously, thank you for coming here. If you're here that means you maybe kind of like who I am as a person. Or maybe you just wanted to see if anyone would donate to something as CRAZY as a superhero web-series. My hope is yes, because, let's be honest, don't you want to see a group of badass women beat the crap out of men's rights activists? Personally that's always been a dream of mine.

WHAT ARE WE DOING?

We're creating a seven-part web series telling this serialized story. It's weird, it's campy, it gets a little dark, but at the end of the day good WILL prevail over evil. Or WILL IT (no spoilers!!!!).

Unfortunately, a web-series costs money! And that's where you come in. If this kind of project sounds interesting and you want to see more, we would really appreciate a donation, no matter how big or small. From renting a super hot and sexy camera, to paying everyone for their generous work on this project--your contribution will get us that much closer to bringing the story of Kappa Force to life . I love this story and the characters and cannot wait to show you the rest of what we have in store.

WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO SPECIFICALLY?

Want to donate!?? OMG YES YOU ARE AMAZING. Below is a breakdown of where your money goes!

INSURANCE - 5%

PRODUCTION DESIGN - 25%

CAMERA RENTAL/CINEMATOGRAPHY - 15%

SOUND - 10%

COSTUME/MAKEUP DESIGN - 15%

PUBLICITY - 15%

ACTOR/PRODUCTION STIPENDS - 20%

INCENTIVES!

Thanks everyone for checking out the page. If you decide to donate we have a slew of swag that we can't WAIT to give to you. If you don't have the funds, that's cool too. Word of mouth is our best form of publicity. Do us the favor of sharing this campaign and following us on facebook/instagram @kappaforceseries! Thx baes. I love you all. 

MEET THE TEAM!

Addison Heimann - Writer/Creator

Addison Heimann is a writer and actor currently residing in Chicago. His plays have been read, workshopped, and performed through Shattered Globe, The New Colony, Indieboots, party/theatre/party and The Poor Theatre among others. Kappa Force is his baby and first love and Addison is the most excited to collaborate with Hannah and Emilie on this exciting project.

http://www.addisonheimann.com

Hannah Welever - Director

Born and raised in Ohio, Hannah moved to Chicago in 2010 to begin her career in film and media art. After almost 8 years of constant learning, production, and process Hannah has created a diverse portfolio of work and collaboration within Chicago and beyond. Hannah is extremely excited to be the fearless leader of the 'Kappa Force' team as she, herself, feels like a cog in the impending patriarchal machine...

http://www.hannahwelever.com

Emilie Modaff - Executive Producer

Emilie Modaff, Executive Producer of Kappa Force, is an actor, musician, writer, and Libra stationed in Chicago. She met Addison during a raucous production of Robin Hood and Maid Marian, quickly fell in love with him, and decided making art together would be a good life decision. Kappa Force is a source of levity in the midst of every day misogyny, drumpf, injustice and rape culture. Emilie encourages viewers to laugh, practice self-care, and smash the patriarchy daily.

http://www.emiliemodaff.com
