story:
Short Summary

Hey! I'm Bonnie White, I've been an actor in New York for the last 7 years and I've been writing for the last two. As an actor, I mostly work on new plays in the downtown off broadway scene and I've always wanted to be a series regular on a tv show, so I decided to take my future into my own hands and write one myself! Helping me reach my goal could be a game changer in terms of my career growth and artistic growth. Think of all the tv shows that started off as a mere web series, what if I was able to reach that far with the amount you contribute today?

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $4,500 in order to make these first 3 episodes. All of that will go directly into the production of the show. With your help we will be able to create a beautiful professional looking series. Your money will pay for us to have:

a Director, an Editor, a crew, a shooting location, props, great equipment like a camera, mics and lights, sound editing and mixing, post production editing and not to mention food to feed our actors so they have the stamina to shoot all day :)

Plus, depending on the size of your contribution, it could get you a ticket to the screening party in July! 

If we don't reach the entire goal, the rest will be coming out of my pocket, so help a sista out lol

The Impact

This project is important because it tells a female centric story. When was the last time you watched a tv show with only female series regulars? I imagine the answer is NEVER.

I've worked with Michael Mullen whose production company Blackbox Productions I'm using for this project. It was Michael who filmed my short video Cookie Love Sick so I know and trust his work. So far that video has a few over 1,000 views on YouTube which is low for YouTube standards, but I've never performed in a 1,000 seat theater sooo pretty cool! 

The actors I cast in the series are people I know and trust because I've worked with them before, wether at The Flea Theater or Indiana University, they are all working New York actors excited to work on a project like this. 

Risks & Challenges

I'm not going to lie, I've never done this before. There is no guarantee that everything will go perfectly, but I'm someone who has learned how to roll with the punches and make necessary changes to reach my goal on the fly. I did make it to Advanced Level Study at UCB Improv after all! Even if this series doesn't get accepted into any festivals or catch the eye of tastemakers online, it will be instrumental to my growth as an actor and writer in terms of confidence and know-how so I'm better equipped for the next story that calls out to me that it's ready to be told. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, I understand! I know what it's like to skip lunch because you don't have $9 in your bank account for a Chipotle burrito, but despite that you can still help me!

  • Make some noise about my campaign on Facebook, Instagram and/or Twitter, post the campaign page with a line about why they should contribute and the hashtag #adminswebseries
  • The Indiegogo share tools are also really easy to use!

Thank you SO much for all of your support and kind words already, I can't wait to share this project with everyone!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hey! I'm Bonnie White, I've been an actor in New York for the last 7 years and I've been writing for the last two. As an actor, I mostly work on new plays in the downtown off broadway scene and I've always wanted to be a series regular on a tv show, so I decided to take my future into my own hands and write one myself! Helping me reach my goal could be a game changer in terms of my career growth and artistic growth. Think of all the tv shows that started off as a mere web series, what if I was able to reach that far with the amount you contribute today?
What We Need & What You Get
I need to raise $4,500 in order to make these first 3 episodes. All of that will go directly into the production of the show. With your help we will be able to create a beautiful professional looking series. Your money will pay for us to have:
a Director, an Editor, a crew, a shooting location, props, great equipment like a camera, mics and lights, sound editing and mixing, post production editing and not to mention food to feed our actors so they have the stamina to shoot all day :)
Plus, depending on the size of your contribution, it could get you a ticket to the screening party in July! 
If we don't reach the entire goal, the rest will be coming out of my pocket, so help a sista out lol

The Impact
This project is important because it tells a female centric story. When was the last time you watched a tv show with only female series regulars? I imagine the answer is NEVER.
I've worked with Michael Mullen whose production company Blackbox Productions I'm using for this project. It was Michael who filmed my short video Cookie Love Sick so I know and trust his work. So far that video has a few over 1,000 views on YouTube which is low for YouTube standards, but I've never performed in a 1,000 seat theater sooo pretty cool! 
The actors I cast in the series are people I know and trust because I've worked with them before, wether at The Flea Theater or Indiana University, they are all working New York actors excited to work on a project like this. 

Risks & Challenges
I'm not going to lie, I've never done this before. There is no guarantee that everything will go perfectly, but I'm someone who has learned how to roll with the punches and make necessary changes to reach my goal on the fly. I did make it to Advanced Level Study at UCB Improv after all! Even if this series doesn't get accepted into any festivals or catch the eye of tastemakers online, it will be instrumental to my growth as an actor and writer in terms of confidence and know-how so I'm better equipped for the next story that calls out to me that it's ready to be told. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute money, I understand! I know what it's like to skip lunch because you don't have $9 in your bank account for a Chipotle burrito, but despite that you can still help me!

Make some noise about my campaign on Facebook, Instagram and/or Twitter, post the campaign page with a line about why they should contribute and the hashtag #adminswebseries
The Indiegogo share tools are also really easy to use!

Thank you SO much for all of your support and kind words already, I can't wait to share this project with everyone!

story:
Short Summary

Tricia Messeroux and Gerard Brogdon have been friends for close to thirty years, sharing many life experiences and great times! Over the past year staying connected was important, but it was also a challenge. They thought that inviting a small group of friends to have monthly dinner parties rotated among each of their homes might ease some of the anxiety caused by the pandemic – the four couples agreed. After a couple of rotations, Tricia realized that dinner at three of the homes was always prepared by the wives, but dinner at the fourth home was prepared by the man of the house. What's more is that he always blew it out of the park! The food was incredible in terms of both taste and presentation.

Tricia, a creative director and CEO of TMezz Production, approached Gerard, a self- taught culinary artist (among other things) to do a cooking show; not to teach the wives to cook, but the MEN... the idea for Foods & Dudes was born!!!

Ten episodes were produced for the first season. The show was so well received that Tricia had the opportunity to meet with influential network and streaming executives who asked for a second season that must be produced within very specific (and expensive) technical parameters. The second season will also have a far heavier focus on the “barber shop talk” aspect of the show, leaning heavily into issues that affect men in our society. Another goal for the second season is for the show to be filmed in a new “open concept” kitchen that will make it easier for the viewers to see the food being prepared, and hear the conversations that take place. The challenge is that we must complete 8- 10 episodes by November 1, 2021 and launch by December 1, 2021.

This is a show that empowers men to do something that hasn’t traditionally been recognized as a man's activity in the home. Merging conversations about men's insights on sports, family, current events and other topics with a cooking lesson to make a delicious meal for their loved ones makes this show unique. These Dudes are well informed and aren't afraid to share their opinions! The viewers will continue to laugh,

learn, and enjoy while watching the Dudes come together for this fun and delectable experience... Welcome to Foods & Dudes!!!

    

What We Need & What You Get

While we already posses and we're self-funding a huge number of production requirements, our additional need is $40K out of $175K to add to: 

- FILMED IN A NEW KITCHEN!!!!

- PURCHASE INDUSTRY REQUIRED EQUIPMENT $$

- TECH SPECS

- EDITORS

We've got only 2 months to complete all 10 episodes!  In early December there's something pretty cool launching on PEACOCK streaming network.  So we've got to move fast!

 

See below for perks for partnership

- $55 (Name listed on website as sponsor)

- $100 (Name listed on website as sponsor, PLUS Foods & Dudes T-Shirt)

- $500 (Name listed on website as sponsor, Foods & Dudes T-Shirt PLUS one free ticket to premier party)

- $1000 (Name listed on website as sponsor, Foods & Dudes T-Shirt PLUS three free tickets to premier party and Foods & Dudes seasoning rub)

- $5000 (Name listed on website, Foods & Dudes T-Shirt, three free tickets to premier party, Foods & Dudes seasoning rub PLUS a 2-3 minute walk-on role on an episode)

The Impact

This show is not only fun and informative, but it’s also important. Families have gotten away from sitting down at the dinner table for a number of reasons, and that’s where some of the “good stuff” can happen. Couples that are reluctant or unable to go to restaurants can have restaurant quality meals prepared and served at home. The topics of discussion will be relatable and debatable, perhaps even bringing attention to issues that aren’t discussed on any other platform – and certainly not while learning to prepare delicious, mouth-watering meals.

Challenges

Our biggest challenge is that the industry requires such incredible specifications when it comes to the finished product in order to be considered for broadcasting or
streaming. Most of these specs require us to purchase additional equipment and hire personnel who are proficient with the use of the equipment.

 

About the Director

Tricia Messeroux, former global ad exec turned creative entrepreneur is internationally known for being a visionary most notably for her brand Toddlewood www.Toddlewood.com.  She and this brand continues to hit the A-list media circuit regularly with features on The View, The Today Show, GMA, Tamron Hall Show, Steve Harvey, ABC, CBS Morning and evening News just to name a few.  

The TMezz Creative Group.  As a visionary, Tricia enlisted her production team to create season 1 of a 10 episode video series, Foods & Dudes.  While this was a new and some would say test market season, her company, TMezz Production www.tmezzcreative.com  has received incredible accolades for the vision and initial execution. Fast forward only 8 months later, Foods & Dudes is in demand.  As the creator and director of Foods & Dudes, she and her team of very talented industry professional work to bring this vision to life.  Her goal is to create something different but eye-catching, inspiring and empowering, insightful as well as humorous....and don't forget...delicious!

 

About Gerard

Our Culinary Artist Gerard (who everyone calls “G”) is a self-taught cook and baker. Growing up, he watched his mother and father prepare traditional Southern dishes and began cooking on his own while in his early teen years. While he learned his basic skills from his parents, he is gifted in being able to recreate dishes just by taste, infuse new and bold flavors to traditional recipes, and create his own style of cooking that uses aggressive flavor combinations. Gerard believes that cooking at home is the starting point for healthy eating, important family discussions, romantic evenings, fantastic family gatherings and so many other events that revolve around good food, drinks, and desserts. His goal is to have men step out of their comfort zone and enter the kitchen - and to teach them to do so skillfully. His catch-phrase in the kitchen is “The first bite we take is with our eyes”, and his hope is that others who watch him will take their own “bite” at cooking because he makes it look so easy and fun!

 

About The Dudes

The magic is two fold:: Cooking instructions by master culinary artist, Gerard
(G) Brogdon, and the cool Dudes that walk into his kitchen with wide eyes and a lot of opinions and insights on numerous topics men, families and the world are facing today.

story:
Welcome to season 5 of "Child of the '70s."  Our first four seasons were largely self-funded by its creator, Michael Vaccaro, along with donations from fans like you.  This season we really want to step it up a notch and help reward the cast and crew with more than just "copy, credit and meals."  Our team worked tirelessly to bring our show to the world and we would like to thank them.

A remarkable amount of money actually goes into producing a show like ours. Equipment rentals, location fees, gas, food and lodging are but the tip of the iceberg. There are also music licensing, post production costs and operating expenses.

We certainly hope you can find it in your hearts and your pocketbooks to donate to our fifth and final season of "Child of the '70s."  

Here are some of the stars of Child of the '70s:

Comedians Bruce Vilanch & Judy Tenuta, Ted Lange (The Love Boat), Gina Hecht (Mork and Mindy), Geri Jewell (The Facts of Life), Lynne Marie Stewart (It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia), Carole Ita White (Laverne and Shirley), the original cowboy from The Village People Randy Jones, LATalk Radio Host Sheena Metal, Amy Linker (Square Pegs), Terry Ray (From Here On Out), Bonnie Sher (Soap), Susan Olsen (The Brady Bunch), Donna Pescow (Angie), Mel England (Ron and Laura Take Back America) and Broadway stars Duane Boutte, Chuck Saculla, Natalie Toro and Lorinda Lisitza, and of course, the creator Michael Vaccaro. 

The show is co-written by Michael Vaccaro and Terrence Moss.  

Co-executive producers are Charlie Vaughn and Michael Vaccaro.

Directed by Tom Pardoe

story:
My name is Tikal De Meru aka Onyx, I've written this very special web series for Youtube and I'll be your host! ​The show is about people that have had a mystical experience and have done something about it. This project will highlight businesses, inventions, teachings, discoveries, modalities and practices that will, that can or that have already impacted the face of the earth. I personally call these people legends and mystics!

You'll see very personal dreams and visions that have inspired the world or are about to come to life. You'll hear some wicked tracks and specially crafted music composed exclusively for the show! plus you'll get to see some cool cartoon illustrations that will take us in the inexplicable cathartic moments the story tellers share. It will be short 'n sweet, bold and weird, and all kinds of cats, but mostly with inspiring people facing the unknown and  diving deep to look within.

 

Raising the stakes of what we believe the mind can take and inspiring others to realise that one of the most challenging journey of discovery may be in the psyche or human consciousness. We push boundaries to learn about our existence when we have not even gotten near the bottom of an ocean of emotion without drowning in the sea of questions about who we are! but man what a tremendous quest that is? 

If this elegant, funky and entertaining project can help illustrate the trials and challenges of our day-to-day wins & losses then, with your help we can create an inspiring library of the many legendary humans that have contributed to perhaps the world's greatest creation: the human experience.

And guess what, we are also taking in more applicants if you want your story told our way. Like what you see? get on board. Expect a wicked style and modern tales of the extraordinary, encounters with another kind, out of body experiences, past life regression, channeling, telepathy, premonitions, spirit guidance, symbolism, shamanism, ancestral voices, possessions, trance, healing, intuition, apparitions and so much more, but also inspiring humans.



This campaign serves in funding the basic needs for a team to keep producing high quality mini documentary series for everyone to enjoy. The team consists of Arya, Balinese film maker, Sovie our new marketing strategist and myself. Also we are needing to hire an Indonesian cartoonist. We have our very own music composer from Los Angeles.

"BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice!

With this I also want to honour and revive a mostly ridiculed and mis-understood ancient art of communication: the art of deep listening. I believe true knowledge is by experience and that there is something behind the veil that is speaking to us and guiding us to do what we do. Perhaps what we call reality will forever remain a notorious mystery, but how much of a sublime challenge is that for a life's mission than the famous aphorism Know Thyself ?

Here is the more quantifiable stuff; we are dialing in the production, the art direction and the concept writing and we already have a quality camera but we need an extra help which will go towards post production, crew, design, marketing, and merchandise. A Grand Total of 13,500 euros​ that will make the difference for the birth and launch of this project to reach your personal screens by February of 2021. We plan to make 44 episodes per year til 2026 and this budget will kickstart the Urban Legends channel on YouTube. "BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice! Alternative avenues for donations to paypal.me/DMTikal

Allocations of raised funds going towards:

  • Production & Post Prod + Props & Design : 6200euros
  • Team : 3100 euros
  • Gear : 1900 Euros
  • Merch & Marketing : 2300euros


Direct Mentions and thank-yous! MP3 soundtrack albums of our music! the show's unique hoodies for collectors items! Have your story told! "BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice!

  • Exclusive MP3 music soundtrack of our first two episodes from our music wizard
  • Give-Away of Urban Legends hoodies, shipped to your doorstep 
  • Exclusive Feature of YOUR business logo, brand and image on our show
  • A whole bunch of DISCOUNT COUPONS from the businesses and legends we feature on our show.
  • Become a sponsor or get your story told in our show.

    Alternative avenues for donations to paypal.me/DMTikal
    Indonesian Bank Transfers to Bank Mandiri
    Acct Owner Theresia Sompie
    Acct. no: 1260004400197


 

With this project, not only will we inspire to take a new look on reality but we can also protect the realms of magic, imagination and creativity for our future generations. 'Imagination' - some say, is the foundation of the human existence.

With today's mega entertainment industry and towering tech growth, some of us must keep finding creative ways to give voice to the dream keepers, the artists, the muses, and the guardians of ancient wisdom, especially the inner technology that is not only valid and prominent in great human advances but in our daily lives. Witnessing the supreme and relentless creative force behind all human beings going through any type of setback can shed much light to those stuck in the dark. We hope the stories told in this show will help those that may be finding themselves riddled with fear or doubt, pain or sorrow, shame or guilt, and give them a potent push towards an exalted life.

The value is endless... 
We hope to demystify the concept of mysticism, in Asia for example, the word mystic is surrounded by the stories of ghosts, demonic possessions, or horror, when some of our most ancient texts have conveyed poetic and powerful accounts of divine interventions, burning bushes, and miracles that two thousand years later are still being told of. In Western countries, it seems that ridicule and mockery tend to precede even the closest thing to a dialogue about anything mystical - which can tear apart a fragile soul or a timid kid when in some parts of the world where the unseen is embraced, people with mystical experiences are seen as gifted. 

OH! and Cats, cats n more cats! to the rescue! 
In case you don't notice throughout the show - We are crazy about cats! and we have a problem to solve here in Bali with cats and dogs not being loved up the way they could be, and even worse still... they are many times dumped injured into garbage or into the wild and left to die... so we want to support the local cat lovers and educational cat sanctuaries, provide emergency care to our friends in need. With our show expected to be a success, 10% of our profits will be reserved and funnelled to supporting cat helpers and creating safe haven for them. 

 

Bali is very unique and seems to have a spiritual aid. Although the COVID-19 drama presents challenges that everyone in our world is facing on a daily basis, our team is working hard to ensure we can create our films while still following awareness, health guidelines and sovereignty. While these are unprecedented times, we foresee finishing production of 44 episodes for 2021 when we meet our crowdfund goal.  *Any perks affected by the pandemic will be worked out to your satisfaction. 

 

Please know you can help in other ways than financially! we believe this show to have great potential for inspiration in unprecedented times like these, so we will take all the help we can use!

  • Let's hear you make some noise about the campaign. Go LOUD on Facebook, or Instagram page, don't forget to say you're supporting us.
  • Want to join the team? we are looking for out marketing strategist and YouTube expert
  • Oh yeah Indiegogo has direct share tools, just use'em if you prefer
  • If you want to be in the show... WE TAKE APPLICATIONS FOR INTERVIEWS ! 

    "BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice!
    Alternative avenues for donations to paypal.me/DMTikal
    Indonesian Bank Transfers to Bank Mandiri
    Acct Manager Theresia Sompie
    Acct. no: 1260004400197

 

 

...from the backstage organic farm

 

 

Here is a short snippet from one of our future episodes
TURN ON the Subtitles in the settings below (English BY AUTHOR)

 

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

After years of searching for the meaning of my own presence I've come to realise my own dreams which I enjoy serving on festival stages and in intimate circles across the world. I'm an intuitive singer, living the life of a mystic lover, infatuated by the mysteries of the cave of shadows. From years of chasing the ghost of my own purpose and fighting with the demons of my own making I have also been collecting a treasure chest of ancestral story tellers and unusual dream keepers. Today, after 13 years of an intimate relationship walking along their side and strolling with my multiple personality order, it's time to relay their inspiring stories with a pinch of my own recipe.

My background as an artist and curious cat carved a mystic path that has led me to remote places both physical and also extremely surreal. After tirelessly digging at the abysmal spiritual rabbit hole and pulling aside the matrix curtains, I attempted to see what lies behind the scenes of what we call reality. I've come across some strange beings and fantastic characters whom have pocketed stories that deserve to be told, and told from the horse's mouth. I hope we will all get to see a great show! 

"BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice!
Alternative avenues for donations to paypal.me/DMTikal
Indonesian Bank Transfers to Bank Mandiri
Acct Manager Theresia Sompie
Acct. no: 1260004400197

Thank you!

Perhaps what we call reality will forever remain a notorious mystery, but how much of a sublime challenge is that for a life's mission than the famous aphorism Know Thyself ?



Here is the more quantifiable stuff; we are dialing in the production, the art direction and the concept writing and we already have a quality camera but we need an extra help which will go towards post production, crew, design, marketing, and merchandise. A Grand Total of 13,500 euros​ that will make the difference for the birth and launch of this project to reach your personal screens by February of 2021. We plan to make 44 episodes per year til 2026 and this budget will kickstart the Urban Legends channel on YouTube. "BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice! Alternative avenues for donations to paypal.me/DMTikal
Allocations of raised funds going towards:

Production & Post Prod + Props & Design : 6200euros 
Team : 3100 euros
Gear : 1900 Euros
Merch & Marketing : 2300euros




Direct Mentions and thank-yous! MP3 soundtrack albums of our music! the show's unique hoodies for collectors items! Have your story told! "BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice!

Exclusive MP3 music soundtrack of our first two episodes from our music wizard
Give-Away of Urban Legends hoodies, shipped to your doorstep 
Exclusive Feature of YOUR business logo, brand and image on our show
A whole bunch of DISCOUNT COUPONS from the businesses and legends we feature on our show.
Become a sponsor or get your story told in our show.Alternative avenues for donations to paypal.me/DMTikalIndonesian Bank Transfers to Bank MandiriAcct Owner Theresia SompieAcct. no: 1260004400197

 


With this project, not only will we inspire to take a new look on reality but we can also protect the realms of magic, imagination and creativity for our future generations. 'Imagination' - some say, is the foundation of the human existence.With today's mega entertainment industry and towering tech growth, some of us must keep finding creative ways to give voice to the dream keepers, the artists, the muses, and the guardians of ancient wisdom, especially the inner technology that is not only valid and prominent in great human advances but in our daily lives. Witnessing the supreme and relentless creative force behind all human beings going through any type of setback can shed much light to those stuck in the dark. We hope the stories told in this show will help those that may be finding themselves riddled with fear or doubt, pain or sorrow, shame or guilt, and give them a potent push towards an exalted life.The value is endless... We hope to demystify the concept of mysticism, in Asia for example, the word mystic is surrounded by the stories of ghosts, demonic possessions, or horror, when some of our most ancient texts have conveyed poetic and powerful accounts of divine interventions, burning bushes, and miracles that two thousand years later are still being told of. In Western countries, it seems that ridicule and mockery tend to precede even the closest thing to a dialogue about anything mystical - which can tear apart a fragile soul or a timid kid when in some parts of the world where the unseen is embraced, people with mystical experiences are seen as gifted. 
OH! and Cats, cats n more cats! to the rescue! In case you don't notice throughout the show - We are crazy about cats! and we have a problem to solve here in Bali with cats and dogs not being loved up the way they could be, and even worse still... they are many times dumped injured into garbage or into the wild and left to die... so we want to support the local cat lovers and educational cat sanctuaries, provide emergency care to our friends in need. With our show expected to be a success, 10% of our profits will be reserved and funnelled to supporting cat helpers and creating safe haven for them. 


 


Bali is very unique and seems to have a spiritual aid. Although the COVID-19 drama presents challenges that everyone in our world is facing on a daily basis, our team is working hard to ensure we can create our films while still following awareness, health guidelines and sovereignty. While these are unprecedented times, we foresee finishing production of 44 episodes for 2021 when we meet our crowdfund goal.  *Any perks affected by the pandemic will be worked out to your satisfaction. 
 


Please know you can help in other ways than financially! we believe this show to have great potential for inspiration in unprecedented times like these, so we will take all the help we can use!

Let's hear you make some noise about the campaign. Go LOUD on Facebook, or Instagram page, don't forget to say you're supporting us.

Want to join the team? we are looking for out marketing strategist and YouTube expert
Oh yeah Indiegogo has direct share tools, just use'em if you prefer
If you want to be in the show... WE TAKE APPLICATIONS FOR INTERVIEWS ! "BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice!Alternative avenues for donations to paypal.me/DMTikalIndonesian Bank Transfers to Bank MandiriAcct Manager Theresia SompieAcct. no: 1260004400197

 
 ...from the backstage organic farm  Here is a short snippet from one of our future episodesTURN ON the Subtitles in the settings below (English BY AUTHOR)  ABOUT THE AUTHORAfter years of searching for the meaning of my own presence I've come to realise my own dreams which I enjoy serving on festival stages and in intimate circles across the world. I'm an intuitive singer, living the life of a mystic lover, infatuated by the mysteries of the cave of shadows. From years of chasing the ghost of my own purpose and fighting with the demons of my own making I have also been collecting a treasure chest of ancestral story tellers and unusual dream keepers. Today, after 13 years of an intimate relationship walking along their side and strolling with my multiple personality order, it's time to relay their inspiring stories with a pinch of my own recipe.My background as an artist and curious cat carved a mystic path that has led me to remote places both physical and also extremely surreal. After tirelessly digging at the abysmal spiritual rabbit hole and pulling aside the matrix curtains, I attempted to see what lies behind the scenes of what we call reality. I've come across some strange beings and fantastic characters whom have pocketed stories that deserve to be told, and told from the horse's mouth. I hope we will all get to see a great show! "BACK IT" - donate to our project or get a perk of your choice!Alternative avenues for donations to paypal.me/DMTikalIndonesian Bank Transfers to Bank MandiriAcct Manager Theresia SompieAcct. no: 1260004400197Thank you!

story:
The Story:

Post Grad is an online series about a group of friends, Chris (pictured), James, Tyler, Chelsea and Malik who all deal with different aspect of life immediately Post Grad-uation. The episodes highlight each character's individual struggles adapting to this new stage of their life. 

  • Post Graduate life isn't talked about very much. We see a lot of sitcoms, even older ones with friend groups, however they're typically into their late 20's/early 30's and established. This "Dramedy" aims to focus on the years prior to this stability and the temporary chaos it can cause. 
  • The actors are all experienced, talented, and ready to bring this project to life. It's a project that we are all passionate about and have all recently experienced. 
  • This campaign is important to us as this project has been years in the making and now that it's time for shooting, we are so close to bringing this project to life for you all to see and enjoy!

The Need 

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The budget to film this series (12 Episodes), using various location shoots, along with the hiring of additional production personnel is around $7,000 (mainly because we're very resourceful and found a way to pull a lot off on our own).  This would allow us to film an entire "season" of the series (and possibly even more) with so many unique locations that help bring this art to life along with helping with expenses such as:
    • Lighting
    • Lenses
    • Props
    • Design
    • Cinematography
  • Nobody wants to watch a show shot in someone's living room every episode and nobody can do a project alone. This campaign would help with both. 

The Reason

With your donation, Post Grad has the ability to reach a MASSIVE audience of young adults who are currently experiencing the same challenges as our characters. With this series, we hope to:

  • Relate to adults young and old, about the challenges a lot of us faced, building a sense of community amongst our viewers. 
  • Give voice to not only this topic, but topics and debates that we all partake in, whether in real life or on social media. To start a conversation. 
  • Entertain you! I meant it IS a dramedy for goodness sake! Yes, there is drama associated with the show topics, but this isn't the Sopranos! There are loads of lines, situations, and moments to keep you laughing!

The Perks

  • We have some amazing perks for donors! These include custom items from the show and the "University" our graduates attended  (t-shirts, mugs, posters, etc. all seen in the show) along with things such as a production credit, a character named in your honor, and more with of course, a thank you to be seen in the post-credit! 

Don't get paid until next week? Do us a favor and we'll call it even

Some may not be able to  contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Talk about our social media campaign on twitter and mention @postgradseries_ or @yalljust_myfans with the link to donate!
  • Be prepared to watch the show and enjoy in the coming months!

story:
What's "From the Ashes"?

Hi, I'm Marlene Thompson, a Second City-trained improviser and comedian living here in Asheville. Over the past few months, I've been working with a group of writers, actors and video production pros to make plans for a show I have wanted to do for a long time.

It's called "From the Ashes," and it's a political comedy and commentary show hosted by me. There'll be an opening monologue, segments from a desk, filmed sketches and on-the-street segments. If you've seen John Oliver or Samantha Bee's shows, you know the format, but this show adds in a local, Asheville element along with the national stories.

There'll be a live show at the Actor's Center of Asheville in Black Mountain September 14-15, but we'll also be making videos of every segment to post to YouTube and Funny or Die.

What We Need

We're looking for a little seed money to pay the crew--camera operator, sound technician, lighting coordinator, etc.--and, if we raise enough, the actors who appear in the sketches. We want to make sure they're compensated for their hard work!

What You'll Get

In addition to the regular segments of the show, we'll be recording a special shout-out video in which I'll thank anyone who contributes $5 or more to our efforts. If you can't contribute that much, I'll thank you personally in a tweet if you pitch in at least $1!

Bigger spenders can actually become part of the show! Anyone who chips in $10 or more will get a character named after them in a sketch in a future episode, and folks who are generous enough to contribute $15 or more will get their photo featured on the show during a desk segment. (Think of the John Oliver jokes where he says "Dave keeps eating the peanut butter. Stop it, Dave!" You'll be Dave!)

Risks and Challenges

This is a pilot, so there's always an outside chance it's the only episode of the show, but our plan is to make this a regular thing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please spread the word around about this campaign! And once the videos are made, please share them!

story:
Texas and Alexis, have been in development since, early pandemic. Remember, Tiger King, toilet paper shortages - oh what a time to be inside. With everything going on, our producer, Alice Shy saw an opportunity to further expand the script from two episodes to six.

With the green light from the writer and creator, Reece Borden, the virtual writer's room was opened. 

In association with the New York Film Academy One Year Producing, the 2020 spring-producing cohort filmed an early version of the pilot. You can watch the spec trailer below. 

Through her production company, Ashy Production Studios, Alice brought on fifteen interns to assist with marketing, social media, public relations, and productions. They established social accounts, managed email marketing campaigns, and creating public relations strategies.  

View Our Show's Press Kit 

Now, we are ready to finance this project. The individuals mentioned above have graciously donated their talents and resources to bring this project to life.

  Season one of Texas & Alexis will consist of Six ten minutes episodes. It is a series about the rigor and beauty of friendship. The show pulls inspiration from Broad City. Visually, we aim for an Edgar Wright style with a campy, colorful aesthetic while building on classic comedy elements from Seinfeld to Schitt's Creek. 

Following production and post-production, We have the goals in mind
Plan A: Land a distribution deal with online streamer such as Facebook Watch, 
Plan B: Run the festival circuit; Win some awards ;)
Plan C: Stream exclusively on Ashy Patreon for subscribers

What does a boss Black lady business student have in common with a bombastic queer drama major? In the case of Texas and Alexis, history. As marginalized students in college, namely at a private white institution (PWI), these childhood best friends have come from the suburbs in search of success, glamour, and fun. So far, they’ve only found the latter. The specific challenges of being Black and/or queer in a PWI can create a rift between those who experience those identities and those who don’t.
Texas & Alexis examines this ravine, throwing its titular characters into situations that exaggerate, prod at, and pick apart the absurdities and hilarities of these gaps inexperience. New York City is a character itself. We see the city through the eyes of naive transplants whose only true notion of New York, comes from 90s sitcoms -- Man are they in for a rude awakening. With the help of some natives, will our characters earn their city legs or will they scamper back to the suburbs?

 

  • Adult vs. Childhood Friendship
  • First-time Sexual Experiences
  • Discovering your purpose as a young adult

 

We're a completely remote team based all across the continental United States who bonded over the love of comedy and the struggle of growing up. We are writers, directors, designers, and entrepreneurs. Check out the team.

 

  • Alice Shy - Producer & Founder of Ashy Production Studio LLC
  • Reece Borden - Head Writer/ Creator
  • Lexi Nicholas - Staff Writer 
  • Jake Wieners - Staff Writer
  • Joey Nicklas - Graphic Designer 
  • Darcy Glastonbury - Director 

 

 

Milton Mendez as Texas 

Reneé Harrison as Alexis 

Brendan Kane as Stuart

Giovanna Drummond as Pri

Benjamin Salerno as Omar III

Emma Maggie-Byers as Candy

Kaitlyn Lunardi  as Persephone 

Rom Romero as Omar Jr. 

 

So, what is in for you?  Besides the warm and fuzzy feeling, you will get from pledging to this project.  Each reward, will 

So, what is in for you? Besides the warm and fuzzy feeling, you will get from pledging to this project. Each reward, will 

$10 - Freshman 

  • Social Media Thank you
  • Name in Scrolling Credits 

$25 - Sophomore

  • Everything in Freshman plus the official show poster

$50 - Junior

  • Everything in the Sophomore plus access to the blooper reel. 

​$150 - Senior 

  • Everything in the Junior plus the Official Texas & Alexis T-Shirt.

$​500 - Super Senior 

  • Everything in the Senior plus an IMDB Credit and signed script 

$1,500- Magna Cum Laude

  • ​Everything in Super Senior plus Early Access to Episode 1

Filming for Texas and Alexis will commence  August 2021.  Indiegogo backers shall expect their awards by October 2021.  The first episode of Texas and Alexis is slated to premier January 2022.    

Filming for Texas and Alexis will commence in August 2021. Indiegogo backers shall expect their awards by October 2021. The first episode of Texas and Alexis is slated to premiere in January 2022.    

We do have a flexible goal that highlights our commitment to this project. Even if we don't achieve our full funding milestone we are committed to seeing this series completed. Why should you get involved now? 

Get If First: You believe in us from the start, so in return, you'll receive exclusive access to the season one premiere, first peek at show merchandise

Your Name in the Credits: Be a part of the journey. Join the ranks of other creatives with your name in the credits

Support Emerging Creatives: Your early support helped make this web series a success. By backing this campaign, the funds you pledge will help to make a visually captivating series that does justice to hilarious words on paper. 

Convinced? Choose your pledge level now!

We're going to keep it 100%. With any creative venture risks and challenges may occur during production. Our experience in development, producing, and the months of works already steeped into this project, means we are very confident in our ability to meet our backers' expectations -- However, sh--t happens.  


As we cannot predict the future, currently we are still in a pandemic, therefore the health and safety of our cast of crew will be the top priority. For this reason, production could be delayed in the case of illness. 

We have partnered with Swag.com for fulfillment for physical rewards (i.e apparel). We do not anticipate any delays in fulfillment. If delays occur, we will keep backers fully updated if the situation changes. 

Never used Indiegogo before? Do not worry we got you covered.  Just follow these three simple steps:

Step 1: Choose your reward level from those shown above and then select that reward in the sidebar to the right. Click the button that says "Get This Perk".

Step 2: Fill out your payment information.

Step 3: Click “Submit Payment” and get ready to join an incredible journey!

The project is accurately portrayed. However, creative projects are subject to evolve. By making a pledge you acknowledge that elements of the project may change, and the final project may differ from what is presented while the Indiegogo campaign is active.

story:
My name is Steve Alten and I am the NY Times and international best-selling author of 20 novels, including The MEG series which spawned the #1 movie in August of 2018, starring Jason Statham.

My new project - www.SeaMonsterCove.com has the potential to be a game-changer, offering a variety of unique entertainment experiences for visitors, including WHERE SEA MONSTERS ROAM, an original episodic web TV series I am writing featuring the most terrifying sea creatures ever to have existed There will also be an original video game based on that web series, visits to the two futuristic virtual facilities that house these critters (each visit a short story in and of itself), educational programs, and much more. Monthly members will run about the average cost of a movie ticket, and offer a PG-13 rating and PG-17/R for those who prefer a bit more realism.

Donations help off-set the costs of 3D animation, allowing us to hire the best talent, offering motion picture level effects.

story:
Downfall: A Spire Actual Play Campaign comes to you from a group of passionate TTRPG players with experience in multiple streamed games.

Downfall will be a weekly TTRPG actual play streamed from our GM's Twitch account on Fridays at 10pm GMT. We plan to begin our campaign in early April 2021 and run for 8 episodes.

In order to deliver a polished stream experience, we are looking to raise funds to pay our cast and commission quality visual assets.

Spire, The Game:

Spire is a TTRPG written by Grant Howitt and Christopher Taylor. It is a fantasy-punk RPG about rebellion, brutality and oppression. You can find out more about the game itself here.

We chose Spire as we believe it is the perfect vehicle to explore themes of class, revolution and hope in our story.

Artwork from Rowan, Rook and Decard is being used in this campaign with permission from Grant Howitt.

 

Downfall, The Story: 

Downfall will explore hopepunk ideas within the grimdark setting Spire provides, through the lens of class conflict. Our campaign will depict a city drowning under the literal constant deluge of condensation pouring down from the artificially frozen Aelfir estates above. 

We’ll see this world through the eyes of four Ministry agents as they are tasked with assassinating the descendant of the general who originally conquered Spire over 200 years ago. As the danger unfolds, they’ll quickly discover that there’s more to their assignment than they initially thought. 

 

The Cast:

Finn, the Gamemaster 

Having worked in retail in the TTRPG industry since 2017, Finn has an in-depth knowledge of the industry and community. With this knowledge, she launched her own freelance service as a trans sensitivity reader, and has worked on a variety of projects, including games by Ursidice and Nuno Teixeira. She is also a Twitch streamer, where she spends most of her time deconstructing the themes of Fallout: New Vegas to anyone who will listen. Finn’s pronouns are she/her. 

Finn will be the Gamemaster, and together with the players will create the world we will be exploring in Downfall.

 

Austin as Dredgen, the Bound

Austin has been playing TTRPGs since 2013, but only recently joined the streaming community in 2019. They've been playing in long form games and charity streams over the last year. Besides playing TTRPGs, they also write for them, with upcoming work including Brinkwood: Blood of Tyrants, and the first full TTRPG they are a co-creator on, Deimos Academy. Never wanting time to rest, they also the co-host on the podcast Secret Histories of Nerd Mysteries. Austin’s pronouns are he/they/she.

Austin will be playing Dredgen, the Bound. Dredgen is a vigilante doing her best to clean up the streets of Spire, hoping with the grime cleaned off the people may raise up and overthrow their oppressors.

 

Frank as Gyan, the Inksmith

Ten years ago, somebody asked Frank if they wanted to play a grumpy old man in a oneshot, and now here they are. Many grumpy old men later, they still refuse to GM but have a good amount of experience playing TTRPGs for streams and podcasts. More than that, Frank’s experience tends closer toward yelling about videogames on their Twitch channel, or working as a voice actor, their most known role being Basira Hussein in The Magnus Archives. Frank's pronouns are they/them.

Frank will be playing as Gyan, the Inksmith. Gyan isn’t a grumpy old man, but a cheerful young author, highly aware that stories have incredible power when told right.

 

Isa as Chroma, the Idol

Since being introduced to the TTRPG community in 2019, Isa has played in permanent and guesting roles on multiple TTRPG streams and podcasts, including No Initiative’s Quest: The Soaring City. She is also a cast member on the Asians Represent Critical Read: Al-Qadim podcast. As well as streaming TTRPGs, she is a cosplayer, artist, content creator and designer, and will be creating the character art for Downfall. Isa’s pronouns are she/her.

Isa will be playing Chroma, the Idol. Chroma is a rebellious and flamboyant street artist, who seeks to bring colour and beauty to the drab slums of Spire to inspire hope in others.

 

Nat as Z, the Azurite

A long-time TTRPG GM and player, both on and off stream, Nat is excited to play part of the crew in Downfall. They’re particularly proud to be The Guide for No Initiative’s Quest: The Soaring City, and loves enabling his co-players to energetic drama and bad decision making (in character). Nat’s also an autistic freelance writer, editor, and TTRPG game designer. Nat's pronouns are they/he.

Nat will be playing Z, the Azurite. A deal-maker and wielder of words, Z brandishes language as others would cutting blades to countervail his burdensome past mistakes.

 

Funding:

We plan to release Downfall regardless of the success of this campaign. But, we want to deliver the best quality stream that we can, as well as compensate everybody for their time and effort. 

To do this, we have drafted a budget to accommodate payment for each player, as well as to commission visual assets for the stream, such as overlays and character artwork. We feel this will allow us to be more ambitious with our story and produce a more visually appealing and professional final product.

We are currently aiming to raise £525 for the project, which broken down, will pay for: 

  • £250: To financially compensate the cast (Split to £50 each) 
  • £75: To commission an overlay from rredcloudss
  • £200: To commission character artwork from Isa

Any funds raised over our goal amount will go towards further financially compensating our cast.

We believe that with the money from this campaign goal, we can further enhance this project and deliver a dynamic story set in the world of Spire. We are incredibly excited to bring you Downfall: A Spire Actual Play Campaign very soon!
story_txt:
Downfall: A Spire Actual Play Campaign comes to you from a group of passionate TTRPG players with experience in multiple streamed games.
Downfall will be a weekly TTRPG actual play streamed from our GM's Twitch account on Fridays at 10pm GMT. We plan to begin our campaign in early April 2021 and run for 8 episodes.
In order to deliver a polished stream experience, we are looking to raise funds to pay our cast and commission quality visual assets.
Spire, The Game:

Spire is a TTRPG written by Grant Howitt and Christopher Taylor. It is a fantasy-punk RPG about rebellion, brutality and oppression. You can find out more about the game itself here.
We chose Spire as we believe it is the perfect vehicle to explore themes of class, revolution and hope in our story.
Artwork from Rowan, Rook and Decard is being used in this campaign with permission from Grant Howitt.

story:
I’m happy you’re here! We’re shooting some fun stuff and want you to be a part of it. Here's a little about the two projects we're currently making.

A Mini Web Series: "Pregnant"

"Pregnant" is a slice of life comedy about a Connecticut dwelling toddler Mom who's far from Pinterest perfect. Pregnant Val encounters glamorous Manhattan Moms, an aloof husband, small town advice givers, and her worst enemy, her own reflection. Against her will, Val occasionally socializes in Manhattan where it’s painfully obvious she’s a fish out of water due to her lack of poise and up to the minute mommy style. Armed only with her sharp wit and purse full of chicken nuggets Val takes on the everyday challenges of pregnancy and the big city. Since it's a mini series we're creating 4 episodes total, each episode is 2 to 4 minutes long. The idea is to make something short and sweet for people, especially Moms, to enjoy. If you're lucky you can "go to the bathroom" and catch a entire episode without a single soul disturbing you... maybe.

Jon Byron is slated to direct three episodes of Pregnant in LA. Kristen directed one episode this past week in Central Park before she moves to LA, where the three remaining episodes will be filmed.

Parody Music Video: "Oops I'm Pregnant Again"

 
If you've never seen this music video  STOP READING THIS  and *immediately watch the video posted above.*  You won't regret this decision. Though Britney is pure perfection we're excited to bring you the "pregnant" version of this song. What we may lack in production grandeur we'll be sure to make up for in humor. Just to confirm your biggest question... Kristen will, I repeat, WILL  be dawning a full body  jumpsuit while 6 months pregnant. 
 
Thanks to the generosity of the Communication Division at Pepperdine University, we'll be filming this in studio in only a few short weeks. Kristen and her brother Chris DellaPace are co-directing this music video together. 
 
$ Monies $
You see the really boring pie chart below? That explains our money allotment of the $6,000 we hope to raise! Though no one's getting rich here it would be so nice to pay people a little somethin' for their hard work. We have zero issues eating Dominos pizza every meal on set and finding props at the Dollar Tree but the little bits here and there add up and become surprisingly expensive. Then come the heavy hitters in cost such as locations, costumes (hello 6-8 pregnancy belly costumes) and post production editing. Your contribution absolutely makes a difference as to how well and how effortlessly these projects get created, so THANK YOU for your support!
 


 
But Y Tho? 
I (Kristen) was inspired to create these projects because being pregnant is hilarious and there isn’t enough funny material on the subject, at least not enough material created by a woman who’s gone through it first hand. Comedy has always brought me such joy; I hope these projects bring a little happiness into your world.
 
Thank you for taking the time to see what we're up to. Speaking on behalf of the cast and crew we would LOVE your support and contribution. Take a gander at the perks (over to the right) you get when you give. Aren't they enticing? Our personal favorite is "The Gender Reveal"! What's Yours?
 
Kristen & Jess 
#pregnantthewebseries

story:
The Story of SLEEPING ELEPHANT

HEY!!

It's Patrick Weiers, Ryan Kilbourne, and Aaron Sharif...thank you for visiting our page! 

We're emerging filmmakers from Toronto who have a passion for film and an ambition to make our mark on the industry. SLEEPING ELEPHANT was conceived in March of 2017 out of a need to explore the recent political divergence between Canada and America. We quickly decided that if we were going to produce a large project, it had to be unique. We conceived a found footage aesthetic which would infuse Instagram "stories" to add an extremely tangible aesthetic while commenting on the increasing popularity of social media content. 

So in September of 2017 , the three of us embarked on a road trip through America and shot on real locations over 23 days. While there was a script (and we scouted locations on Google Maps), we capitalized on any interesting locations and unique people we encountered. We mixed our spontaneous improvisation with subtextual scripted conversations to create an incredibly unique aesthetic. 

Since completing production in early October, 2017, we've been balancing our day jobs with editing the series and we've finally been able to have a picture-locked cut with our composers' music. Although we're embracing a raw and "user-generated" aesthetic, we need to improve the technical quality of the series in order to maximize the audience's engagement. We don't want the visual, and especially the audio quality, to distract the audience from the thematic impact of the series so we're asking you to help us make this project the best it can be! 

 

Breaking Down the Finance 

We're asking for $7,000 CAD: 

  • $2,500 CAD for Sound Edit and Sound Mix
    • Sound Editing includes making the dialogue more audible, eliminating unwanted sounds, and adding new sound effects to create a more detailed and crisp sound to the series. 
    • Sound Mixing includes balancing the levels of the dialogue, sound effects, and music to create a more dynamic sonic environment. 
  • $2,000 CAD for Composers
    • We have connected with a pair of Composers who have worked on a variety of projects. They will help emphasize dramatic cues while complementing the emotions of the series. 
  • $1,500 CAD for Colour Correction
    • Colour Correction is the process of making the images more dynamic by adding contrast and enriching certain colours to emphasize particular thematic tones. The stylization of the images also helps distinguish between different geographical regions along the road trip.  
  • $1,000 CAD for Graphic Designer
    • Our Graphic Designer will improve the realism of our multimedia aesthetic by further developing the overlays for our Instagram and Skype Sequences. They'll also create a custom font and design the subtitles and credits. 

 

We've connected with some really talented collaborators, and after seeing a rough cut of our series, they've agreed to work at discounted rates. Why don't they just work for free? Well...on top of software and hardware costs, our team are professionals who do their respected jobs to pay the bills! The fees listed above are just enough to keep the lights on! Our team is passionate about independent productions and they all believe SLEEPING ELEPHANT can break through the noise and have a genuine impact on independent cinema. 

While most campaigns have tangible perks, we decided to take a different approach and offer some services and opportunities. As emerging filmmakers, we don't have much money but we do have a developed skillset that we can offer! Two of our marquee perks are Photography and Videography Services (of your choosing) done by the filmmakers. We have plans for SLEEPING ELEPHANT to be released around the world and you have a chance to be in it! Finally, if you want to launch your career in the media industry you have a chance to become an Executive Producer. 

 

Why Do We Need The Money? 

Our main motivation to produce SLEEPING ELEPHANT was to make something unique and prove to the world that you don't need a million dollars to make engaging and impactful content...and we succeeded! We've gotten some great feedback from our test screenings, but in order to present the series in a more formal setting we need to make the series more technically pristine. As much as festivals and film-lovers celebrate micro-budget independent filmmaking, it's necessary to perform colour correction, sound editing, and sound mixing in order to minimize the audience's distraction by the technical shortcomings.

While we want to keep a raw and "user-generated" aesthetic, making the series more watchable will make the characters more engaging and the subtext more impactful. On top of our sound and colour collaborators, working with our composers' original music will also heighten the emotion of the series and solidify it as a genuine independent and original piece of cinema! 

 

The Team 

Patrick Weiers - Writer/Producer/Director/Actor

PATRICK WEIERS is a Toronto-based artist and filmmaker. A graduate from Queen’s University Film School, Patrick is on a determined path to creative innovative and inspiring works. His short films have screened at a handful of festivals across Canada including the Kingston Canadian Film Festival and the Willson Oakville Film Festival. He’s continuously on the hunt to explore contemporary consumption patterns while expanding the aesthetics of cinema.

 

Ryan Kilbourne - Writer/Producer/Director/Actor 

Ryan Kilbourne is a Toronto-based writer, photographer and filmmaker. He graduated with distinction from Concordia University's Mel Hoppenheim School of Cinema in 2016. He loves long nature walks with his 60lb Kelpie mix.  Ryan hopes you'll enjoy SLEEPING ELEPHANT-- he had a fun time making it. 

 

Aaron Sharif - Writer/Actor 

Hi! I'm Aaron. I've been around for 22 years, I have seen and experienced so much of life but haven't even skimmed the surface of it all. I hope to continue growing my knowledge base and meeting new people until there's nothing left to learn and no one left to meet. Can you tell I'm an optimist? Cheers!

 

Rebeka Herron - Producer 


Rebeka Herron is an alumna of Capilano University’s Motion Picture Program and the Cineplex Entertainment Film Program Producers’ Lab at the Canadian Film Centre. Currently Rebeka works in development for Taqqut Productions, an Inuit based production company specializing in animation and children’s content. Recent projects include the award winning short film The Undertaker’s Son (2017), Lucas (2017), and VR Wonders of the World (2017).

 

Chantel McDonald - Actress 

Chantel is an actor and playwright born and raised in Toronto. Select film credits include her role as Rose in the short QUEENS OF HEARTS, which premiered at the 2018 Inside Out festival, Chris Power’s feature film, BLOODSLINGER, and her appearance in Kazik Radwanski’s feature film TOWER. Select theatre credits include: Tracey in Bob Del Rio’s PROFESSIONALLY EHTNIC at Summerworks '17, narrating a staged reading of Trey Anthony’s BLACK MOTHERS DON'T SAY I LOVE YOU (retitled) for bcurrent’s Rock.Paper.Sistahz festival, and Agnes in Orphaned Egret’s production of SHE KILLS MONSTERS. 

 

Christine Nguyen - Actress 

Christine is an Asian-Canadian Actor based in Toronto. She is a graduate at the Ryerson Theatre School’s Acting program. Christine practices martial arts. She’s trained in wushu and has recently competed in the Ontario Winter Games. She also runs long distance and hopes to run the Boston Marathon in the future. Credits include: Aaron Jan’s Swan, Exed Out, Apartment 13, Absolute Anger, Breath Anew and CBC’s Four In The Morning.

 

Bryce Mitchell and Keegan Jessamy - Composers

Based in Toronto, Canada, Keegan and Bryce have been composing music for film, television and visual media since 1999. Together they have worked on countless short films and notable feature films, such as AT HOME BY MYSELF WITH YOU, for which they received a Genie Nomination, as well as the recent ORDINARY DAYS and BECOMING BURLESQUE. In 2016 Keegan and Bryce scored the music for the Netflix Original sci-fi feature ARQ. 

 

Ryan Wibowo - Sound Editor/Sound Mixer 

Ryan is a sound designer and engineer in Toronto. Originally from Jakarta, Indonesia, Ryan moved to Toronto in 2013 to pursue his education in film. Ryan graduated with honours from Humber College's Bachelor of Film and Media Production and has been pursuing his love for sound in film ever since. He tackles all kinds of projects including scripted dramas, documentaries, and reality.

 

What Are We Working Towards? 

Every production’s two enemies are TIME and MONEY.....and SLEEPING ELEPHANT is no exception. Right now we need to finance post-production and we're chasing a deadline.

It was a huge personal risk making this series. We turned down jobs, paid out of pocket, and worked thousands of hours for no immediate return. We did it because we love the medium and we’re passionate about our unique approach to filmmaking. We don't want to see our time and money go to waste and we're reaching out to you hoping that you cannot only help us achieve our goal, but be a part of a new age of independent cinema! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help! 

While we would appreciate whatever financial contribution you can make, any public or private sharing of our series would be amazing! Whether it’s sharing one of our pages with your friends or just spreading the series word-of-mouth, any type of discussion is welcomed. We’re confident that the further our series reaches, the more awareness we can bring to independent Canadian cinema!

Hi! I'm Aaron. I've been around for 22 years, I have seen and experienced so much of life but haven't even skimmed the surface of it all. I hope to continue growing my knowledge base and meeting new people until there's nothing left to learn and no one left to meet. Can you tell I'm an optimist? Cheers!
 
Rebeka Herron - Producer 

Rebeka Herron is an alumna of Capilano University’s Motion Picture Program and the Cineplex Entertainment Film Program Producers’ Lab at the Canadian Film Centre. Currently Rebeka works in development for Taqqut Productions, an Inuit based production company specializing in animation and children’s content. Recent projects include the award winning short film The Undertaker’s Son (2017), Lucas (2017), and VR Wonders of the World (2017).
 
Chantel McDonald - Actress 

Chantel is an actor and playwright born and raised in Toronto. Select film credits include her role as Rose in the short QUEENS OF HEARTS, which premiered at the 2018 Inside Out festival, Chris Power’s feature film, BLOODSLINGER, and her appearance in Kazik Radwanski’s feature film TOWER. Select theatre credits include: Tracey in Bob Del Rio’s PROFESSIONALLY EHTNIC at Summerworks '17, narrating a staged reading of Trey Anthony’s BLACK MOTHERS DON'T SAY I LOVE YOU (retitled) for bcurrent’s Rock.Paper.Sistahz festival, and Agnes in Orphaned Egret’s production of SHE KILLS MONSTERS. 
 
Christine Nguyen - Actress 

Christine is an Asian-Canadian Actor based in Toronto. She is a graduate at the Ryerson Theatre School’s Acting program. Christine practices martial arts. She’s trained in wushu and has recently competed in the Ontario Winter Games. She also runs long distance and hopes to run the Boston Marathon in the future. Credits include: Aaron Jan’s Swan, Exed Out, Apartment 13, Absolute Anger, Breath Anew and CBC’s Four In The Morning.
 
Bryce Mitchell and Keegan Jessamy - Composers

Based in Toronto, Canada, Keegan and Bryce have been composing music for film, television and visual media since 1999. Together they have worked on countless short films and notable feature films, such as AT HOME BY MYSELF WITH YOU, for which they received a Genie Nomination, as well as the recent ORDINARY DAYS and BECOMING BURLESQUE. In 2016 Keegan and Bryce scored the music for the Netflix Original sci-fi feature ARQ. 
 
Ryan Wibowo - Sound Editor/Sound Mixer 

Ryan is a sound designer and engineer in Toronto. Originally from Jakarta, Indonesia, Ryan moved to Toronto in 2013 to pursue his education in film. Ryan graduated with honours from Humber College's Bachelor of Film and Media Production and has been pursuing his love for sound in film ever since. He tackles all kinds of projects including scripted dramas, documentaries, and reality.
 
What Are We Working Towards? 
Every production’s two enemies are TIME and MONEY.....and SLEEPING ELEPHANT is no exception. Right now we need to finance post-production and we're chasing a deadline.
It was a huge personal risk making this series. We turned down jobs, paid out of pocket, and worked thousands of hours for no immediate return. We did it because we love the medium and we’re passionate about our unique approach to filmmaking. We don't want to see our time and money go to waste and we're reaching out to you hoping that you cannot only help us achieve our goal, but be a part of a new age of independent cinema! 

 
Other Ways You Can Help! 
While we would appreciate whatever financial contribution you can make, any public or private sharing of our series would be amazing! Whether it’s sharing one of our pages with your friends or just spreading the series word-of-mouth, any type of discussion is welcomed. We’re confident that the further our series reaches, the more awareness we can bring to independent Canadian cinema!

story:
The Universal Language 

"Experience the beauty of dance and culture through a life changing immersive journey around the world"

 

Story:

The Universal Language is a global dance documentary showcasing dance culture, authentic human interaction, through the journey of our talented host Rebecca Reinhart  through improv and no scripted lines. Dance has been recently gaining momentum in popular culture and our goal is to showcase the initiation/creation behind many styles.

Acknowledging the changes in the world and how people are living from COVID-19 outbreak, we wish to share the excitement of each encounter with the viewers as if they were experiencing it first hand by blending film production and new media. 

Because we want you to be part of this incredible journey we will offer the added benefit of Virtual Reality (VR). You will have the option of discovering an extended version of the pilot and to explore landscapes, cultural dances and rituals of Alberta and the Tsuu T’ina & Cree Nation as if you were there!  This will also give you the opportunity to learn the choreography. 

This doc-series will  respectfully share the history of various dance practices educating the audience on the meaning and joy behind such artforms showing the depth and hard work behind each genre and their secrets. 

 

Let’s celebrate life together through dance. We cannot wait to bring this onto your screens!! 

 

 

Alberta : the home of Tsuu T’ina & Cree Nations 

Alberta is a multifaceted landscape in western Canada that is home to the rocky mountains, large prairie skies, desert lands, ice fields and large coniferous forests. Alberta hosts many opportunities for bonding with nature. Whether it's white water rafting, ice climbing, or canoeing through a peaceful lake, it is a dream location for any adventure seeker.

Home to the  Beaver, Blackfoot, Chipewyan, Cree, Tsuu T'ina, Saulteaux, Slavey and Nakoda nations, these are a few of the indigenous communities that are a part of the backbone to Alberta's wild landscape. We will have the pleasure to film with Tsuu T’ina & Cree Nations and bring this amazing experience to you! 

 

Estimated Budget:

With this Kickstarter campaign, we are hoping to cover some of the pre-production costs to film our Pilot episode in Canada. Members of the crew have been putting their own savings into this passion project. A stretch goal would be to cover all production costs, after all fees, shipping, and merchandise costs.Here are estimated costs, and it's break down, based on our current  $30,000 goal.

 

Why do we need your help? 

The Universal Language is moving towards signing with Netflix, BBC or some broadcaster of the sort, so we definitely need your help!

We plan to change the world through art and love. Traveling the world, covid safety first in our minds, we cannot wait to visit all the numerous cultures and their foundations in movement. Whether it’s a deeply integrated ritual to bring on rain, or a lively celebration in the streets, we want to share this with you, AND here’s how you can help us...

 

Travel: Shipping our amazing team from Toronto to Calgary and safely! 

 

We have carefully selected specific members for their specific talents from across Canada. We need our incredible team in Calgary to shoot with the Tsuu T’ina & Cree Nation for the Pilot episode. 

 

Multiple Perspectives: With plans to shoot two perspectives, Virtual Reality (VR) and Film. The equipment needs to be shipped or rented, to bring out vision to life.

 

Dues: Paying the respective communities for their time will be essential. Not only compensating others for their time, we need to pay our superbly talented crew members!! (Our DP, VR specialist, need to be paid for their time and dedication)

 

Food: Let’s eat. And let’s eat properly!  We want to provide our crew and talent with food that will keep them healthy, happy and ALWAYS prioritize local food suppliers !! 

 

Sanitization & Covid Safety: On top of regular film duties, we are going to need to ensure our set is clean and up to the covid safety standards. We are following all the guidelines to keep everyone safe. 

 

Goodness, the wildest and most beautiful thing about film is all the amazing talent it involves. One episode takes an army of amazing souls, so ANY and ALL donations help!

 

We truly wish to have you be a part of the journey. We will keep you posted !! 

 


 

Rewards:

$10 - You will receive a personal tagged mention on our instagram story! PLUS a digital film poster!

$20 - You will receive a personalized video mention from Rebecca on our instagram! (our creator and HOST!)  PLUS a digital 'The Universal Language' Film Poster signed by the crew AND a soundtrack download. 

$50 - You will receive a special thanks in the film credit + video call from set with Rebecca - LIMITED. You will also get a personalized video mention on our instagram (from @rebeccareinhart  - our creator and HOST!) + our soundtrack download and our digital film poster!

$100 - You will receive a video DANCE CLASS with Rebecca - LIMITED. PLUS a personalized video mentioning you on our instagram @universallanguage (from Rebecca Reinhart  - our creator and HOST!) PLUS a digital 'The Universal Language' Film Poster  signed by the crew + a download of our soundtrack and a digital film poster!

$500 - Your name will be placed in our special thank you credits! Plus we will send out a HUGE personalized thank you on social media (from the host Rebecca Reinhart!) PLUS a video-class - LIMITED. AND digital rewards: Pilot Teaser download, Soundtrack download, Digital Film Poster  signed by the crew , Behind the scenes videos!

 

The Crew:

Host and Co-Director: Rebecca Reinhart

She is the HOST and CO-DIRECTOR of The universal Language, and works professionally in the industry as an actor, dancer, director and choreographer. Her choreography can be seen in award winning musicals (Broadway World) and huge-hit music videos (Alx Veliz, Gord Bamford, Paper Lions, Lights, Classified, Warren G, Lindsay Kay and Featurette).  Rebecca Reinhart cares deeply for humankind, art  expression, and extensive experience as a choreographer making her the perfect host for this series. 

@rebeccareinhart

 

 

Co-Director: Elisa Werneck 

The CO-DIRECTOR of the doc-series wants to show some empathy to the world through her work. Originally from Brazil, Elisa Werneck lives in Toronto, Canada. With extensive experience in Cinematography, Directing, TV Production and working on Tier A sets. Through this ambitious documentary series, she wants to raise awareness and explore dance, cinematography and art in an immersive and unique way. 

@_elisewerneck

 

 

Production Manager: Katharina Benjamim 

The Production Manager cares deeply about art forms and how they communicate cultural aspects in a universal way. Born in Brazil, and experiencing cultural rituals at her home-country, she has specialized in historical costumes and cultural studies, in her studies at the University of Arts London, bringing essential knowledge to the production. 

@kath.benjamim 

 

 

Executive Production: West & Social 

The Executive Producer  is a Toronto based, boutique ad agency, specializing in the creation of high concept visual advertising with festival appearances around the world, commercially distributed feature films, and multiple awards including the Irving Avrich Emerging Filmmaker Award at the Toronto International Film Festival.

Run by Dan & Adam, they are working with startups and entrepreneurs, charities and causes, focused on collaborating with other businesses with the goal of improving the world around them. 

@west_and_social

 

 

 Risks and challenges:

Timelines in the film require multiple talented members to make the magic happen. Our current funding goal helps us to gather the necessary resources to bring to life the PILOT episode of The Universal Language in a breathtakingly immersive experience never seen before!

Please keep in mind that funding distribution may be relocated, to meet Covid-19 requirements and guidelines.

Thank you for the support, our team can't wait to show you the final result!
