story:
Betting Big is a talk show focusing on tech investors, their experiences, and their advice for entrepreneurs looking for funding. Hosted by the no-nonsense business journalist Bonnie Halper, every show reveals more about the world of angel investing and venture capital from the point of view of one of its key players. From the mouth of each investor, you’ll hear about their biggest wins, most painful losses, and their best advice on how to get funded.

To many entrepreneurs looking for funding, the world of venture capital and angel investing is a big mystery. Sure, you can read hundreds of blogposts about how to structure your pitch or design your team, but it’s nothing like having a conversation with those who could fund your dreams. That’s where Betting Big comes in. We give founders access by interviewing high-profile tech investors from different ethnic, gender, and industry backgrounds, and then we broadcast those conversations for everyone to see. What’s more, at the end of each show, we’ll give our studio audience of entrepreneurs a chance to get their questions answered.

The final product will be distributed across different television and streaming platforms. 

From the host, to the folks behind the camera, to our startup incubator partner, we’ve assembled a fantastic team to make this show special.

Bonnie Halper - Show Host

Bonnie Halper is a well-known voice in the tech startup world. A respected, no-nonsense writer, commentator, and industry expert, she has been quoted in the Wall Street Journal, Reuters, MarketWatch, San Jose Mercury News and Time Magazine. With degrees from Columbia and Oxford, Bonnie mentors at three of the world’s top accelerators: Entrepreneurs Roundtable, DreamIt, and Founder Institute NY.

 

Joanes Prosper - Executive Producer

Joanes Prosper is an award-winning producer with over 17 years of experience in both film and TV. He is the CEO and Creative Director of Prosper Digital, a full-service video production and marketing company in Brooklyn. In addition to his career in the creative arts, Joanes has a business and finance background and has consulted for Wall Street firms such as Goldman Sachs, J.P. Morgan Chase, and Credit Suisse in the areas of credit and equity derivatives. Joanes has a BA in Marketing with a concentration in Finance and Drama from Penn State. 


Randall Dottin - Director

Randall Dottin is award-winning director whose work has played in several festivals around the world. His MFA thesis film, A-Alike, was licensed for a two-year broadcast run by HBO and won numerous awards including the Gold Medal at the Student Academy Awards for Best Narrative Film. Randall was named by INDIEWIRE Magazine as one of the Top Ten New Voices in Black Cinema. He received his undergraduate in Film from Dartmouth College and his MFA in Film Directing at the Columbia University.


Caroline Mariko Stucky - Cinematographer 

Caroline Mariko Stucky started her film career in Hamburg, Germany -- where she perfected her technical skills and learned the tools of the trade. Her work has been selected in over 50 international film festivals. Some of her credits as a Director of Photography (DP) includes The Perfect Bunny (2013), Upside Down (2014), Hemingway’s Homage to Switzerland (2015), Butterfly (2016), Wishful Whiskers (2016), and Good Grief aka Starfish (2016).

 

Keith Saunders - Marketing Consultant

Keith helps companies acquire new customers through a blend of marketing strategy, copywriting, and creative direction. For his clients, he creates marketing plans, website copy, blogposts, social media content, video scripts, and other promotional materials. Some of the companies he’s had the pleasure of working with: Nissan, Gillette, VH1, TBS, Fox Sports Net, Smirnoff, Lowe’s, and Reebok. Website: keithjsaunders.com

We're extremely excited to film this project at the Zahn Innovation Center, a startup incubator and coworking space located at the City College of New York. It offers an array of resources to entrepreneurs, including: annual competitions, a startup bootcamp, mentorship and pro-bono services, networking opportunities, and rapid prototyping facilities. The Center's mission: to create a community of changemakers who dream, design, and develop ideas that can impact the world.

We'll shoot the show in front of a live audience as a way to bring more energy and to give entrepreneurs a chance to get their questions answered by an investor. 

Find out more about the Zahn Innovation Center here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0kgo5dack0

Producing a quality show isn’t cheap. But even without money, our team has developed the show format, secured an amazing space to shoot the episodes, and assembled a diverse list of investor heavyweights to deliver the goods. Now, we’re at a crucial point in our development: we need to hire a crew, build a set, and do all the wonderful things necessary to finish the job.

So, we'd love to have your contribution to the campaign. 

 

On the right side of the page, we've created a list of great perks to show our thanks and appreciation. Every little bit helps. 

For those interested in becoming a sponsor of the show, we'd like to explain the opportunity in more detail.

As an episode sponsor, you'll be able to feature your logo and company at the top of the opening and closing of one of the twelve episodes of the show. “This show is sponsored by” titling and voice-over narration will be provided.

Promotion will also be provided on the Betting Big website in a special sponsor section underneath the video window. The description will highlight the sponsor and the appropriate call-to-action.

Additional sponsorship mentions will be provided on social media channels (Linkedin, Youtube, Facebook, Twitter, and Reddit) during the week of the release of that episode. Credit will also be provided on local cable access and NYC Media in the rolling credits at the end of the show.

Lastly, special recognition will be provided at the show’s premiere with an opportunity to do a two-minute presentation on yourself or your company. As a sponsor, you will receive 3 tickets for the event, as well as mentions on signage and publicity material. 

 

THANK YOU!

If you've made a contribution, awesome! Please consider sharing our page link with your friends to help us reach more people - https://igg.me/at/bettingbig

If you know a startup business or entrepreneur who could benefit from our show, wonderful. Please share the campaign link with them (https://igg.me/at/bettingbig) and let them know about the perks that we are offering for their support.  

Lastly, if you know someone in the press or media (maybe that's you :)) who might want to help us spread the news, amazing. Have them contact our executive producer Joanes Prosper at joanes@prosperdigital.tv. We have some upcoming engagements, but can use as much support as possible to get the word out.

story:
Bring us back to TV and the internet for all new shows!

Nightmare Theatre has been a Gulf Coast fixture for 15 years, both on TV and at our live events. Recently, we've been handed the keys to a full digital studio with three HD cameras, lights, etc. and free reign to shoot when and what we want! This also includes a primetime spot on a Cox HD channel starting in January 2018! We also want to bring the show back online!

What We Need!

We're seeking to raise $5,000 to cover our expenses - building a new set, hiring a professional crew, licensing films to air, closed captioning, etc. As always, this isn't a money-making thing for us - we've always done this out of our love of performing and of classic b-movies. Every bit of money will go right back into Nightmare Theatre!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let everyone know about our campaign! Share on social media and tell your friends!
story_txt:
Bring us back to TV and the internet for all new shows!
Nightmare Theatre has been a Gulf Coast fixture for 15 years, both on TV and at our live events. Recently, we've been handed the keys to a full digital studio with three HD cameras, lights, etc. and free reign to shoot when and what we want! This also includes a primetime spot on a Cox HD channel starting in January 2018! We also want to bring the show back online!

What We Need!
We're seeking to raise $5,000 to cover our expenses - building a new set, hiring a professional crew, licensing films to air, closed captioning, etc. As always, this isn't a money-making thing for us - we've always done this out of our love of performing and of classic b-movies. Every bit of money will go right back into Nightmare Theatre!
Other Ways You Can HelpPlease let everyone know about our campaign! Share on social media and tell your friends!

story:
Do keep up-to-date with the latest about our project by clicking on the UPDATES tab above. We will be posting casting news and any other project developments as they occur.

 

We are independent filmmakers who have previously worked on numerous short films together, and have been screened at festivals across the world – including the Cannes Film Festival’s ‘Short Film Corner’, The Pinewood Studios Short Film Showcase, BFI Film Festival Competition, LA's The Independent Shorts Awards, and many more (we're a big hit in Venezuela! Not sure why...). 

In 2017 we shot the pilot episode for a series on Amazon Prime called 'Superclaims' – the series was well received and even promoted by Amazon during their Black Friday sales, the biggest sales event of the year! The pilot episode is still available for viewing on Prime, and we will be using Prime as one of our distributors, though with the scope of this series we are also negotiating with other big networks.

 

The core team is...
Govind "Guv" Chandran (Director & Series Co-Creator) and Jamie "My name isn't Chris" Laxton (Cinematographer & Series Co-Creator). They are joined by Joshua "JTD " Taylor-Davies (Producer) and Conor "Protein" Tychowski (Production Manager). Previous collaborations have yielded very positive responses, including the last two short films which have been featured at over fifteen festivals since January 2019.

Storytellers (2019)

THE CAST

 

Having survived 'The Apocalypse,' Larkin lives a solitary life in his derelict home, called Paradise. Being on his own for such a long time and rarely needing anything that isn’t too far from his dwelling, Larkin lives an odd and.... naturist lifestyle. His world is set to drastically change (as if the apocalypse wasn't enough) when two survivors – Kat and Stan – stumble upon Larkin's home. Relieved at no longer being by himself however, Larkin invites the pair to stay with him.

Whilst struggling to get accustomed to living with each other, the group are then attacked by a bunch of marauders who have been tracking Kat and Stan. Despite having the upper hand on the survivors, one of the marauders – Alex – ends up betraying her tribe (they were dicks tbf) in order to join this new ‘community' in Paradise. Todd, a ‘writer’ who had been taken prisoner by the marauders also decides to join.

Season One of 'How To Dress For The Apocalypse' follows Larkin’s efforts to acclimatize to sharing his home with his new tenants, all whilst trying to turn them into a community that are greater than the sum of their individual parts. Through many missteps and misadventures, the group try learning to live and coexist with one another, in order to survive.

Each episode focuses on an entry in the guidebook of ‘How To Dress For the Apocalypse' - narrated to us, the audience, through the stories of Larkin’s community - acting as a parable for the subsequent entry.

All the episodes of the series end with a post-credit advertisement for ‘Layton’s Miracle Skin Care Cream’ - of which the relevance becomes clearer as the series progresses.

The series will pay homage to classic post-apocalyptic senarios as well as modern pop-culture and draws inspiration from shows such as Community, Final Space, Rick and Morty and many more.

 

 

So, we need your support to start our journey by helping to fund our pilot episode. We have already sourced support for cinema grade filming equipment (cameras, lights, cocaine*, etc) along with our post production costs. Your amazingly generous support will help provide us with: 

  • ◙  Location Costs

  • ◙  Food and Water for Set (essential for apocalyptic survival)

  • ◙  Props

  • ◙  Prosthetics

  • ◙  Expenses

  • ◙  Mannequins

  • ◙  Beans

  • ◙  Hair & Make-Up

  • ◙  More Mannequins

  • ◙  More Beans!

*This is a joke. There is no cocaine. Or is there. No. There isn't.

 

 

The Rewards! Ah, yes! We thought long and hard about what we would have liked as funders and came up with some great ideas that you can see to your right! For every tier you go up, you get the tiers that come before. Ranging from a simple thank you on the HTD4TA website, to having your name etched on to a prop on set, or even having your name as one of the marauder characters!! Hot damn, does that not sound pretty decent. 

 

 

And that's it! That's us and that's the project! We can't thank you enough for reading through our IndieGoGo page and providing any support that you are able to give.  A lot of hard work and effort has gone into getting things to where they are - and we've got some amazing plans for where things can (and are!) going to go! Every bit of support really does bring a sense of community in the shared love of sitcoms and post-apocalyptic insanity! 

So, from all the cast and crew - Thank You.

story:
I'm Kyle Mackesey. I'm a jack of many trades and a proud Massachusetts Townie. For the past seven plus years I have been learning the craft of building hand- puppets along with writing comedy, building sets, drawing, lighting, video and audio work. Now that I have assembled a quorum for performance production I am ready to bring my puppet, Townie, comedy webseries: Sonkhonkett, to the wider world. This fictional town lies where the Rumney Marsh takes up Boston's North Shore towns of Revere and Saugus. The webseries aims to capture the local persona of the region, the Townie. Being one myself, we are a unique people that I feel is either overlooked or misrepresented in popular culture. For me there is no better way to parlay information than humor. I meticulous sculpt and gather jokes and comedic structures I feel capture the Massachusetts style of comedy. The show is ADULT (Not for children), ball-busting and fearless but done out of great love for the land that has shaped my ways and spirit.

Many hours, days, weeks, months and years has been invested into this town I call Sonkhonkett. Laying out every street of the town which you can check out at http://www.sonkhonkett.com/  and https://www.facebook.com/sonkhonkett/ , researching North Shore history and creating the town's own lineage, building sets and figuring out how to film has pushed this project to it's next evolution. There are shorts on Youtube, https://www.youtube.com/user/skaskaskadank/videos , called "Sonkhonkett Samplers" that introduce the viewer to the world of this town.  They start out with limited production value but as time progressed over these past 4 years we have a DSLR camera, a variety of sets and props, better audio and better lighting.

We hosted two fundraisers in the last  two years where we reached on average 180% of our target goal. The first fundraiser funded the people and equipment to make the Sonking Pilot Episode and the second just went towards paying the performers, artists, craftsmen and laborers. This year we are continuing to have 90% of the funds allocated to all the people that make Sonkhonkett possible.

Sonkhonkett is about fun anthropology in a Squidbillies / Trailer Park Boys sort of manner but Sonkhonkett is more than that. I can't do Sonkhonkett without collaboration. My collaborators come from a variety of backgrounds and they kill at what they do. I want Sonkhonkett to become a production company that pays people for what they are worth. I, like many others who "Sonk The Honk" are artists and more often than not our work is rarely paid appropriately or even at all. Artists are skilled, passionate folk that deserve better. But this also applies to all workers. As the cost of living goes up and wages either stagnate or decrease many people struggle to survive and live a happy life. This production will not just need puppeteers, videographers, painters, sculptors but accountants, janitors, marketing folk, software engineers and you name it. We would like this $800 to act as an investment to forward us in the direction of creating a company that is fair to its workers. A company that will stay local to portray what is local because we got what no other state has got. GO MASSACHUSETTS!

story:
Summary

 Red is a small town, Bryan County Oklahoma girl, looking for a guy who can make her feel something big! Since meeting men the traditional way isn’t working, she’s turning to her community, and the internet, to help her land the biggest catch in the Red River- the man of her dreams!

Distribution channel: YouTube

Location: Bryan County Oklahoma and surrounding areas

Episodes: 14 thirty minute episodes

Why is this show different than other dating shows:
Romancin On the Red is about small town life and small town romance.

There are no 20 year old supermodels, no big city investment bankers, no helicopter rides to Hawaii.

This is real life, and real love. This is fishing in the dark, horse rides, and calf fries.

This is a small town single mom looking for love and romance on the Red River.

What We Need & What You Get

People are already excited about this show, and we get inquiries every hour asking when we are going to start shooting, but we need YOUR assistance to get started!

We are asking for $5000 to begin our project.  We are offering the following incentives for your contribution:

Any donation amount - Thank you shout out on twitter

$50 - Thank you shout out on twitter and instagram

$100 - Series sponsor credit on social media (1 time) and in end credits (1 episode)

$400 - Series sponsor credit on social media (3 posts) and in end credits (every episode)

$1000 - Co-Producer credit on social media and in end credits of each episode   (Only 3 available)

 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

Your donations will help purchase:

  • sound and video equipment
  • items for elimination competitions
  • advertising costs
  • wardrobe & makeup (as needed - most is provided by contestants)
  • transportation expense (gas, etc) to get to locations
  • necessary permits and licensing
  • location fees
  • editing costs
  • attorney and legal expenses
  • other unexpected and associated expenses

Risks & Challenges

With every venture, there are potential challenges, but we are prepared to overcome them.  Everyone on our team is new to the idea of producing a webseries, but we have other skills that contribute to our success:

  • Lisa is a marketing guru who worked in the talent booking industry for almost a decade, providing valuable insight into talent casting and talent agreements, as well as large scale live event organization,  and has built a small web of contacts to reach out to for advice.  She is also a talented photographer.
  • Shelby is an amazing makeup artist with an eye for design that makes her an excellent location scout, set designer, and director.
  • Red, the star of the show, has headed a band for years, giving her experience in commanding attention and keeping people entertained.  She has a clear idea of what she wants this show to be, and how to achieve that goal
  • The team is fun and dynamic, with the respect for each other required to work in close quarters to develop a project of this magnitude.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support is so valuable to this project!  If you can't donate money, please donate time!

  • Like us on social media:
    • www.facebook.com/romancinonthered
    • www.instagram.com/romancinred
    • www.twitter.com/romancinred
  • Share our social media posts in your feeds
  • Share our indiegogo campaign
  • If you are a clothing, jewelry, or accessory designer, email us at info@debutanteproductions.com or message us via social media to donate items to be used in the show
  • Subscribe to our youtube channel, and watch Romancin' On The Red when it debuts!

And that's all there is to it.
